Triple H & Stephanie McMahon-Helmsley take on Trish Stratus & Kurt Angle. Plus, The Rock & Chris Jericho team up for action, William Regal faces Test, and more.

Mr. McMahon officiates the contract signing between "Stone Cold" Steve Austin and Triple H for their match at No Way Out with the stipulation that neither man will engage in a physical act of aggression with each other. The Rock competes in a Fatal 4-Way Match for an opportunity at Kurt Angle's WWE Championship, The Undertaker faces Haku, and more.

Mr. McMahon orders "Stone Cold" Steve Austin and Triple H to team up to compete against The Rock and WWE Champion Kurt Angle in the main event. Plus, Trish Stratus' romantic relationship causes issues for Stephanie McMahon-Helmsley, Edge & Christian battle Kaientai, and more.

Mr. McMahon plans a special Valentine's Day present for his wife. The Rock faces Rikishi in the main event with a very unique stipulation regarding "Stone Cold" Steve Austin and Triple H's match at No Way Out. Plus, Chris Jericho defends his Intercontinental Championship, The Undertaker and Kane are in action, and more.

Stephanie McMahon-Helmsley's jealousy towards Mr. McMahon's mistress leads her to call out Trish Stratus. But when the Billion Dollar Princess' invitation is answered by "Stone Cold" Steve Austin, Triple H finds himself struggling to maintain control. Plus, The Undertaker takes on D-Von Dudley and Christian in a Triple Threat match, and much more.

The road to WrestleMania X-Seven officially begins as "Stone Cold" Steve Austin makes his presence felt when The Rock faces off against Kurt Angle and Big Show in a Triple Threat Hardcore Championship main event. Trish Stratus learns the dirty truth about her relationship with Mr. McMahon. Plus, Right to Censor, Chris Jericho, and many more.

"Stone Cold" Steve Austin & WWE Champion The Rock take on Triple H & Kurt Angle in the main event, but the Road to WrestleMania X-Seven becomes personal for The Rattlesnake when Mr. McMahon reveals The Great One's new manager. Plus, The Chairman's takes his degradation of Trish Stratus to a despicable level.

When Commissioner William Regal orders The Rock to defend his WWE Championship against Kurt Angle in the main event, "Stone Cold" Steve Austin issues a warning to The People's Champion. After being confronted by The Undertaker on SmackDown, Triple H decides to show the Phenom how to play the game. Plus, The Hardy Boyz, Eddie Guerrero, and more.

While preparing to team up with Intercontinental Champion Chris Jericho for a 3-on-2 Handicap Tag Team main event, WWE Champion The Rock readies to get some payback on his WrestleMania X-Seven opponent, "Stone Cold" Steve Austin. Shane McMahon addresses his father's recent actions and challenges him to a match on the Grandest Stage of Them All.

Witness one of the most epic events in sports entertainment history as WWE owner Vince McMahon announces that he's purchased WCW in this historic simulcast. The Brothers of Destruction face The Rock and "Stone Cold" Steve Austin. Mick Foley has a special message for Mr. McMahon. Edge, Christian, and Kurt Angle compete in Six-Man Tag Team action.

"Stone Cold" Steve Austin kicks off his reign as WWE Champion with a new attitude and with Mr. McMahon by his side. However, not everyone is content with this new alliance as The Rock challenges The Rattlesnake to a rematch inside a Steel Cage. Plus, Stephanie McMahon battles Trish Stratus, Triple H shows the world where he stands, and more.

CEO Linda McMahon drops a bombshell on her husband. Triple H & Stephanie McMahon-Helmsley team up with WWE Champion "Stone Cold" Steve Austin to take on The Hardy Boyz and Lita. Plus, Jim Ross is treated to some insult to go with his recent injury, The Undertaker goes one-on-one with Big Show, and much more.

Matt Hardy gets a measure of payback when he targets WWE Champion "Stone Cold" Steve Austin. However, his vengeance is bittersweet as Jeff Hardy is forced to defend his newly-won Intercontinental Championship against Triple H in the main event. Plus, Edge and Christian defend their Tag Team Championships against The Holly Cousins and more.

"Stone Cold" Steve Austin and Intercontinental Champion Triple H team with Edge & Christian to face The Brothers of Destruction and The Hardy Boyz in an Eight-Man Tag Team main event. Plus, Shane McMahon makes his presence felt when Big Show takes on Test, Spike Dudley battles Rhyno for the Hardcore Championship, and much more.

CEO Linda McMahon orders "Stone Cold" Steve Austin to defend his WWE Championship against The Undertaker in the main event. While The Rattlesnake prepares for this dangerous task, Intercontinental Champion Triple H goes one-on-one with Test. Plus, Chris Jericho challenges Rhyno for the Hardcore Championship, Kurt Angle loses his medals, and more.

When Rikishi decides to no longer be a pawn in Mr. McMahon twisted game of power, he finds himself going one-on-one with WWE Champion "Stone Cold" Steve Austin in the main event. Chris Jericho takes his rivalry with Commissioner William Regal inside a steel cage. Plus, The Dudley Boyz take on X-Factor in a Tables Match and much more action.

WWE Champion "Stone Cold" Steve Austin and Intercontinental Champion Triple H challenge Kane & The Undertaker to a Chain Match in the main event, and things get personal after The Game and The Rattlesnake orchestrate a plot to get rid of the Phenom. Plus, Kurt Angle goes one-on-one with Rikishi, Edge & Christian in tag team action, and much more.

As Mr. McMahon's incomparable duo of "Stone Cold" Steve Austin and Triple H reach the pinnacle of success by holding the WWE, Intercontinental, and Tag Team Championships simultaneously, Chris Jericho challenges both men to a Tag Team main event. Plus, Shane McMahon disrupts a special ceremony for Kurt Angle, Big Show in action, and more.

Chris Jericho issues a challenge to "Stone Cold" Steve Austin for his WWE Championship, however, Y2J learns that you can't always get what you want when Mr. McMahon intervenes with plans of his own. The Dudley Boyz face off against The Holly Cousins. Justin Credible & X-Pac face The Hardy Boyz, Big Show defends his Hardcore Championship, and more.

"Stone Cold" Steve Austin defends his WWE Championship against Chris Jericho in the main event. Things take a dangerous turn when The Undertaker searches for whoever has been stalking his wife. Plus, several superstars compete in 2001 King of the Ring Qualifying Matches, Shane McMahon and his WCW renegades make their presence felt, and more.

Kurt Angle battles another submission specialist inside a steel cage. Chris Jericho takes on both Rhyno and Big Show in a Triple Threat Match. Plus, the Qualifying Matches for the 2001 King of the Ring Tournament continue, The Hardy Boyz are in action, and more.

The Undertaker's wife's stalker is revealed. WWE Champion "Stone Cold" Steve Austin's bullying of Spike Dudley and Molly Holly leads to The Rattlesnake competing in a Six-Man Tag Team main event. Plus, King of the Ring Qualifying Matches continue and much more.

Shane McMahon and his WCW renegades look to leave another lasting impression on Mr. McMahon. "Stone Cold" Steve Austin and Kurt Angle seek revenge on Booker T. As Edge prepares for coronation as the 2001 King of the Ring, another former winner makes his presence felt. Plus, The Dudley Boyz take on The Brothers of Destruction and more.

While Mr. McMahon tries to rally his WWE troops, problems between Kurt Angle and WWE Champion "Stone Cold" Steve Austin escalate. Booker T defends his WCW Championship against Buff Bagwell in the first WCW main event on Raw. Plus, Diamond Dallas Page causes problems for The Undertaker, Lita & Matt Hardy take on Big Show & Trish Stratus, and more.

WWE's war with WCW is taken to the extreme after ECW gets involved. While WWE Champion "Stone Cold" Steve Austin campaigns to lead Team WWE at Invasion, The Rattlesnake convinces Kurt Angle to challenge Booker T for his WCW Championship. Plus, The Undertaker battles Diamond Dallas Page in a Street Fight, Chris Jericho in action, and more.

Team WWE has their back against the wall in the fight against the ECW and WCW invaders. Will anyone be able to get through to a despondent "Stone Cold" Steve Austin before it's too late? The Dudley Boyz deliver a painful message to their brother Spike. Booker T defends the WCW Championship against Chris Jericho and much more.

After betraying WWE at Invasion to become the leader of The Alliance, WWE Champion "Stone Cold" Steve Austin addresses his stunning change in direction. Kurt Angle teams with Edge & Christian to take on The Dudley Boyz and WCW and United States Champion Booker T, Diamond Dallas Page puts The Undertaker's wife in harm's way, and more.

When Mr. McMahon welcomes back The Rock to lead WWE, Shane and Stephanie McMahon try to enlist The Great One to join their cause. After bring the WCW Championship to WWE, Kurt Angle is forced to defend his gold in a No Disqualification Match against Booker T while WWE Champion "Stone Cold" Steve Austin continues to use guerrilla tactics to assist.

WCW Owner Shane McMahon goes one-on-one with The Rock in a Street Fight main event. ECW Owner Stephanie McMahon gets more than she bargained for from Chris Jericho. Lita shares some candid remarks regarding WWE Champion "Stone Cold" Steve Austin as he takes on Matt Hardy. Kane battles Rob Van Dam for the Hardcore Championship and more.

WWE Champion "Stone Cold" Steve Austin looks to whip The Alliance into shape. The Rock & Chris Jericho team to take on Rhyno & WCW Champion Booker T. Plus, The Brothers of Destruction defend their WCW Tag Team Championship against Chuck Palumbo & Sean O'Haire in a steel cage, Kurt Angle battles Rob Van Dam for the Hardcore Championship, and more.

The WWE Universe celebrates 'Stone Cold' Steve Austin Appreciation Night as The Alliance battle WWE Superstars in an all out war. Plus The Rock faces Lance Storm, Christian collides with Matt Hardy, a six-diva tag match featuring Lita, Jacqueline, Molly Holly, and much more.

Kurt Angle & Chris Jericho challenge WWE Champion "Stone Cold" Steve Austin to a Tag Team Match in the main event, but when an "injury" from Y2J on SmackDown renders The Rattlesnake unable to compete, he enlists Raven and Hardcore Champion Rob Van Dam to take his place. Plus, The Rock defends his WCW Championship against Rhyno and more.

As a result of throwing Kurt Angle's most prized possessions in the Detroit River on SmackDown, WWE Champion "Stone Cold" Steve Austin finds himself in a dangerous situation. Christian looks to bring the WCW Championship back to The Alliance when he challenges The Rock for the gold. Plus, The Undertaker battles Test and more.

Despite being humiliated by Kurt Angle last week, WWE Champion "Stone Cold" Steve Austin shows the measure of his resolve as he tries to rally his Alliance, beginning with Rob Van Dam defending his Hardcore Championship against Kurt Angle. In the main event, Test & Stephanie McMahon-Helmsley take on WCW Champion The Rock and more.

In the wake of September 11th, WWE embraces American patriotism as Kurt Angle & Chris Jericho team up to take on Hardcore Champion Rob Van Dam & WWE Champion "Stone Cold" Steve Austin. Stephanie McMahon-Helmsley & Test unite to battle WCW Champion The Rock. Plus, Booker T in action and more.

With "Stone Cold" Steve Austin losing the WWE Championship to Kurt Angle, The Alliance looks to regroup. Booker T is charged with recapturing the WWE Championship from the Olympic Gold Medalist while Rob Van Dam challenges The Rock for the WCW Championship. Plus Bradshaw & The Brothers of Destruction face The Dudley Boyz & Test and more.

Shane McMahon forces WCW Champion The Rock to take on The Dudley Boyz in a Tables Match while he sets his sights Kurt Angle's WWE Championship. Plus, Chris Jericho teams with The Brothers of Destruction to face Hardcore Champion Rob Van Dam and WCW Tag Team Champions Test & Booker T, Edge gives X-Pac & Christian a wakeup call, and much more.

"Stone Cold" Steve Austin returns to reclaim the WWE Championship from Kurt Angle. Dissension brews within WWE when Chris Jericho teams with WCW Champion The Rock to take on Shane McMahon & Hardcore Champion Rob Van Dam. Plus, Rhyno defends his WCW United States Championship against Edge and more.

With "Stone Cold" Steve Austin set to defend his WWE Championship against Kurt Angle and Rob Van Dam in a Triple Threat match at No Mercy, Austin tries to combat this new threat by encouraging RVD to go after The Rock's WCW Championship. Plus, The Rattlesnake & Booker T face The Undertaker & Kurt Angle, Edge battles X-Pac, and more.

WWE CEO Linda McMahon proposes a Winner Take All Match between The Alliance and WWE at Survivor Series. Despite Chris Jericho defeating The Rock at No Mercy for WCW Championship, Y2J & The Great One team up to challenge The Dudley Boyz for the WWE Tag Team Championship. Plus, Kurt Angle goes after the WCW United States Championship and more.

Mr. McMahon announces that there will be a defector from The Alliance joining WWE. While WWE Champion "Stone Cold" Steve Austin scramble to discover the identity of the mole from within, The Chairman gears up to go one-on-one with Shane McMahon in a Street Fight. Plus, Kurt Angle faces a difficult decision, Edge battles Rob Van Dam, and more.

Mr. McMahon creates dissension within the ranks of The Alliance by announcing that WWE Champion "Stone Cold" Steve Austin will defect to WWE. While The Rattlesnake suffers a backlash from his troops, problems persist within The Chairman's camp as The Rock battles Chris Jericho for the WCW Championship. Plus, Rob Van Dam faces Booker T and more.

WCW Champion The Rock and WWE Champion "Stone Cold" Steve Austin go face-to-face. Commissioner Mick Foley makes a groundbreaking announcement regarding the convoluted title picture. Plus, Kurt Angle defends the WCW United States Championship against Edge, William Regal looks to bring the WCW Championship back to The Alliance, and more.

Following Team WWE's victory at Survivor Series, The Alliance and their sordid invasion is no more. Mr. McMahon creates a special club for those who are willing to do anything to save their jobs. A legend returns to change the nature of WWE. The Rock defends his World Championship against Kurt Angle, Rob Van Dam faces The Dudley Boyz, and more.

Mr. McMahon looks to humble "Stone Cold" Steve Austin by ordering him to join his "Kiss My Ass Club," but when things don't go according to The Chairman's plan, another unwilling candidate is forcefully inducted. Plus, Edge defends his Intercontinental Championship against Test, Kurt Angle & Chris Jericho take on Kane & The Rock, and more.

Before the tournament to crown the first Undisputed WWE Champion at Vengeance, Ric Flair gives Chris Jericho an opportunity to face "Stone Cold" Steve Austin. Women's Champion Trish Stratus & World Champion The Rock take on Kurt Angle & Mr. McMahon. Plus, Rob Van Dam defends his Hardcore Championship against European Champion Christian and more.

Chris Jericho defends his newly-won Undisputed WWE Championship against "Stone Cold" Steve Austin in a steel cage. Mr. McMahon enlists Booker T disrupt Ric Flair's plans. Plus, The Rock & Women's Champion Trish Stratus take on The Dudley Boyz for the Tag Team Championships, The Undertaker in action, and more.

Chris Jericho defends his Undisputed WWE Championship against Rob Van Dam with WWE Co-Owner Ric Flair serving as special referee. Booker T finds himself on the run from "Stone Cold" Steve Austin. Plus, The Rock goes one-on-one with Lance Storm, The Undertaker defends his Hardcore Championship against Jeff Hardy, and much more action.

On a special Christmas Eve edition of Monday Night Raw, Chris Jericho defends his Undisputed WWE Championship against both Kurt Angle and The Rock in a No Disqualification Triple Threat Match. WWE Co-Owners Mr. McMahon and Ric Flair celebrate the holiday season with separate parties, and "Stone Cold" Steve Austin makes an appearance at both events.

Relive some of the Top 10 most exciting and unforgettable matches from 2001. From "Stone Cold" Steve Austin battling The Rock for the WWE Championship at WrestleMania X-Seven, to The Dudley Boyz defending the Tag Team Championship against both The Hardy Boyz and Edge & Christian, some of most action-packed moments from the past year are featured.

Triple H returns and declares his intentions to win the 2002 Royal Rumble Match. While the rivalry between Mr. McMahon and Ric Flair continues to escalate, The Chairman decides to see exactly what The Nature Boy is made of. Plus, "Stone Cold" Steve Austin & The Rock team up to take on the Big Boss Man & Booker T, Rob Van Dam battles Test, and more.

Triple H's plans to not compete until the 2002 Royal Rumble Match earn him some negative attention from "Stone Cold" Steve Austin and The Undertaker. When Bradshaw takes exception to WWE Undisputed Champion Chris Jericho's disparaging comments about Texas, Y2J finds himself teaming with Christian & Lance Storm to take on the APA & Rikishi.

Just 24 hours after winning the 2002 Royal Rumble Match, Triple H begins his road to WrestleMania by teaming with The Rock to take on Kurt Angle and WWE Undisputed Champion Chris Jericho. Despite suffering a defeat at the hands of Ric Flair, Mr. McMahon makes a cryptic promise to do something that even he will regret. Plus, more action.

With Mr. McMahon's plans of bringing in the New World Order to kill his own company causing a stir within the locker room, WWE Co-Owner Ric Flair tries to dissuade The Chairman from this drastic action by reminding him of WWE's enduring legacy. Triple H's road to WrestleMania runs into a one-on-one match against Booker T, and more.

Following Co-Owner Ric Flair's refusal to sell his half of WWE back to Mr. McMahon on SmackDown, The Chairman reveals when he will inject the New World Order into his company. In effort to save her marriage, Stephanie McMahon-Helmsley makes a special announcement. Plus, "Stone Cold" Steve Austin & The Rock face The Undertaker & Chris Jericho.

As Triple H and Stephanie McMahon-Helmsley look to renew their wedding vows, a shocking revelation threatens to bring the wedding bells crashing down. With an opportunity to take the WWE Undisputed Championship from Chris Jericho at No Way Out approaching, "Stone Cold" Steve Austin must turn his attention to The Undertaker. Plus, Tazz and more.

"Stone Cold" Steve Austin issues a special challenge to the NWO. The Hardy Boyz battle Lance Storm & Christian. Mr. Perfect faces Kane. Hollywood Hogan confronts The Rock. Goldust & William Regal take on Rob Van Dam & Edge. Kurt Angle battles Triple H to determine who faces Chris Jericho for the Undisputed Championship at WrestleMania.

The New World Order continues their reign of terror by turning their attention to "Stone Cold" Steve Austin as Scott Hall issues a challenge to the Texas Rattlesnake before he battles Mr. Perfect. As Triple H sets his sights on taking the WWE Undisputed Championship at WrestleMania, Kurt Angle looks for a golden opportunity of his own.

Triple H faces Kurt Angle in a steel cage. In order to force Ric Flair into accepting his challenge to a match at WrestleMania, The Undertaker sets his sights on "The Nature Boy"'s flesh and blood. Plus, the NWO looks to finish the job they started on "Stone Cold" Steve Austin, Rob Van Dam takes on Lance Storm, and much more action.

The NWO battles The Rock & "Stone Cold" Steve Austin 3-on-2 Handicap Match. The rivalry between Triple H and WWE Undisputed Champion Chris Jericho gets personal when The Game's pride and joy is put in harm's way. Plus, Mr. McMahon calls an emergency Board Meeting to discuss the state of WWE, Lita & Trish Stratus face Stacy Keibler & Jazz, and more.

CEO Linda McMahon makes an historic announcement that will reshape the landscape of WWE for years to come with a Brand Extension that will see Mr. McMahon taking control of SmackDown while Ric Flair oversees Monday Night Raw. As the WWE Universe readies for the first ever WWE Draft, nothing will prepare them for the arrival of Brock Lesnar.

History is made as the first ever WWE Draft pits SmackDown General Manager Mr.McMahon against RAW General Manager Ric Flair in a battle over the superstars that will belong to their brands. From The Rock and Hulk Hogan to the Undertaker and Rob Van Dam, the destination of WWE's top superstars will be decided in the birth of the WWE Brand Extension.

Following the first WWE Draft, a new era begins on Monday Night Raw as Co-Owner Ric Flair takes the helm of WWE's flagship show. While "The Nature Boy" looks to sign "Stone Cold" Steve Austin exclusively to his brand, Mr. McMahon arrives with his own agenda. WWE Undisputed Champion Triple H receives a new title and a new challenge and more.

With Mr. McMahon disrupting WWE Co-Owner Ric Flair's plans to name an opponent for the WWE Undisputed Championship at Backlash, "The Nature Boy" gives both "Stone Cold" Steve Austin and The Undertaker an opportunity to become the No. 1 Contender. In the wake of Brock Lesnar's trail of carnage, Paul Heyman explains his association with the Next Big Thing.

The Undertaker teams with the NWO's Scott Hall & X-Pac to take on Bradshaw & "Stone Cold" Steve Austin in a Handicap main event. The Hardy Boyz face Booker T & Goldust. Paul Heyman springs a trap on Brock Lesnar's next victim. Plus, Molly Holly faces Trish Stratus to determine the No. 1 Contender for the Women's Championship and more.

"Stone Cold" Steve Austin looks for payback on the NWO. Triple H looks for revenge of his own as he targets The Undertaker. Plus, Brock Lesnar's path of destruction continues as he goes one-on-one with Matt Hardy, Goldust & Booker T battle Bubba Ray & Spike Dudley, and much more.

With Big Show aligned with the NWO after turning on "Stone Cold" Steve Austin, Co-Owner Ric Flair again tries to set things acting as referee when the Rattlesnake & Bradshaw take on Scott Hall & X-Pac. As WWE Undisputed Champion Hulk Hogan faces William Regal Eddie Guerrero defends the Intercontinental Championship against Jeff Hardy and more.

The NWO promises to reveal a shocking surprise that will change the very nature of Raw. The Undertaker's pursuit for the WWE Undisputed Championship ends up costing him another prized possession when Hulk Hogan goes for a little ride. Goldust follows Booker T to an unusual location. Plus, Brock Lesnar, William Regal, and many more in action.

Ric Flair challenges Hulk Hogan for the WWE Undisputed Championship in a No Disqualification match. But when "Stone Cold" Steve Austin disrupts his opportunity, "The Nature Boy" forces the Rattlesnake to compete in a Lumberjack match against the newest member of the NWO. Plus, Brock Lesnar battles the Hardy Boyz in a Handicap match and more.

Rob Van Dam challenges WWE Undisputed Champion The Undertaker for the gold. After being put out-of-action on the orders of WWE Co-Owner Ric Flair, "Stone Cold" Steve Austin runs into trouble at local bar. Plus, Kevin Nash returns to take command of the NWO, Brock Lesnar looks to invade Dudleyville, and much more.

Eddie Guerrero defends his Intercontinental Championship against Rob Van Dam in a Ladder match. Bubba Ray Dudley gets a chance at payback as he take on Brock Lesnar. Plus, the NWO's X-Pac & Booker T face the Hardy Boyz, Tommy Dreamer shows WWE Undisputed Champion The Undertaker what lengths he is willing to go to, and much more.

"Stone Cold" Steve Austin faces Ric Flair. Brock Lesnar teams with Eddie Guerrero to take on Bubba Ray Dudley & Intercontinental Champion Rob Van Dam. Kevin Nash breaks a lot of hearts when introduces the newest addition to the NWO. Plus, the King of the Ring Qualifying matches, Tommy Dreamer faces WWE Undisputed Champion The Undertaker, and more.

Ric Flair receives an unexpected challenge from Mr. McMahon to face off in a No Holds Barred Match for sole ownership of WWE. Brock Lesnar battles Bubba Ray Dudley in a King of the Ring Qualification Match. Plus, Shawn Michaels gives the boot to a member of the NWO, the Hardy Boyz confront WWE Undisputed Champion The Undertaker, and more.

Mr. McMahon breaks his silence about "Stone Cold" Steve Austin leaving WWE, and has his world rocked with the return of another iconic superstar. Plus, Brock Lesnar takes on Booker T in a King of the Ring Quarterfinal Match main event, Matt Hardy faces WWE Undisputed Champion The Undertaker, and much more.

Mr. McMahon challenges the Raw Superstars to prove they have ruthless aggression. Intercontinental Champion Rob Van Dam battles the 2002 King of the Ring Brock Lesnar in the main event. Plus, Booker T & Goldust target the NWO by taking on X-Pac and the Big Show, Jeff Hardy faces WWE Undisputed Champion The Undertaker, and more.

As Paul Heyman continues to unleash Brock Lesnar on the WWE, Ric Flair looks to stop The Next Big Thing's path of destruction. Dissent is brewing within the New World Order but Shawn Michaels reveals he has a solution. In an epic main event, Jeff Hardy challenges Undertaker for the Undisputed WWE Championship in a Ladder Match. Plus, Rob Van Dam and more.

The NWO sends a message to an old friend before teaming with a couple of radical superstars to take on Booker T, Goldust, Rob Van Dam, Bubby Ray & Spike Dudley in a 10-Man Tag Team main event. Brock Lesnar and Paul Heyman receive a warm homecoming from some ECW Alumni. Jeff Hardy challenges William Regal for the European Championship and more.

Mr. McMahon drops a bombshell on the WWE Universe when he introduces a former rival as the new General Manager of Raw. Brock Lesnar teams with WWE Undisputed Champion The Undertaker to take on Ric Flair & Rob Van Dam. Booker T battles Big Show. Plus, a Six-Man Tag Team Elimination match, Trish Stratus in action, and much more.

Raw General Manager Eric Bischoff introduces Triple H to the brand with Shawn Michaels as his manager. But when The Heartbreak Kid takes exception to his new boss, The Game sets things right. Brock Lesnar makes a shocking business decision. Rob Van Dam meets Jeff Hardy in a Ladder match to unify the European and Intercontinental Championships.

Raw General Manager Eric Bischoff introduces some new additions to his brand. After his recent betrayal at the hands of Triple H, Shawn Michaels goes on a hunt for some retribution on The Game. Plus, Ric Flair goes one-on-one with WWE Undisputed Champion The Rock, Fabulous Moolah is given three minutes to plug her new autobiography, and much more.

As Triple H searches for the unknown assailant responsible for viciously assaulting Shawn Michaels, the details behind this sordid attack come to light when Raw General Manager Eric Bischoff sets up a meeting via satellite between The Game and the Heartbreak Kid. Rob Van Dam takes on Chris Jericho. Plus, 3-Minute Warning, Tommy Dreamer, and more.

The Rock teams with the Undertaker, Goldust & Booker T to face Triple H & The Un-Americans in the main event. Chris Jericho & The Big Show battle Ric Flair & Bubba Ray Dudley. Matt Hardy makes his presence felt during a match between his brother Jeff and Rob Van Dam. Plus, Brock Lesnar, Tommy Dreamer, and more in action.

Triple H goes one-on-one with WWE Undisputed Champion The Rock in a No Disqualification main event. Shawn Michaels decides to show The Game that he is more than ready for a fight. Plus, The Undertaker teams with Booker T & Goldust to take on The Un-Americans in a Six-Man Tag Team Match, Chris Jericho targets Ric Flair, and more.

Brock Lesnar returns to Raw while Triple H and The Undertaker battle in the main event for a chance to become the No. 1 Contender for his title. However, SmackDown GM Stephanie McMahon shows up with announcement that will change the complexion of the Brand Extension. Plus, Rob Van Dam, Jeff Hardy, and much more.

In retaliation for Stephanie McMahon making Brock Lesnar and his Undisputed Championship exclusive to the SmackDown brand, Raw General Manager Eric Bischoff makes history by revealing a new Heavyweight Championship exclusive to the red brand. Kane faces Lance Storm & Christian in a Handicap Match. Plus, Triple H, Booker T, Rob Van Dam, and more.

Intercontinental Champion Rob Van Dam battles Chris Jericho, the Big Show, and Jeff Hardy in a Fatal 4-Way Elimination main event to determine the No. 1 Contender for the World Championship. Plus, Kane and Bradshaw take on the Un-Americans, Bubba Ray Dudley in action, and more.

As Rob Van Dam prepares to challenge Triple H for his World Heavyweight Championship at Unforgiven, "Mr. Monday Night" must first defend his Intercontinental Championship against Chris Jericho while The Game puts his gold on the line against Jeff Hardy. Plus, Kane goes one-on-one with William Regal, Rico makes his Raw debut, and much more.

After preventing Rob Van Dam from capturing the World Heavyweight Championship against Triple H at Unforgiven, Ric Flair's relationship with The Game begins to evolve as both men join forces to take on Bubba Ray Dudley and RVD. Raw General Manager Eric Bischoff looks to lay down the law. Randy Orton makes his Raw debut, and much more.

While Bubba Ray Dudley seizes an opportunity to challenge Triple H for his World Heavyweight Championship, Kane begins a journey of his own when he faces Chris Jericho for the Intercontinental Championship. Eric Bischoff looks to make an example out of Lita. Plus, Trish Stratus defends her Women's Championship against Victoria, and much more.

Raw General Manager Eric Bischoff introduces a concept where anything and everything can happen in a game of chance. The Superstars of Raw compete in a series of unique matches that can only be chosen by a game of Roulette. Plus, World Heavyweight Champion Triple H makes a shocking revelation about Kane's past.

World Heavyweight Champion Triple H battles Rob Van Dam in a Canadian Lumberjack Match. Intercontinental Champion Kane breaks his silence about The Game's shocking allegations. Plus, Booker T goes one-on-one with the Big Show in a Falls Count Anywhere Match, Molly Holly & Victoria face Jacqueline & Women's Champion Trish Stratus, and more.

While Kane prepares to challenge Triple H for his World Heavyweight Championship at No Mercy by competing against him in a Tag Team main event, The Game decides to rub salt in the Big Red Machine's wounds with a shocking display of humiliation that would become one of the most controversial moments in Raw history. Plus, Rob Van Dam and more.

Despite being defeating Kane at No Mercy, World Heavyweight Champion Triple H looks to put his rivalry with the Big Red Machine to rest when they meet in a Casket Match. However, The Game may be for some heartbreak when an old friend returns to settle a score. Eric Bischoff introduces a concept for a new structure to be unveiled at Survivor Series.

With his reign as World Heavyweight Champion being threatened by the first ever Elimination Chamber Match at the upcoming Survivor Series, Triple H seeks answers regarding Shawn Michaels' WWE future. Plus, The Game & Chris Jericho take on Booker T & Kane. Dave Batista makes his Raw debut, Rob Van Dam battles Christian, and much more.

As the very first Elimination Chamber Match for the World Heavyweight Championship approaches at Survivor Series, Shawn Michaels stakes his claim in the contest while Triple H faces Booker T in the main event. While her problems with Women's Champion Trish Stratus continue, Victoria takes out her aggression on Terri once again. Plus, Kane and more.

Shawn Michaels kicks off his reign as the new World Heavyweight Champion with three challengers to his title when Rob Van Dam battles Booker T and Chris Jericho in a Triple Threat Match to determine the No. 1 Contender for the gold. Scott Steiner speaks on the current state of WWE. Plus, Women's Champion Victoria, 3-Minute Warning, and many more.

Shawn Michaels defends his World Heavyweight Championship against Rob Van Dam. Trish Stratus looks to recapture the Women's Championship by challenging Victoria for the gold. Batista sets his sights on Kane in singles action. Plus, Jeff Hardy & The Hurricane take on Lance Storm & William Regal, Goldust battles Rico, and much more action.

The rivalry between Triple H and World Heavyweight Champion Shawn Michaels continues to escalate when the Heartbreak Kid serves as the Special Guest Referee for The Game's main event battle with Rob Van Dam to determine the new No. 1 Contender for Michaels' title. Batista faces The Hurricane. Plus, Trish Stratus in action and much more.

With Triple H set to challenge Shawn Michaels for the World Heavyweight Championship at Armageddon, Raw General Manager Eric Bischoff makes a special stipulation to their upcoming battle. Women's Champion Victoria teams with World Tag Team Champions Christian & Chris Jericho to take on Trish Stratus & The Dudley Boyz in the main event and more.

Shawn Michaels is called out by one of his most loyal followers. While Triple H celebrates his new championship reign, Scott Steiner arrives to let him know exactly why he signed with Raw. Plus, Chris Jericho goes one-on-one with Booker T, Kane & Rob Van Dam take on 3-Minute Warning, and much more.

In the midst of the holiday season, RAW General Manager Eric Bischoff looks to punish Jim Ross & Jerry "The King" Lawler by forcing them to team up in the main event against Lance Storm & William Regal. Triple H issues a unique challenge to Scott Steiner. Plus, Booker T & Goldust defend their World Tag Team Championship, Test in action, and more.

As 2002 comes to a close, join Jonathan Coachman and Terri as they highlight some of the year's most memorable matches and unforgettable moments in WWE. From The Rock facing Hollywood Hulk Hogan at WrestleMania X8 to the in-ring return of Shawn Michaels against Triple H at SummerSlam, relive the most exciting action from throughout the year.

Christian & Chris Jericho take on Kane & Rob Van Dam. Despite being defeated by Scott Steiner in an Arm Wrestling Match, World Heavyweight Champion Triple H issues another unique challenge to Big Poppa Pump. Plus, Booker T & Goldust defend their World Tag Team Championship against Lance Storm & William Regal, Test battles Chris Nowinski, and more.

Mr. McMahon returns to give General Manager Eric Bischoff the proper motivation to turn Raw completely around. World Heavyweight Champion Triple H meets Scott Steiner in another unique contest. The Superstars of Raw compete in a Battle Royal where the winner will get to choose his entrance number in the 2003 Royal Rumble Match. All this and more.

Raw General Manager Eric Bischoff drops a bombshell on the WWE Universe by inviting a former adversary to return at No Way Out. One of the most legendary factions in history is formed when Scott Steiner's challenge to a Royal Rumble rematch against World Heavyweight Champion Triple H is answered by an animal. Jeff Hardy faces Rob Van Dam and more!

On a night where World Heavyweight Champion Triple H and Batista take on Kane and Rob Van Dam in the main event, Scott Steiner learns that The Game doesn't come to a fight by himself. Plus, Booker T goes one-on-one with Jeff Hardy, Victoria defends her Women's Championship against Trish Stratus in a Chicago Street Fight, and much more.

Scott Steiner battles Chris Jericho in the main event for an opportunity at Triple H's World Heavyweight Championship. The Game gives his new faction a name that their enemies will come to fear. RAW General Manager Eric Bischoff leaves Chief Morely in charge while he travels through the great state of Texas in search of "Stone Cold" Steve Austin.

With time running out in his quest to sign "Stone Cold" Steve Austin to Monday Night RAW before No Way Out, Eric Bischoff is confronted by Mr. McMahon who gives his former adversary one final chance to keep his job as Raw General Manager. Evolution's Batista looks to make an example out of Tommy Dreamer. Chris Jericho faces Jeff Hardy and more.

As he awaits his confrontation with "Stone Cold" Steve Austin at No Way Out, Raw General Manager Eric Bischoff looks to warm up by competing in a No Holds Barred main event against The Rattlesnake's best friend, Jim Ross. Scott Steiner partners with Booker T to take on Evolution's Batista and World Heavyweight Champion Triple H. Plus, more action.

The Rock returns to Raw to compete in a 20-Man Battle Royal to determine who will challenge Triple H for his World Heavyweight Championship at WrestleMania XIX. Evolution's Randy Orton & Batista face Scott Steiner & Booker T. Plus, Jerry "The King' Lawler battles Chief Morely in a No Disqualification Match, Kane in action, and more.

"Stone Cold" Steve Austin's return to Raw is met with an unceremonious welcome from his longtime rival The Rock. Booker T comes face-to-face with World Heavyweight Champion Triple H. Plus, Kane & Rob Van Dam battle Al Snow & Tommy Dreamer in a Hardcore Tag Team Match, Chris Jericho goes one-on-one with Test, and much more.

Eric Bischoff looks to bury the hatchet with "Stone Cold" Steve Austin while The Rock challenges the Texas Rattlesnake to one more match at WrestleMania. Before World Heavyweight Champion Triple H takes on Maven, Booker T addresses The Game's recent comments. Plus, Trish Stratus battles Jazz for a chance at the Women's Championship and more.

Eric Bischoff challenges "Stone Cold" Steve Austin to a Lumberjack Match, but plans change when The Rock makes a suggestion that spells trouble for The Rattlesnake. World Heavyweight Champion Triple H finds himself in match against Booker T's most loyal friend, Goldust. Plus, Chris Jericho & Christian take on Test & Scott Steiner and more.

Booker T & Goldust take on Ric Flair and World Heavyweight Champion Triple H. With The Rock set to perform a special concert for the WWE Universe, Eric Bischoff bans "Stone Cold" Steve Austin from the building. Before their match on the grandest stage of them all, Chris Jericho pays a tribute to his childhood idol Shawn Michaels. All this and more.

When The Rock looks to celebrate his first WrestleMania victory over Stone Cold Steve Austin with a special Appreciation Night Ceremony for himself, The Great One is floored by the arrival an unexpected guest. After retaining his World Heavyweight Championship on the grandest stage of them all, Triple H faces The Hurricane.

While the WWE Universe still buzzes over Goldberg's groundbreaking arrival, The Rock is left with a challenge to face him at Backlash. After witnessing "Stone Cold" Steve Austin's recent firing at the hands of Eric Bischoff, Jim Ross decides to take his career in a different direction. Chris Jericho & Triple H face Shawn Michaels & Booker T.

Kevin Nash speaks out on his relationship with Shawn Michaels and World Heavyweight Champion Triple H. The Rock answers Goldberg's challenge. Plus, Kane & Rob Van Dam defend their World Tag Team Championship against Lance Storm & Chief Morely, Scott Steiner debates Chris Nowinski, and much more.

Shawn Michaels serves a special guest referee for a WrestleMania XIX rematch between Booker T and World Heavyweight Champion Triple H. As his match against Goldberg at Backlash approaches, The Rock shows the WWE Universe exactly what he thinks of his opponent in a special concert. Plus, Lita returns, The Hurricane faces Chris Jericho, and more.

Trish Stratus faces Eric Bischoff in a No Disqualification Match main event. Linda McMahon returns with some news regarding "Stone Cold" Steve Austin. Following his victory over The Rock, Goldberg is given a platform to address the WWE Universe when Chris Jericho unveils the debut edition of The Highlight Reel. Triple H targets Kevin Nash and more.

With Stone Cold Steve Austin being brought back to Monday Night RAW as the new Co-General Manager of the brand, The Rattlesnake looks to make some changes that reignite his rivalry with Eric Bischoff. World Heavyweight Champion Triple H makes his presence felt when Chris Jericho features Kevin Nash as his guest on new edition of The Highlight Reel.

Kevin Nash faces Chris Jericho in the main event. Goldberg gets his hands on Christian in a Steel Cage Match. While Rob Van Dam and Kane each stake their claim in the upcoming Battle Royal to crown a new Intercontinental Champion, they must first defend their Tag Team Championship against the Legion of Doom. All this and more.

"Stone Cold" Steve Austin makes some action-packed matches and begins an investigation into who tried to run down Goldberg. When Triple H is forced to defend his World Heavyweight Championship in the main event against a former champion of his own choosing, The Game unwisely selects a friend. Plus, The Dudley Boyz in action and much more.

Eric Bischoff orders Shawn Michaels and Ric Flair to team up against Triple in the main event. On an all new edition of The Highlight Reel, Chris Jericho issues a challenge to his featured guest, Goldberg. Plus, Booker T, Rob Van Dam, and many more in action.

Ric Flair, Randy Orton & World Heavyweight Champion Triple H take on Shawn Michaels, Kevin Nash & The Hurricane in a Six-Man Tag Team Match. When Chris Jericho runs in terror of Goldberg, Intercontinental Champion Christian takes over as host of The Highlight Reel with featured guest, The Rock. Plus, "Stone Cold" Steve Austin and more.

As Triple H prepares to defend his World Heavyweight Championship against Kevin Nash inside a Hell in a Cell at Bad Blood, RAW Co-General Manager Stone Cold Steve Austin introduces a Special Guest Referee to maintain order in a match that he is all too familiar with. Before he can get his hands on Chris Jericho, Goldberg warms up for his upcoming match by taking on Rosey. Plus, Randy Orton battles The Hurricane, Booker T meets Christian in the first ever 'Spin-A-Rooney' Contest, and much more!

On a night where Kane & Rob Van Dam look to regain the World Tag Team Championship in the main event, World Heavyweight Champion Triple H offers the Big Red Machine a chance to join Evolution. However, Raw Co-General Manager "Stone Cold" Steve Austin has another offer for The Game's newest prospect. Plus, Booker T, Goldberg, and more in action.

Kane puts his mask on the line against Triple H for The Game's World Heavyweight Championship. In blast from the past, Shawn Michaels & Kevin Nash team up to take on Evolution's Ric Flair & Randy Orton. Plus, Rodney Mack's "White Boy Challenge" is answered by Goldberg, Mick Foley is honored by his peers as a true Hardcore Legend, and much more.

Rob Van Dam looks for some retribution for his former tag team partner Kane by challenging Triple H for his World Heavyweight Championship in a No Disqualification Match. Gail Kim makes her WWE debut by competing in a Battle Royal for Jazz's Women's Championship. Plus, Christian defends his Intercontinental Championship against Booker T and more.

Raw Co-General Manager "Stone Cold" Steve Austin looks to call out Kane to try to motivate him in a less destructive direction. Ric Flair & Randy Orton battle Rob Van Dam & Bubba Ray Dudley. Plus, Booker T receives another opportunity at Christian's Intercontinental Championship, Shawn Michaels appears on an all-new Highlight Reel, and much more.

Things get heated when Jim Ross sits down for a one-on-one interview with Kane. Evolution takes a trip to Dudleyville as Ric Flair, Randy Orton, and World Heavyweight Champion Triple H battle Bubba Ray, D-Von, and Spike Dudley in a Six-Man Tag Team Match. Plus, Gail Kim defends her Women's Championship against Molly Holly, and more.

After witnessing the recent disturbances caused by Kane, Linda McMahon returns to set things in order with the Co-General Managers of Raw, Eric Bischoff and "Stone Cold" Steve Austin. But when the Big Red Monster faces Rob Van Dam in the main event, the CEO of WWE finds herself in dangerous situation. Goldberg returns to show The Game who's next.

Less than a week after giving CEO Linda McMahon a Tombstone heard around the world, Kane is forced to come face-to-face with another member of the McMahon family. With Goldberg set to challenge Triple H for his World Heavyweight Championship at SummerSlam, The Game sends a message to his upcoming opponent. Randy Orton appears on the Highlight Reel.

When Eric Bischoff refuses to give Shane McMahon a match against Kane, "Stone Cold" Steve Austin orders his fellow Co-General Manager of Raw to face Shane-O-Mac in a No Holds Barred Match. Goldberg faces Ric Flair. Plus, Rob Van Dam goes one-on-one with Chris Jericho, Trish Stratus challenges Molly Holly for her Women's Championship, and more.

As Goldberg goes one-on-one with Ric Flair in the main event, RAW Co-General Manager "Stone Cold" Steve Austin decrees that he will suspend Evolution members Randy Orton and World Heavyweight Champion Triple H if they interfere. Plus, Christian defends his Intercontinental Championship, The Hurricane in action, and more.

On a night where Shane McMahon resolves to take out Eric Bischoff before their match at SummerSlam, the Co-General Manager of Raw brings their rivalry to another level by paying CEO Linda McMahon an unannounced visit at her home. Goldberg gets his hands on another member Evolution when he goes one-on-one with Randy Orton in the main event and more.

Goldberg issues another challenge to Triple H for his World Heavyweight Championship. When Shane McMahon takes exception to his father's comments on The Highlight Reel, he finds himself facing Chris Jericho. Plus, Eric Bischoff names the Raw Employee of the Month, Randy Orton takes on Maven, and more.

After turning the heat up in his rivalry with Kane, Shane McMahon finds himself at the mercy of the Big Red Monster. In an action-packed Six-Man Tag Team main event, Goldberg teams with Shawn Michaels & Maven to take on Evolution's Ric Flair, Randy Orton, & World Heavyweight Champion Triple H. "Stone Cold" Steve Austin, Chris Jericho, and more.

"Stone Cold" Steve Austin gives a "State of Raw Address." Evolution gets the better of Goldberg when he is forced to compete in a Tag Team Match. In retribution for saving Shane McMahon, Rob Van Dam faces Kane inside a steel cage. Plus, a 10-Man Tag Team Match, Gail Kim teams with Women's Champion Molly Holly, and much more.

Shane McMahon and Kane sign the contract for their upcoming Last Man Standing Match. As his World Heavyweight Championship defense against Goldberg approaches, Triple H hosts a special celebration in honor of the career of his opponent. Plus, Rob Van Dam battles Chris Jericho, Jerry "The King" Lawler faces Al Snow, and more.

Goldberg begins his reign as World Heavyweight Champion by defending his title against Chris Jericho. Evolution takes on Maven, Garrison Cade & Mark Jindrak in a Six-Man Tag Team Match. Plus, Rob Van Dam challenges Christian for his Intercontinental Championship, Kane pays the recuperating Shane McMahon a visit, and more.

Despite "Stone Cold" Steve Austin being suspended by the WWE Board of Directors, his rivalry with his fellow Co-General Manager continues as Eric Bischoff takes control of Raw. While Triple H places a bounty on his head, World Heavyweight Champion Goldberg teams with Shawn Michaels to take on Evolution's Ric Flair & Randy Orton. All this and more.

With Triple H putting a bounty on Goldberg's head, The World's Strongest Man Mark Henry seizes an opportunity to cash in on the reward when battles the World Heavyweight Champion in the main event. After being assaulted in the hospital by Kane, Shane McMahon sends the Big Red Monster on the ride of his life. Plus, Rob Van Dam, Evolution, and more.

Shawn Michaels teams with World Heavyweight Champion Goldberg to take on Mark Henry and Evolution's Ric Flair & Randy Orton in a Handicap Match. When Chris Jericho tries to rally against the leadership "Stone Cold" Steve Austin, Shane McMahon teams with Booker T & The Dudley Boyz to battle Y2J and friends in an 8-Man Tag Team Tables Match.

Eric Bischoff makes a special proposal to "Stone Cold" Steve Austin. When Goldberg defends his World Heavyweight Championship against Shawn Michaels, a more evolved Superstar returns to cash in on Triple H's offered bounty. Plus, Kane sends a message to Shane McMahon, Lita & Trish Stratus team up to take on Victoria & Molly Holly, and much more.

With Goldberg being taken out by Batista on last week's edition of Monday Night RAW, Eric Bischoff looks to hand over the World Heavyweight Championship to Evolution. Rob Van Dam defends the Intercontinental Championship against Chris Jericho in a steel cage. Plus, Shane McMahon faces a mystery opponent in a No Disqualification Match and much more.

"Stone Cold" Steve Austin and fellow Co-General Manager Eric Bischoff meet to sign the contract for their teams to battle for control of Monday Night Raw at Survivor Series. Plus, Batista returns to the ring to take on Maven, Shawn Michaels goes one-on-one Mark Henry in the main event, and much more action.

As the battle for control of Raw approaches at Survivor Series, members of both Team Austin and Team Bischoff meet in a series of matches including Shawn Michaels taking on Randy Orton. Goldberg goes one-on-one with Batista in the main event. Shane McMahon confronts Kane at an unusual location. All this and more.

Following his team's victory over Team Austin at Survivor Series, Eric Bischoff assumes total control of Raw as the sole General Manager and grants each of his loyal Superstars some special favors. Despite retaining his World Heavyweight Championship against Triple H, Goldberg is forced to battle Evolution in a main event Handicap Match.

Eric Bischoff places his Superstars at the mercy of chance and circumstance when he reintroduces Raw Roulette. While this concept gives Triple H another chance at Goldberg's World Heavyweight Championship, Shawn Michaels finds himself less fortunate as he teams up with Chris Jericho to take on Batista & Ric Flair in the main event.

Eric Bischoff receives some stunning news from the newly hired Outside Consultant, Mick Foley. With Foley being given the power by Linda McMahon to make any change he wants, World Heavyweight Champion Goldberg receives a chance to get his hands on Evolution when he teams with Shawn Michaels & Rob Van Dam to face Kane, Randy Orton & Batista.

Mick Foley starts a petition to bring "Stone Cold" Steve Austin back to Raw. While struggling to maintain power on Raw, Eric Bischoff orders World Heavyweight Champion Goldberg to face Kane in a Lumberjack Match main event. Plus, Chris Jericho and Christian offer an apology to Lita and Trish Stratus, Batista battles Rob Van Dam, and more.

Evolution's World Heavyweight Champion Triple H and World Tag Team Champions Batista & Ric Flair take on Rob Van Dam & Shawn Michaels in the main event. Eric Bischoff unveils yet another plan to help him seize control of Raw by offering a proposal to his fellow Co-General Manager, Mick Foley. Plus, Rico battles Jon Heidenreich, and more.

Join Jerry "The King" Lawler and Jonathan Coachman as they review some of the Raw brand's most memorable matches and unforgettable moments from 2003. From Shawn Michaels' one-on-one battle against Chris Jericho at WrestleMania XIX, to Team Austin battling Team Bischoff at Survivor Series for complete control of RAW relive the best in Raw action.

The WWE Board of Directors convene for a special meeting to decide "Stone Cold" Steve Austin's fate. Shawn Michaels receives another chance at glory when he challenges Triple H for the World Heavyweight Championship. Plus, Randy Orton defends his Intercontinental Championship against Booker T, Rob Van Dam goes one-on-one Scott Steiner, and more.

In his role as the new Sheriff of Raw, "Stone Cold" Steve Austin lays down the law by ordering Triple H to defend the World Heavyweight Championship against Shawn Michaels at the Royal Rumble in a unique match. Plus, Ric Flair & Batista defend the World Tag Team Championship against The Dudley Boyz, and Rob Van Dam in action, and more.

Randy Orton extends an open invitation to Mick Foley to witness him defend the Intercontinental Championship against Rob Van Dam in the main event. Shawn Michaels and World Heavyweight Champion Triple H come face-to-face in an interview with Jonathan Coachman. After demanding some in-ring action, Matt Hardy goes one-on-one with Goldberg and more.

With Eric Bischoff away, Interim General Manager Jonathan Coachman announces that the Superstars of Raw will compete in a series of matches for a chance to participate in an Over The Top Rope Challenge where the winner will receive the Number 30 Spot in the 2004 Royal Rumble. Plus, Randy Orton, Mick Foley, "Stone Cold" Steve Austin, and more.

Shawn Michaels and World Heavyweight Champion Triple H are left stunned when Sheriff "Stone Cold" Steve Austin introduces a new player to their rivalry. Mick Foley confronts Randy Orton. Plus, Chris Jericho's overplays his position, Raw General Manager Eric Bischoff punishes Jonathan Coachman, and much more action.

Before facing Shawn Michaels in the main event, Intercontinental Champion Randy Orton looks to take out Mick Foley. When Chris Jericho welcomes Chris Benoit to The Highlight Reel, Y2J finds himself teaming with Christian to challenge Batista & Ric Flair for the World Tag Team Championships. Plus, Goldberg and more.

As World Heavyweight Champion Triple H prepares to sign the contract for his title defense at WrestleMania XX, an old friend shows up to break some hearts. With "Stone Cold" Steve Austin offering Goldberg a chance to get even with Brock Lesnar at No Way Out, SmackDown General Manager Paul Heyman comes to Monday Night Raw with a word of warning.

While Shawn Michaels looks to settle some unfinished business in the main event, Sheriff Stone Cold Steve Austin and General Manager Eric Bischoff try to decide who will challenge Triple H for the World Heavyweight Championship at WrestleMania XX. Intercontinental Champion Randy Orton looks end his rivalry with Mick Foley and more.

Mr. McMahon makes some groundbreaking announcements for WrestleMania XX including naming "Stone Cold" Steve Austin the special referee for the match between Brock Lesnar and Goldberg. But first, the Rattlesnake must prove his officiating capabilities when The Chairman takes on Eric Bischoff in the main event. Plus, Batista and more in action.

Triple H looks to eliminate the two threats to his World Heavyweight Championship by having them face off with Batista and Intercontinental Champion Randy Orton in tag team action. But while Evolution tries to maintain their dominance, Mick Foley looks to rock their world by enlisting the help of an old friend. Plus, Rob Van Dam and more in action.

Triple H delivers a message to both challengers for his World Heavyweight Championship. Following their unforgettable reunion, The Rock 'n' Sock Connection returns to Raw for a face-to-face confrontation with Evolution. Plus, Kane is confronted by his fate, an 8-Man Tag Team Match, and more.

Mr. McMahon makes a special announcement. In retaliation for losing the World Heavyweight Championship, Triple H goes on a quest for vengeance by having Batista, Ric Flair & Randy Orton battle two enemies of Evolution in a Handicap Match. Plus, Rob Van Dam and Booker T defend the World Tag Team Championship against The Dudley Boyz and more.

The landscape of WWE is drastically altered when SmackDown General Manager Paul Heyman and Raw General Manager Eric Bischoff randomly select Superstar additions to their prospective brands in the first ever WWE Draft Lottery. Mr. McMahon has Eddie Guerrero defend the WWE Championship. Plus, Evolution, Chris Jericho, and many more in action.

Triple H receives a challenge from one of Raw's newest additions, Shelton Benjamin. In an effort to discover the reasons behind her controversial actions at WrestleMania, Chris Jericho confronts Trish Stratus on an all new edition of The Highlight Reel. Plus, Tajiri battles Kane, Mick Foley issues a special challenge to Randy Orton, and much more.

When Shelton Benjamin challenges Triple H to a rematch from the previous edition of Monday Night RAW in effort to prove that his victory wasn't a fluke, Evolution responds by stacking the odds in The Game's favor. The Women of WWE compete in a Battle Royal to determine the No. 1 Contender for the Women's Championship. Plus, Kane and much more.

Shelton Benjamin partners with Shawn Michaels and others to take on Evolution's Triple H, Batista, Randy Orton & Ric Flair in an Eight-Man Tag Team Match. Edge responds to some disheartening news from Raw General Manager Eric Bischoff's apprentice, Johnny Nitro. Plus, Lita joins Chris Jericho on The Highlight Reel, Tajiri faces Al Snow, and more.

Shawn Michaels seizes an opportunity to put him back in the hunt for the World Heavyweight Championship. Edge picks a fight with Randy Orton that leads him into a Tag Team main event against Evolution's Ric Flair & Batista. Kane makes a statement to Lita. Plus, Victoria defends the Women's Championship against Molly Holly and more.

Triple H goes one-on-one with Tajiri. Shelton Benjamin takes exception to Randy Orton disrespecting another legend. Before Matt Hardy can battle Kane in retaliation for his recent assault, the Big Red Monster takes matters in his own hands. Plus, Evolution's Ric Flair & Batista go after the World Tag Team Championship and more.

Triple H, Batista & Randy Orton take on Shelton Benjamin, Tajiri & Edge in a Six-Man Tag Team Match. During an all new Highlight Reel, things take a dire turn for Matt Hardy after Kane reveals that he has stolen something precious to him. Plus, Shawn Michaels goes after the World Heavyweight Championship in the main event, and much more.

Chris Jericho faces Christian in a Steel Cage Match. When Shawn Michaels makes his presence felt during Triple H's match with Shelton Benjamin, Raw General Manager Eric Bischoff decides to punish The Heartbreak Kid. While Matt Hardy prepares for action, Kane informs Lita that time is running out. Plus, Tajiri takes on Batista and much more.

Batista & Randy Orton look to bring home the gold to Evolution by going after the World Tag Team Championship. Weeks of being tormented by Kane come to a head when Lita is faced with an ultimatum. Eugene has his world rocked by the return of a new friend. All this and much more.

Shawn Michaels' ongoing rivalry with Triple H rages on as Raw General Manager Eric Bischoff reinstates The Heartbreak Kid. When things break down on The Highlight Reel, Chris Jericho finds himself teaming with Shelton Benjamin to take on Evolution's Batista & Intercontinental Champion Randy Orton. Plus, Edge faces Ric Flair and much more.

Triple H sends a message to Shawn Michaels. After The Coach lures Eugene into an attack by Kane, RAW General Manager Eric Bischoff decides to make an example out of his nephew by having him go one-on-one the Big Red Machine. Plus, Shelton Benjamin takes on Randy Orton, Matt Hardy battles Garrison Cade, and much more.

Triple H orders Evolution to divide and conquer their enemies as Batista faces Shelton Benjamin in singles action before Intercontinental Champion Randy Orton goes one-on-one with The Heartbreak Kid in the main event. Eugene tries to prove himself when he takes on Eric Bischoff's apprentice, Johnny Nitro. Plus, Lita battles Gail Kim, and more.

Shawn Michaels and Triple H come face-to-face once again as Jim Ross tries to get both men to put their rivalry to rest. On a new edition of The Highlight Reel, Eugene is given a chance to meet his hero. Lita's life is forever changed after receiving some troubling news. Plus, Evolution's Ric Flair, Batista, and Randy Orton and more.

Eugene receives the opportunity of lifetime when he competes in the main event against his hero, Triple H. The future clashes with the past when The Rock and Intercontinental Champion Randy Orton come face-to-face. Matt Hardy's joy over Lita's pregnancy turns to grief after Kane makes a shocking revelation. Edge & Chris Jericho face Evolution.

After taking exception to Triple H dubiously making Eugene an honorary member of Evolution, William Regal finds himself taking on The Game in singles action with a very special guest referee. Before Kane goes after the World Heavyweight Championship in the main event, Jim Ross conducts a one-on-one interview with the Big Red Monster.

When Eugene takes control of Raw, Triple H seizes the opportunity to manipulate the new Interim-General Manager into stacking the odds in Evolution's favor. Randy Orton defends his Intercontinental Championship against Chris Jericho. Molly Holly faces Victoria and Nidia to determine the No. 1 Contender for the Women's Championship.

Eugene is given a chance to ascend to the top of WWE when Raw General Manager Eric Bischoff unexpectedly grants him an opportunity at the World Heavyweight Championship. After the sordid affair between Kane and Lita explodes on The Highlight Reel, Chris Jericho finds himself going one-on-one with the Big Red Monster. All this and more.

Following Evolution's despicable assault on Eugene, William Regal confronts Triple H and Raw General Manager Eric Bischoff. Randy Orton looks to reclaim some gold when he challenges Edge for the Intercontinental Championship. A battle between Kane and Chris Jericho proves too big for a ring to hold. Plus, the Raw Divas Search continues and more.

Triple H looks to reclaim the World Heavyweight Championship in an Iron Man Match in the main event. While The Game prepares to go the distance for gold, the rest of Evolution competes against the Superstars of Raw in an Over The Top Rope Battle Royal to determine a No. 1 Contender to face the champion at SummerSlam. All this and more.

After failing to recapture the World Heavyweight Championship thanks to Eugene, Triple H calls out his special "friend" for some payback. However, it is William Regal who ends up feeling the wrath of The Game. Tensions between Chris Jericho and Intercontinental Champion Edge boil over when Y2J invites his rival to join him on The Highlight Reel.

Following Triple H's vicious assault on William Regal, Eugene calls out The Game for a face-to-face confrontation. In an attempt to get even with Kane, Matt Hardy puts his relationship with Lita at stake by entering a dangerous contract with the Big Red Monster. Plus, Evolution competes in a Handicap Match main event and much more.

On a night where Randy Orton defends his newly won World Heavyweight Championship in a main event rematch from SummerSlam, Evolution plans an unforgettable celebration to commemorate his history-making reign. Less than a week before her wedding to Kane, Lita lets the WWE Universe know where she stands. All this and more.

The bells of unholy matrimony toll throughout the WWE Universe as Lita begrudgingly prepares to marry Kane in one of the most bizarre and unusual wedding ceremonies in WWE. After excommunicating World Heavyweight Champion Randy Orton from Evolution, Triple H explains his motivations for turning on his former friend. Plus Edge and more in action.

As Triple H faces Eugene in a No Disqualification Match, World Heavyweight Champion Randy Orton delivers a crushing message to The Game and Evolution. When Kane gives Lita a special wedding present, the Big Red Monster's blushing bride returns the favor. Plus, Batista takes on William, Victoria & Nidia battle Gail Kim & Trish Stratus, and more.

Things take an unexpected turn when Kane battles World Heavyweight Champion Randy Orton in the main event. After Raw General Manager Eric Bischoff strips the recently-injured Edge of the Intercontinental Championship, Christian and Chris Jericho get an opportunity to climb for the gold at Unforgiven. Plus, Triple H faces Eugene inside a steel cage.

After crashing Triple H's celebration for becoming the new World Heavyweight Champion, Randy Orton is forced to take on Evolution in a 3-On-1 Handicap Match. The sordid marriage between Kane and Lita comes to an unexpected turning point when Gene Snitsky debuts against the Big Red Monster. Plus, the 2004 Raw Divas Search continues and more!

Evolution competes in a Six-Man Tag Team Match. After weeks of competition, the 2004 Raw Divas Search comes down to two finalists. Mr. McMahon returns to deliver some taboo news to Raw General Manager Eric Bischoff. Plus, Chris Jericho defends the Intercontinental Championship against Shawn Michaels, The Hurricane battles Tajiri, and much more.

Randy Orton's hopes of regaining the World Heavyweight Championship from Triple H at Taboo Tuesday are put in jeopardy when he is ordered to face Batista in a No Disqualification Match. Shawn Michaels and Intercontinental Champion Chris Jericho take on Christian & Tyson Tomko. Gene Snitsky refuses to take responsibility for his actions and more.

A dispute between World Heavyweight Champion Triple H and Intercontinental Champion Chris Jericho leads to both men colliding in a Lumberjack Match. Kane takes exception when Gene Snitsky reveals a shallow depth of character. Eric Bischoff again humiliates Eugene. Plus, The Hurricane and Rosey go after the World Tag Team Championships and more.

With the WWE Universe being given the opportunity to decide who will face Triple H for the World Heavyweight Championship at Taboo Tuesday, The Game's three potential opponents team up for main event action when they take on Evolution in a Six-Man Tag Team Match. Kane goes on a rampage after hearing some disparaging comments from Gene Snitsky.

While awaiting the WWE Universe's decision on who will face Triple H for the World Heavyweight Championship at Taboo Tuesday, the three potential challengers meet in a Triple Threat Match. Eric Bischoff orders Eugene to face Gene Snitsky. Plus, Randy Orton & Intercontinental Champion Chris Jericho take on Evolution's Batista & Ric Flair, and more.

When Eric Bischoff takes the night off, Evolution tries to seize control of Raw, but face defiance from Raw's Superstars. Randy Orton receives an offer he can’t refuse to go one-on-one with Ric Flair in the main event for a shot the World Heavyweight Championship at Survivor Series. Plus, Edge explains his actions from Taboo Tuesday and more.

Evolution demands that order be restored to Raw. However, resistance from General Manager Eric Bischoff leads World Heavyweight Champion Triple H to abandon his allies before they take to the ring for a Six-Man Tag Team Match. Plus, Intercontinental Champion Shelton Benjamin faces Viscera, Eugene battles Gene Snitsky in a Hardcore Match, and more

With control of RAW to be decided between Team Orton and Team Triple H at Survivor Series, Batista looks to make a statement on behalf of The Game when he goes one-on-one with Randy Orton. Chris Jericho invites Lita and Women's Champion Trish Stratus to the Highlight Reel. Plus, Edge in action, Shelton Benjamin takes on Tyson Tomko, and more.

Following Team Orton's victory at Survivor Series, Maven takes control of this Raw by making several unique matches, including giving himself a chance at Triple H's World Heavyweight Championship. However, The Game makes him an offer of a lifetime. Plus, Jonathan Coachman faces Randy Orton, Lita takes on Molly Holly, and much more action.

With another member of Team Orton given control of Raw, Triple H's reign as World Heavyweight Champion is put in jeopardy when he is forced to put the title on the line in a Steel Cage Match. Plus, Trish Stratus defends the Women's Championship against Lita and Molly Holly in a Triple Threat Match, Jonathan Coachman faces Rhyno and more.

As Randy Orton assumes the role of Raw General Manager, Triple H is faced with another threat to his reign as World Heavyweight Champion when a Battle Royal is held to see who will challenge The Game for the gold in the main event. Plus, Lita & Victoria take on Molly Holly & Trish Stratus, Eugene & William Regal in action, and much more.

History is made when Trish Stratus defends the Women's Championship against Lita in the main event. After a controversial finish to last week's World Heavyweight Championship Match, Mr. McMahon gives some devastating news to Triple H on the Highlight Reel. Plus, Shelton Benjamin defends the Intercontinental Championship against Christian and more.

With the fate of the vacant World Heavyweight Championship in his hands, Eric Bischoff announces that a new champion will be crowned at New Year's Revolution when a sinister structure returns to WWE. While continuing to torment the women of WWE, Snitsky receives some hellish news from Women's Champion Lita. Plus, Randy Orton faces Edge and more.

Join Jerry "The King" Lawler and Jonathan Coachman as they look back on Raw's best matches and moments from 2004. From Randy Orton being excommunicated from Evolution to Lita and Trish Stratus' main event battle for the Women's Championship, all the action from throughout the year is featured.

Several Raw Superstars including Chris Jericho, Triple H, Shelton Benjamin, and more try to earn the best spot in the upcoming Elimination Chamber Match for the World Heavyweight Championship by competing in a series of Beat The Clock Matches. However, General Manager Eric Bischoff throws a curve ball at the challengers' championship aspirations.

Before they battle for the World Heavyweight Championship inside the Elimination Chamber at New Year's Revolution, the six competitors find themselves in singles action including Triple H taking on Randy Orton in the main event. Plus, Intercontinental Champion Shelton Benjamin battles Sylvain Grenier, Victoria faces Trish Stratus, and more.

Randy Orton tries to cause a rift between Batista and new World Heavyweight Champion Triple H before going one-on-one with The Animal in the main event to determine the No. 1 Contender for The Game's title. Shawn Michaels gives Edge some unexpected advice. Plus, several Superstars look to qualify for the Royal Rumble Match and more.

While Triple H prepares to defend his World Heavyweight Championship against Randy Orton at the Royal Rumble, Batista's own championship aspirations cause some concern for The Game. Snitsky learns that Hell hath no fury like a Big Red Monster. Plus, Shawn Michaels faces Christian, Six-Man Tag Team action, and more.

With an opportunity for Triple H's World Heavyweight Championship approaching, Randy Orton prepares for The Game by going one-on-one with Ric Flair. Batista continues to pursue his championship goals when he battles La Resistance in a Handicap Match to qualify for the 2005 Royal Rumble. Plus, Evolution crashes a celebration for Jim Ross and more.

Batista finds himself standing at a fork in his road to WrestleMania after The Animal is enticed to go to SmackDown to chase the WWE Championship. Kane and Snitsky's rivalry takes them inside a steel cage. Shawn Michaels & Randy Orton take on Evolution's Ric Flair and World Heavyweight Champion Triple H in the main event. All this and more.

For the first time, Raw emanates from Japan. Triple H defends his World Heavyweight Championship against Edge. Ric Flair goes one-on-one with Shawn Michaels. While deciding who he will face on The Grandest Stage of Them All, Batista takes to the ring to battle Maven. Plus, Randy Orton faces Tyson Tomko, a special fashion show, and more.

While preparing to go one-on-one with Edge, Batista's attention turns to SmackDown's WWE Champion John "Bradshaw" Layfield who's impending arrival on Raw sends The Animal hunting. Candice Michelle joins the Highlight Reel. Plus, Shelton Benjamin defends the Intercontinental Championship against Gene Snitsky, Randy Orton faces Christian, and more.

As the General Managers from both Raw and SmackDown await Batista's decision on which champion he will face for the gold at WrestleMania, The Animal makes a shocking revelation. Shelton Benjamin defends his Intercontinental Championship against Snitsky. Plus, Trish Stratus defends the Women's Championship against Victoria and Molly Holly and more.

Batista clears addresses why he left Evolution for a pursuit of gold at WrestleMania. In a main event Street Fight, Shawn Michaels goes one-on-one with Edge. Plus, Chris Jericho takes on Maven, Gene Snitsky challenges Shelton Benjamin for the Intercontinental Championship, and much more.

With his upcoming battle against Triple H for the World Heavyweight Championship at WrestleMania approaching, Batista sets his sights on another former ally from Evolution when he goes one-on-one with Ric Flair. Shawn Michaels sends a message to SmackDown's Kurt Angle. Randy Orton challenges The Undertaker to a WrestleMania match.

Randy Orton is the guest on a new edition of Chris Jericho's Highlight Reel. With eyes set on his upcoming World Heavyweight Championship Match against Triple H, Batista takes on Gene Snitsky. Plus, Shawn Michaels teams with an old friend to take on Sylvain Grenier & Rob Conway, Kane battles both Christian and Tyson Tomko, and much more.

Batista goes one-on-one with Kane in a Lumberjack Match main event. In an incredible Tag Team Match, Chris Jericho partners with Intercontinental Champion Shelton Benjamin to take on the duo of Christian & Tyson Tomko. Plus, Randy Orton's arrogance puts him further into the grave, Shawn Michaels battles Rob Conway, and much more.

Just days before they battle for the World Heavyweight Championship at WrestleMania 21, Triple H and Batista are given a final opportunity to address each other face-to-face. SmackDown's Kurt Angle makes his presence felt during Shawn Michaels' battle against Muhammad Hassan. Plus, Chris Jericho hosts a new edition of The Highlight Reel and more.

New World Heavyweight Champion Batista goes one-on-one with Randy Orton in a Non-Title Match. Shelton Benjamin defends the Intercontinental Championship in a Triple Threat Match against Chris Jericho and Christian. Muhammad Hassan looks to make a statement at the expense of Shawn Michaels. All this and more.

As Batista gives his first interview as World Heavyweight Champion, Triple H sends a message of his own to The Animal. However, The Game's attention is quickly diverted when The Hurricane & Rosey look for some payback. Shawn Michaels' quest to get even with Muhammad Hassan & Daivari leads The Heartbreak Kid to get help from an unexpected source.

While Jim Ross reluctantly prepares for a No Disqualification Match against Triple H in the main event, RAW General Manager Eric Bischoff gives Good Ol' J.R. some relief by putting Batista in his corner. Shawn Michaels' recent plea for help from Hulk Hogan is answered when The Heartbreak Kid goes one-on-one with Muhammad Hassan. All this and more.

Triple H looks to stack the deck against World Heavyweight Champion Batista when The Animal battles Christian in a Non-Title Match. Before they team up against Muhammad Hassan & Daivari at Backlash, Shawn Michaels & Hulk Hogan send a message to their opponents. Plus, Chris Jericho takes on Sylvain Grenier, Trish Stratus goes on a date, and more.

Batista is given the night off from action while eight Superstars including Shelton Benjamin, Edge, Chris Jericho, and more compete in the first Gold Rush Tournament to determine a new No. 1 Contender for The Animal's title. Plus, The Hurricane & Rosey defend the World Tag Team Championships against La Resistance and more.

The Semi-Finals of the Gold Rush Tournament see Shawn Michaels take on Edge. Despite Christian's best efforts to turn the tables on Ric Flair, "The Nature Boy" shows everyone that he still has it what it takes. Rob Conway and Sylvain Grenier try to prove who is the better member of La Resistance. All this and more.

The Final Round of the Gold Rush Tournament to determine the No. 1 Contender for the World Heavyweight Championship sees Edge face Kane. While looking for someone to blame for Triple H's absence, Ric Flair finds some comfort in an old friend. Plus, Randy Orton addresses his status in the upcoming WWE Draft and more.

While Eric Bischoff holds a funeral service for ECW, Mr. McMahon shakes things up by putting Bischoff face-to-face with his longtime rival Paul Heyman. Edge challenges Batista for the World Heavyweight Championship. Plus, Ric Flair shows the WWE Universe the meaning of loyalty, Kane is left scarred by Lita's recent betrayal, and more.

After Triple H challenges him to defend the World Heavyweight Championship inside Hell in a Cell, Batista defends his title against Muhammad Hassan. Eric Bischoff introduces a new team member in his fight against ECW. Plus, Shelton Benjamin defends the Intercontinental Championship in a Triple Threat Match, Kane joins The Highlight Reel, and more.

As the WWE Draft Lottery gets under away, Raw welcomes its newest addition that leaves the fans in awe. Batista and Triple H sign a contract for their upcoming match. And while the love triangle between Kane, Edge, and Lita continues, the rivalry between Eric Bischoff and Paul Heyman heats up. Plus, Shelton Benjamin, Chris Masters, and more.

Triple H plans a surprise for the next pick in the WWE Draft. In his first match on Raw, WWE Champion John Cena teams with Chris Jericho to take on Christian & Tyson Tomko. "Stone Cold" Steve Austin serves as the Special Enforcer when Shelton Benjamin defends the Intercontinental Championship against Muhammad Hassan. All this and much more.

When things break down in a match between Kurt Angle and World Heavyweight Champion Batista, The Animal teams with Shawn Michaels to face Triple H and Raw's newest acquisition. John Cena defends the WWE Championship against Muhammad Hassan. Edge and Lita receive an uninvited guest to their wedding. All this and more.

Kurt Angle's pursuit of Batista and the World Heavyweight Championship is halted after a confrontation with Ric Flair. Shawn Michaels chooses John Cena and a mystery partner to help him face Chris Jericho, Christian, & Tyson Tomko in a Six-Man Tag Team main event. The newest addition to the Raw brand makes his arrival on Carlito's Cabana.

Shawn Michaels teams with Hulk Hogan to take on Carlito and Kurt Angle in the main event. However, The Heartbreak Kid seizes this opportunity to make The Immortal One face the music. Plus, Edge & Snitsky battle Kane & Big Show, WWE Champion John Cena has a face-to-face confrontation with Chris Jericho on The Highlight Reel, and much more action.

Shawn Michaels make a huge announcement on Piper's Pit. Raw General Manager Eric Bischoff feels the wrath of John Cena after ordering him to defend the WWE Championship against Chris Jericho at SummerSlam. Plus, a new Kurt Angle Invitational, Shelton Benjamin challenges Carlito for the Intercontinental Championship, and more.

Hulk Hogan answers Shawn Michaels' challenge for a match at SummerSlam. Eric Bischoff forces WWE Champion John Cena to battle Snitsky in a Lumberjack Match. Edge looks to put an end to his rivalry with Kane when he battles the Big Red Monster in a Steel Cage Match. Carlito defends the Intercontinental Championship against Shelton Benjamin and more.

Chris Jericho serves as special guest referee when WWE Champion John Cena faces Intercontinental Champion Carlito. With his match with Hulk Hogan at SummerSlam set, Shawn Michaels informs the WWE Universe that the "old HBK" is back. While trying to put Kane down in a Stretcher Match, Edge is confronted by the return of another rival and more.

Mr. McMahon welcomes Matt Hardy back to Raw to address his personal rivalry with Edge and Lita. Chris Jericho serves as special guest referee when John Cena defends the WWE Championship against Intercontinental Champion Carlito.
