Plus, Shawn Michaels shows his opinion of Hulk Hogan in a hilarious parody, Tatanka in action and more.

Shawn Michaels and Hulk Hogan meet to discuss and answer questions about their upcoming battle. In attempt to punish someone for John Cena retaining the WWE Championship, Eric Bischoff joins The Highlight Reel to announcer that Referee Chad Patton will go one-on-one with Chris Jericho. Matt Hardy returns to action to face Snitsky and much more.

Hulk Hogan prepares for his upcoming showdown with Shawn Michaels by going one-on-one with Kurt Angle. WWE Champion John Cena is forced to take on Chris Jericho and Intercontinental Champion Carlito in a Handicap Match. Just days before he faces Matt Hardy, Edge takes to the ring to battle Val Venis. Plus, Big Show in action and much more.

Chris Jericho and John Cena find themselves fighting for more than gold after Raw General Manager Eric Bischoff orders them to face each other in the first ever "You're Fired" Match. Despite losing to Hulk Hogan, Shawn Michaels addresses his defeat. Plus, Kurt Angle takes on Shelton Benjamin, Ric Flair joins Carlito's Cabana, and more.

Ric Flair & Shawn Michaels take on Chris Masters & Carlito. Despite their battle at SummerSlam, the rivalry between Edge and Matt Hardy is far from over as they face each other in a Street Fight. WWE Champion John Cena calls out Kurt Angle for a face-to-face confrontation. All this and much more.

Kurt Angle makes his presence felt in a big way when WWE Champion John Cena goes one-on-one with Tyson Tomko. Lance Cade & Trevor Murdoch make their debut against World Tag Team Champions The Hurricane & Rosey. 2005 Raw Divas Search winner Ashley joins The Highlight Reel. Shawn Michaels steps up to Chris Masters' Masterlock Challenge and more.

WWE Champion John Cena competes in a Handicap Match against Kurt Angle & Tyson Tomko. Edge sends a message to Matt Hardy. Ric Flair goes one-on-one with Chris Masters. The team of Lance Cade & Trevor Murdoch continue to impress when they take to the ring against Eugene & Tajiri. Plus, Shelton Benjamin, Trish Stratus, and many more.

When RAW General Manager Eric Bischoff tries to unfairly award the WWE Championship to Kurt Angle in the aftermath of Unforgiven, Mr. McMahon returns to set things right. The Olympic Gold Medalist then partners with Chris Masters, Edge & Snitsky in an Eight-Man Tag Team Match against John Cena, Big Show, Shawn Michaels & Matt Hardy.

The Superstars of RAW bid farewell to Spike TV with action including Shawn Michaels and WWE Champion John Cena taking on Carlito & Chris Masters in a Tables Match. Edge sends a message to Matt Hardy. Plus, Trish Stratus defends the Women's Championship against Victoria, Big Show battles Snitsky in a Street Fight, and much more.

On a very special Raw Homecoming to USA, Triple H makes his own return to action when he and Ric Flair take on Carlito & Chris Masters. Eric Bischoff competes in a No Disqualification Match against WWE Champion John Cena. Plus, Kurt Angle and Shawn Michaels compete in a 30-Minute Iron Man Match and more.

After being stunned by Stone Cold Steve Austin on Raw's Homecoming to USA, the McMahon family looks for retribution. Triple H explains why he turned on Ric Flair. Shawn Michaels, Big Show, and WWE Champion John Cena unite to take on Carlito, Kurt Angle & Edge. Plus, Trish Stratus defends the Women's Championship against Victoria and much more.

With Jim Ross being unceremoniously fired by Linda McMahon, the CEO of WWE joins Carlito's Cabana to explain her actions. When Jonathan Coachman is given Good Ol' J.R.'s place as lead announcer, "Stone Cold" Steve Austin returns to fight for his friend's job. All this and much more.

Shawn Michaels battles Big Show and Kane in a Triple Threat Match. Mick Foley serves as special guest referee when Kurt Angles goes one-on-one with WWE Champion John Cena in a Non-Title Match. Plus, Mr. McMahon tries to further humiliate Jim Ross and his legacy, Ric Flair looks to get his hands on Triple H, and much more.

Shawn Michaels goes one-on-one with WWE Champion John Cena in the main event. Triple H prepares for his upcoming Steel Cage Match with Ric Flair by taking on Viscera. Jonathan Coachman receives some news that could spare him from a rattlesnake's bite. Plus, a Diva Halloween Costume Contest, Eugene takes on Rob Conway, and much more.

With the rivalry between Ric Flair and Triple H to be settled in an upcoming Last Man Standing Match, The Game gets a close look at "The Nature Boy" in action against Rob Conway. Shawn Michaels teams with WWE Champion John Cena to take on Chris Masters & Kurt Angle in the main event. Plus, Shelton Benjamin, Trish Stratus, and more in action.

In the wake of the sudden and tragic passing of Eddie Guerrero, Superstars from both Raw and SmackDown come together to mourn the loss of Latino Heat and pay tribute to his legacy. From Rey Mysterio going one-on-one with Shawn Michaels to WWE Champion John Cena taking on Randy Orton, the Superstars of WWE pay homage to their fallen brother.

Before Team SmackDown battles Team RAW at Survivor Series, Superstars from both sides serve as Lumberjacks when Raw's Shawn Michaels goes one-on-one with SmackDown's John "Bradshaw" Layfield. Ric Flair defends the Intercontinental Championship against Trevor Murdoch. Kurt Angle receives some assistance during his match with Shelton Benjamin.

With his job as General Manager of RAW at stake thanks to Mr. McMahon, Eric Bischoff struggles to accomplish his goal of taking the WWE Championship off of John Cena by forcing him to defend the title against Kurt Angle and Chris Masters in a Triple Threat Submission Match. Shawn Michaels faces Carlito. Plus, Big Show & Kane in action and more.

Mr. McMahon presides over the trial of Eric Bischoff that could put an end to his tyrannical reign as Raw General Manager. Shawn Michaels & Shelton Benjamin take on Kurt Angle & Daivari. Plus, Triple H goes one-on-one with Tajiri, Kane & Big Show defend the World Tag Team Championships in a Fatal 4-Way Tag Team Match, and much more action.

In the aftermath of Eric Bischoff's termination from WWE, Mr. McMahon assumes the role of Interim-General Manager and announces that Triple H, Shawn Michaels, Shelton Benjamin, and many more compete in a series of matches for a chance to qualify for the upcoming Elimination Chamber Match. Plus, WWE Champion John Cena takes on Daivari and more.

From Bagram Air Force Base in Afghanistan, WWE superstars are once again given the honor of performing for members of the U.S. Armed Forces with the holiday tradition of Tribute to the Troops. Witness WWE Champion John Cena, Triple H, Trish Stratus, and many more give a special thanks to our service men and women.

Before battling for the WWE Championship in the Elimination Chamber at New Year's Revolution, John Cena, Kurt Angle, and more compete in a series of Beat The Clock Matches. Mr. McMahon looks to ring in the New Year by interviewing potential candidates for the vacant Raw General Manager position and indulges in an unusual Christmas present.

Mr. McMahon orders Kurt Angle and WWE Champion to battle each other in a First Blood Match. Edge adds fuel to his rivalry with Intercontinental Champion Ric Flair. Triple H sends a message to Big Show. Plus, Gregory Helms' attitude gets him in royal trouble, Shawn Michaels goes one-on-one with Kane, and more.

The rivalry between Edge and John Cena over the WWE Championship continues to heat up but the relationship between Lita and Edge gets even hotter. Kurt Angle & Shawn Michaels battle Chris Masters & Carlito. Plus, Trish Stratus faces Ashley Massaro, Chavo Guerrero battles Rob Conway in a Royal Rumble Qualifying Match, and more.

Ric Flair is given the chance to break another record when he battles Edge for the WWE Championship. The career of Shawn Michaels is once again on the line as he faces World Heavyweight Champion Kurt Angle in a non-title match. Shelton Benjamin takes on the Big Show. Plus, John Cena, Carlito, and more.

The rivalry between John Cena and WWE Champion Edge rages on when both men team with a mystery partner to go head-to-head in a Tag Team Match. With the Royal Rumble approaching, Jonathan Coachman and Jerry "The King" Lawler battle each other for the coveted Number 30 Spot. Plus, Shawn Michaels goes one-on-one with Shelton Benjamin and more.

Despite losing the WWE Championship at the Royal Rumble, Edge receives another opportunity to ascend to the top of WWE when he battles John Cena for the gold. After costing Shawn Michaels his chance to main event WrestleMania, Mr. McMahon is faced with a special challenge from The Heartbreak Kid. Plus, Triple H faces Chavo Guerrero and more.

Eight Superstars including Triple H, Rob Van Dam, Shelton Benjamin, and more compete in a tournament to determine who will compete for the WWE Championship at WrestleMania. Edge & Lita take on Maria and WWE Champion John Cena where the winner will get to choose the special guest referee in their upcoming battle for the WWE Championship and more.

Mick Foley serves as the special guest referee when John Cena defends the WWE Championship against Edge. The Road to WrestleMania Tournament reaches the semi-finals with Triple H going one-on-one with Big Show and Rob Van Dam taking on Chris Masters. Mr. McMahon tries to humiliate Shawn Michaels. Plus, Shelton Benjamin faces Eugene and more.

With an opportunity to challenge John Cena for the WWE Championship at stake, Triple H battles Rob Van Dam and Big Show in a Triple Threat Match. Edge looks to make an example of a beloved WWE Hall of Famer before challenging Mick Foley to a match at WrestleMania. Shawn Michaels receives some help when he takes on The Spirit Squad and more.

After earning the opportunity to challenge John Cena for the WWE Title at WrestleMania, Triple H comes face-to-face with the champion. Mr. McMahon is dealt some heartbreak when he tries to force Marty Jannetty to join his infamous club'. Mick Foley responds to Edge's challenge. Rob Van Dam and more compete in Money in the Bank Qualifying Matches.

Triple H and WWE Champion John Cena face off in a WrestleMania Rewind Match. The ongoing issues between Shawn Michaels and the McMahon family continue to escalate when The Heartbreak Kid battles Shane McMahon. Shelton Benjamin defends the Intercontinental Championship against Ric Flair, Candice Michelle celebrates a recent accomplishment, and more.

Before competing against each other in a Six-Man Tag Team main event, Triple H and WWE Champion John Cena come together to sign the contract for their upcoming match at WrestleMania 22. When things get messy in the rivalry between Shawn Michaels and the McMahon family, The Heartbreak Kid finds himself facing The Spirit Squad in a Steel Cage Match.

Mr. McMahon continues to stack the deck against Shawn Michaels when he and WWE Champion John Cena take on Triple H and Shane McMahon. Lita pleads with Mick Foley to call off the upcoming Hardcore Match against Edge at WrestleMania. Shelton Benjamin defends the Intercontinental Championship against Ric Flair and Rob Van Dam in a Triple Threat Match.

After battling each other in an incredible contest, Triple H and Shawn Michaels find themselves in opposite corners once again when WWE Champion John Cena goes one-on-one with Mr. McMahon in the main event. Mick Foley offers an apology to Lita and gives Edge a gift to commemorate their upcoming confrontation at WrestleMania and more.

John Cena finds himself in main event action when he takes on The Game and Edge in a Handicap Match. Despite losing to Shawn Michaels on The Grandest Stage of Them All, Mr. McMahon issues another challenge to The Heartbreak Kid. Plus, Ric Flair receives a savage introduction to a new Superstar, Chavo Guerrero, Shelton Benjamin, and more in action.

Triple H and WWE Champion John Cena take on Edge in a Handicap Match. Mr. McMahon's search to find Shawn Michaels' tag team partner leads The Chairman to a place he has never been. Kane & Big Show try to reclaim the WWE Tag Team Championships from The Spirit Squad. Plus, Mickie James defends the Women's Championship against Maria and more.

When Mr. McMahon looks for a sign from above, Shawn Michaels shows him the meaning of "seek and you shall find." However, The Heartbreak Kid's actions earn him a match with Umaga. Triple H finds himself competing in a Handicap Match main event against Edge and WWE Champion John Cena. Trish Stratus gives Mickie James a special surprise and more.

Before defending the WWE Title against Triple H and Edge at Backlash, WWE Champion John Cena teams with his upcoming opponents to take on The Spirit Squad in a 5-on-3 Handicap Match. Mr. McMahon gives Shawn Michaels a taste of things to come when The Heartbreak Kid battles Shane McMahon. Plus, Umaga in action and more.

Mr. McMahon gives control of Raw to The Spirit Squad. However, John Cena is given nothing to cheer about, as he is forced to defend the WWE Championship against Kenny in the main event with Triple H serving as the special guest referee. Plus, Edge welcomes Mick Foley to be his guest on an all new Cutting Edge, Umaga in action, and much more.

On a night where Triple H challenges him for the WWE Championship, John Cena is also forced to team with Shawn Michaels against The Spirit Squad in a 5-on-2 Handicap Match. Rob Van Dam defends the Intercontinental Championship against Chris Masters, Shelton Benjamin, and Charlie Haas in a Fatal 4-Way Match. Plus, Mick Foley battles an ECW Original.

Triple H's frustrations with Mr. McMahon reach a new level when The Chairman changes The Game's WWE Championship opportunity against John Cena into an unusual contest involving Shelton Benjamin, Chris Masters, and Intercontinental Champion Rob Van Dam. Mick Foley invites another hardcore icon to a face-to-face confrontation.

In an attempt to humble Triple H for his actions, Mr. McMahon forces The Game to apologize before using him as his instrument of destruction when Shawn Michaels takes on all five members of The Spirit Squad. After Mick Foley's change in attitude leads him to present his honorary Hardcore Championship to Edge, another extreme legend takes exception.

Mr. McMahon capitalizes on Triple H's problems with The Spirit Squad by forcing The Game to face Kenny in the first Spiritjack Match. Old friends make bitter enemies when Mick Foley and Paul Heyman come together for a face-to-face confrontation between ECW and WWE. Edge battles Big Show for an opportunity at the WWE Championship and more.

The war between ECW and WWE rages on, as WWE Champion John Cena and Rob Van Dam to sign the contract for their upcoming battle for the WWE Championship at One Night Stand. After being drafted to ECW by Paul Heyman, Kurt Angle gets into a heated confrontation with WWE's Mick Foley. Triple H goes one-on-one with Big Show and more.

With the WWE Championship in the hands of Rob Van Dam, Paul Heyman promises to bring the gold to the premiere of ECW and welcomes Edge to join them as the new No. 1 Contender. However, The Rated-R Superstar will have to first go through former champion John Cena. Mr. McMahon forces Triple H to battle The Spirit Squad in a Gauntlet Match.

After being reunited under the D-Generation X banner once again, Shawn Michaels and Triple H lure The McMahons out of the arena to get some overdue retribution on The Spirit Squad. John Cena faces ECW Original Balls Mahoney. Plus, Kane speaks out about being stalked by a version of his former self, Randy Orton takes on Snitsky, and much more.

John Cena looks to bring the WWE Championship back to WWE when he challenges Rob Van Dam for the gold. Things get a little messy for The McMahons after D-Generation X imitates them. Kane's struggles with his former self rage on during his battle with Randy Orton. Mickie James defends the Women's Championship against Trish Stratus and more.

ECW's Rob Van Dam defends the WWE Championship against Edge and John Cena in a Triple Threat Match. The McMahon family's humiliation at the hand of D-Generation X continues when Triple H and Shawn Michaels invade the production truck. Johnny Nitro defends the Intercontinental Championship against Carlito and much more.

In an effort to punish DX's biggest fan, Mr. McMahon and Shane team up to make an example out of Eugene in a Handicap Match. After his match against Shelton Benjamin is disrupted by Edge, John Cena pays the Rated-R Superstar a special visit. Amidst Ric Flair's rivalry with Mick Foley, "The Nature Boy" finds himself faced with a giant challenge.

The rivalry between The McMahons and DX continues, as Shawn Michaels takes on Shane McMahon. While Mick Foley continues to deny Ric Flair's challenge for a rematch, "The Nature Boy" finds himself at odds with another friend of the Hardcore Legend. Torrie Wilson & Trish Stratus team up against Victoria and Women's Champion Mickie James and more.

John Cena & Ric Flair take on WWE Champion Edge & Intercontinental Champion Johnny Nitro. With Triple H away at the hospital preparing for the birth of his child, Mr. McMahon seizes an opportunity to dismantle Shawn Michaels. Hulk Hogan shows up to give Randy Orton a lesson in respect. All this and more.

After being humiliated by the father of his new grandchild, Mr. McMahon orchestrates another plot to get even with DX when Shawn Michaels faces Umaga. WWE Champion Edge provides commentary as John Cena battles Matt Striker. Johnny Nitro defends the Intercontinental Championship against Carlito and Shelton Benjamin in a Triple Threat Match.

The McMahons continue to get the upper hand on DX when it's Triple H's turn to face Umaga in the main event. Lita and WWE Champion Edge take on Carlito & Trish Stratus in a Mixed Tag Team Match. Shelton Benjamin goes one-on-one with Kane to determine the No. 1 Contender for the Intercontinental Championship. Plus, John Cena in action and more.

The McMahons send a message to Triple H and Shawn Michaels. Before he goes one-on-one with Carlito in the main event, WWE Champion Edge takes his rivalry with John Cena to a personal level when he reveals a visit to Cena's hometown. Randy Orton learns that there is nothing like the real thing after making a mockery of Hulk Hogan.

While their humiliation at the hands D-Generation X continues, following their loss to Shawn Michaels and Triple H at SummerSlam, The McMahons look to perform their own brand of degradation on another WWE Superstar by having Mick Foley join Mr. McMahon's Kiss My Ass Club. Edge quickly finds himself the victim of an unexpected twist of fate.

When D-Generation X's pranks cause Mr. McMahon to take the night off, Shane McMahon looks to punish Shawn Michaels & Triple H by placing them in a Handicap Match. John Cena issues a challenge to Edge for his WWE Championship that the Rated-R Superstar can't refuse. Plus, Lita defends the Women's Championship against Mickie James and much more.

With the blood of Shawn Michaels and Triple H on their hands following their recent assault on DX, The McMahons and Big Show are sent running in fear when The Game and The Heartbreak Kid look for retribution. John Cena teams with Carlito & Trish Stratus to take on Randy Orton, Women's Champion Lita & WWE Champion Edge. Plus, Jeff Hardy and more.

Mr. McMahon and his allies look to soften up Shawn Michaels and Triple H when The Chairman goes one-on-one with The Game in a No Holds Barred main event. John Cena partners with Jeff Hardy & Carlito to take on Randy Orton, Intercontinental Champion Johnny Nitro & WWE Champion Edge. Plus, Ric Flair battles Umaga, and much more.

John Cena partners with DX to take on Edge, Trevor Murdoch & Lance Cade. Johnny Nitro defends the Intercontinental Championship in a Six-Pack Challenge against Jeff Hardy, Randy Orton, Carlito, Super Crazy, and Chris Masters. In a rematch from their battle at Unforgiven, Umaga goes one-on-one with Kane. All this and much more action.

DX find themselves in the fight of their lives, as Triple H and Shawn Michaels team up for a Gauntlet Match. With one arm tied behind his back, WWE Champion John Cena faces Lita in a No Holds Barred Match. Kane challenges Johnny Nitro for the Intercontinental Championship. Plus, the tournament to crown a new Women's Champion begins and more.

Edge battles John Cena in a steel cage for the WWE Championship. After competing in a Texas Tornado Match, D-Generation X turns their attention gets even with Jonathan Coachman. Sgt. Slaughter returns to teach Nicky of The Spirit Squad some respect. Plus, Jeff Hardy challenges Johnny Nitro for the Intercontinental Championship and more.

Superstars from SmackDown and ECW join Raw for an evening of unforgettable action in a WWE family reunion. The Undertaker represents SmackDown in the main event against Raw Superstar and WWE Champion John Cena. Plus, D-Generation X battles Lance Cade & Trevor Murdoch in a Street Fight, Umaga faces Kane in a Loser Leaves Raw Match, and more.

Triple H faces Randy Orton. Mr. McMahon gathers ECW Champion Big Show and World Heavyweight Champion Booker T together with WWE Champion John Cena for some news regarding Cyber Sunday. Jeff Hardy defends the Intercontinental Championship against Super Crazy, Shelton Benjamin, and Chris Masters in a Fatal 4-Way Match. All this and much more.

While preparing to face ECW Champion Big Show and World Heavyweight Champion Booker T at Cyber Sunday, WWE Champion John Cena turns his attention to Johnny Nitro, as Nitro battles Cena on behalf of his celebrity friend, Kevin Federline. Randy Orton faces Triple H. Plus, the tournament to crown a new Women's Champion continues, and more.

With Cyber Sunday less than a week away, Mr. McMahon allows the WWE Universe a chance to choose John Cena's opponent between ECW Champion Big Show, World Heavyweight Champion Booker T, and Jonathan Coachman. Edge referees a bout between Triple H and Randy Orton. Plus, Eugene & "Hacksaw" Jim Duggan take on Umaga, Johnny Nitro in action, and more.

Eric Bischoff takes control of this edition of Raw by placing several Superstars in some precarious positions while seizing various opportunities to assist his allies. From serving as referee when Rated-RKO challenges Ric Flair & "Rowdy" Roddy Piper for the World Tag Team Championship to forcing Maria to face Umaga, Bischoff shows his tyranny.

In an attempt to prevent D-Generation X from interfering when Rated-RKO challenges Ric Flair and "Rowdy" Roddy Piper for the World Tag Team Championship in the main event, Jonathan Coachman puts a bounty on the heads of Shawn Michaels and Triple H. Plus, WWE Champion John Cena battles Umaga, Women's Champion Lita faces Mickie James, and more.

WWE Champion John Cena teams up with Ric Flair and DX to take on Rated-RKO, Big Show & Kenny of The Spirit Squad in an Eight-Man Tag Team Match. Johnny Nitro and Jeff Hardy battle for the Intercontinental Championship in a Ladder Match. Plus, Sabu goes one-on-one with Umaga, Mickie James faces Women's Champion Lita, and much more.

Umaga issues a challenge to John Cena for the WWE Championship. Before Rated-RKO take on the recently reunited Hardy Boyz, Edge & Randy Orton call out D-Generation X by appealing to Triple H and Shawn Michaels' better nature. Plus, Jerry Lawler goes one-on-one with Chris Masters, a WWE Divas Battle Royal, and much more.

DX teams with The Hardy Boyz to take on Rated-RKO & MNM in an Eight-Man Tag Team Match. Despite a recent challenge from Umaga, John Cena puts the WWE Championship on the line in Chris Masters' Masterlock Challenge. Eugene is featured on the Kiss Cam. Plus, Shelton Benjamin faces Super Crazy, Cryme Tyme visits a retirement community, and more.

After making his presence felt in WWE Champion John Cena's match with Armando Alejandro Estrada, Johnny Nitro finds himself going one-on-one with Cena. The problems between DX and Rated-RKO escalate when a contest between Triple H and Edge leads to a Six-Man Tag Team Match. Plus, Umaga takes on Intercontinental Champion Jeff Hardy and more.

Thirty Superstars compete in a Battle Royal where the winner will challenge John Cena for the WWE Championship later in the evening. In a Handicap Tag Team Match, Johnny Nitro partners with The World's Greatest Tag Team to take on The Hardy Boyz. Plus, Ric Flair goes one-on-one with Kenny Dykstra and much more.

From Camp Victory in Baghdad, WWE superstars continue the Christmas tradition of performing for members of the U.S. Armed Forces with another presentation of Tribute to the Troops. On this memorable holiday celebration, WWE Champion John Cena, Edge, The Undertaker, Randy Orton, and many more superstars are in action!

WWE Champion John Cena looks to put his rivalry with Kevin Federline to an end when they meet in one-on-one action. However, K-Fed's first bout in WWE is riddled with controversy after he enlists the help of some special friends. Plus, Rob Conway makes an ill-fated promise, Cryme Tyme in action, and more.

John Cena goes one-on-one with The Great Khali in the main event. With Triple H going down with an injury in DX's battle with Rated-RKO, Edge & Randy Orton promise to finish off Shawn Michaels next. Plus, Jeff Hardy defends the Intercontinental Championship against Kenny Dykstra, two celebrities come to Raw to face-off against each other, and more.

Rated-RKO battles Shawn Michaels in a Handicap Match main event. Before they meet for the WWE Championship at the Royal Rumble, John Cena and Umaga come face-to-face in a contract signing for their upcoming bout. Plus, Mickie James defends the Women's Championship against Victoria, Ric Flair battles Kenny Dykstra, and much more.

Shawn Michaels' personal rivalry with Edge leads The Heartbreak Kid into a main event Street Fight against The Rated-R Superstar. After mocking Mr. McMahon's unique obsession, WWE Champion John Cena learns the hard way why you never cross the boss. In a Raw vs. SmackDown Challenge, MNM member Joey Mercury faces Intercontinental Champion Jeff Hardy.

Shawn Michaels partners with WWE Champion John Cena to challenge Rated-RKO for the World Tag Team Championships. Mr. McMahon's attempts to please the WWE Universe with a special Fan Appreciation Night are trumped by an unexpected guest. Plus, Jeff Hardy defends the Intercontinental Championship against The Great Khali and much more.

After The Undertaker chooses to face Batista for the World Heavyweight Championship at WrestleMania 23, John Cena is faced with three potential contenders for his WWE Championship, as Shawn Michaels battles Edge and Randy Orton in a Triple Threat Match main event to determine who will challenge Cena for the gold on The Grandest Stage of Them All.

Things get more than a little hairy when Donald Trump challenges Mr. McMahon to a confrontation at WrestleMania 23. WWE Champion John Cena partners with Shawn Michaels, The Undertaker, and World Heavyweight Champion Batista to take on MVP, Mr. Kennedy, and Rated-RKO. Plus, Umaga makes a statement at the expense of two WWE legends and much more.

Mr. McMahon introduces his representative in the upcoming Battle of the Billionaires against Donald Trump and gives him a golden opportunity to challenge Jeff Hardy for the Intercontinental Title. Edge battles Rob Van Dam to qualify for the Money in the Bank Ladder Match. Randy Orton takes on WWE Champion John Cena. All this and much more.

Rated-RKO challenges Shawn Michaels and WWE Champion John Cena for the World Tag Team Championship. Jeff Hardy and Shelton Benjamin battle to qualify for the Money in the Bank Ladder Match. Donald Trump reveals his representative to face Umaga at WrestleMania's Battle of the Billionaires. All this and much more.

While trying to find out who the Special Guest Referee is for the Battle of the Billionaires at WrestleMania 23, Mr. McMahon receives some news that drives him stone cold crazy. In the first ever Falls Count Anywhere Match for the Women's Championship, Melina defends the gold against Mickie James. All this and much more.

Shawn Michaels and WWE Champion John Cena defend their World Tag Team Championship in a Gauntlet Match. The upcoming Battle of the Billionaires is made official when Donald Trump and Mr. McMahon sign the contract for their confrontation on The Grandest Stage of Them All. Plus, Randy Orton, Women's Champion Melina, and many more in action.

As Shawn Michaels travels down the road to WrestleMania, The Heartbreak Kid looks to silence his critics when SmackDown's John "Bradshaw" Layfield makes an appearance. Intercontinental Champion Umaga battles Eugene. Plus, WWE Champion John Cena takes to the ring for main event action, Randy Orton goes one-on-one with Jeff Hardy, and much more.

Shawn Michaels and WWE Champion John Cena take on The Undertaker and World Heavyweight Champion Batista. As his 'Battle of the Billionaires' confrontation approaches, Mr. McMahon steps into the ring for a No Disqualification Match against Donald Trump's representative, Bobby Lashley. All this and more.

John Cena & Shawn Michaels defend the World Tag Team Championship in a Tag Team Battle Royal. With Mr. McMahon literally losing his hair after his Battle of the Billionaires confrontation with Donald Trump, The Chairman looks for payback by having ECW Champion Bobby Lashley take on Armando Estrada and Intercontinental Champion Umaga.

In an effort to regain respect for his family name after Mr. McMahon had his head shaved at WrestleMania, Shane McMahon puts his own hair on the line when he challenges Bobby Lashley for the ECW Championship. With a opportunity to challenge John Cena for the WWE Championship at Backlash at stake, Randy Orton goes one-on-one with Shawn Michaels.

In the first episode of Raw to air from Italy, Umaga's No Holds Barred Open Challenge for the Intercontinental Championship is accepted by Santino Marella, a member of the WWE Universe. Plus, Jonathan Coachman again stacks the deck against WWE Champion John Cena by forcing him into a 2-on-1 Handicap Match against Rated-RKO in the main event.

Shawn Michaels and WWE Champion John Cena relive their unforgettable battle for the WWE Title at WrestleMania 23 when they step into the ring once again to go head-to-head. With recent humiliations weighing on his mind, Shane McMahon decides to make an example out of a fan. Plus, Melina defends the Women's Championship against Maria and more.

After Shawn Michaels, Edge, and Randy Orton are each mysteriously assaulted by an unknown assailant, WWE Champion John Cena is in for a huge surprise when he demands a face-to-face confrontation with the Superstar responsible. Mr. McMahon celebrates his new reign as ECW Champion by sending Umaga to dismantle Rob Van Dam and much more.

Shawn Michaels goes one-on-one with The Great Khali for a chance at the WWE Championship at Judgment Day. Meanwhile, WWE Champion John Cena takes on Randy Orton. Plus, Mr. McMahon agrees to give Bobby Lashley an opportunity at the ECW Championship, Mr. Kennedy defends his Money in the Bank Contract against Edge, and much more.

With Edge using his Money in the Bank Contract to capture the World Heavyweight Championship from The Undertaker, The Rated-R Superstar bids farewell to Raw by going one-on-one with Shawn Michaels. John Cena looks to retrieve his stolen WWE Championship from The Great Khali. Bobby Lashley battles Jonathan Coachman. All this and more.

Despite his victory over The Great Khali at Judgment Day, WWE Champion John Cena's problems with the Punjabi Nightmare are far from over. Before he can challenge Mr. McMahon for the ECW Championship at One Night Stand, Bobby Lashley must first run the Gauntlet against several opponents. Plus, Ric Flair takes on Carlito and much more.

After making a special announcement, Shane McMahon stacks the deck against his rivals by teaming with The Great Khali & Umaga to take on Bobby Lashley and WWE Champion John Cena in a Handicap Match. Randy Orton faces Rob Van Dam. Plus, a Memorial Day Bikini Beach Blast Battle Royal, Ric Flair & Torrie Wilson battle Carlito & Victoria, and more.

Following his loss of the ECW Championship at One Night Stand, Mr. McMahon combats his feelings of impending doom by taking out his frustrations on the Raw locker room. John Cena defends the WWE Championship in a Triple Threat Match against The Great Khali and Umaga. Torrie Wilson faces Carlito. Plus, Randy Orton battles Ric Flair and more.

On a night where the Superstars of SmackDown and ECW come to Raw for the first ever Tri-brand Draft, the evening also plays host to the ill-fated Mr. McMahon Appreciation Night. Superstars from all three brands battle in a series of matches to decide their fates. The celebration for The Chairman of WWE backfires and literally goes up in smoke.

While the WWE Universe buzzes over the investigation into Mr. McMahon's alleged death in a mysterious limo explosion, Stephanie McMahon vows to exact vengeance on whoever is responsible. Randy Orton teams with King Booker to take on Bobby Lashley and WWE Champion John Cena. Plus, Mick Foley goes one-on-one with Umaga and more.
Superstars remember Chris Benoit. Highlights from Hard Knocks and Chris' past matches.

Several RAW Superstars compete in Beat the Clock Matches for an opportunity to challenge John Cena for the WWE Championship at The Great American Bash. When Dusty Rhodes introduces his son Cody around the locker room, Randy Orton shows The American Dream some disrespect. Plus, Santino Marella faces Umaga, Carlito battles The Sandman, and more.

When WWE Hall of Famer Dusty Rhodes comes to Monday Night RAW to demand some respect from Randy Orton after his recent actions, The American Dream finds himself faced with a challenge from The Legend Killer. Mr. Kennedy partners with King Booker to take on Bobby Lashley & Jeff Hardy in a Tag Team Match. Plus, Paul London, Umaga, and more.

Tensions rise between Bobby Lashley and WWE Champion John Cena when both men come face-to-face in a heated in-ring debate. Randy Orton looks to make a statement at the expense of Cody Rhodes. Jeff Hardy, Shelton Benjamin, and Santino Marella battle in a Triple Threat Match to determine the Number One Contender for the Intercontinental Championship.

In an attempt to get the better of John Cena, Jonathan Coachman orders the WWE Champion to team with Women's Champion Candice Michelle to take on Intercontinental Champion Umaga and World Tag Team Champions Lance Cade & Trevor Murdoch in a No Disqualification Champions Only main event. Cody Rhodes demands to go one-on-one with Randy Orton and more.

While WWE Champion John Cena looks to teach Carlito a lesson in the main event, the new No. 1 Contender for the WWE Championship, Randy Orton, goes one-on-one with Sgt. Slaughter. Before Triple H makes his return at SummerSlam, King Booker sends a message to the so-called King of Kings in a match against Jerry "The King" Lawler. All this and more.

On a night where Mr. McMahon explains his recent actions before announcing a Battle Royal to determine a new General Manager of Raw, The Chairman receives some news that could change his family forever. WWE Champion John Cena is forced to battle Intercontinental Champion Umaga. King Booker faces Jerry "The King" Lawler. All this and more.

After gathering the entire WWE roster together to address his recent paternity suit, Mr. McMahon soon discovers that the identity of his illegitimate child is closer than ever. WWE Champion John Cena teams with Intercontinental Champion Umaga to take on Carlito & Randy Orton. King Booker receives word that he will soon be playing a whole new game.

WWE Champion John Cena goes one-on-one with Snitsky. Mr. Kennedy faces off with Carlito to determine the No. 1 Contender for the Intercontinental Championship. King Booker summons Triple H to crown him in front of the WWE Universe. Plus, Maria and Ron Simmons go on a date, Cody Rhodes battles Shelton Benjamin, and much more.

Randy Orton is given an opportunity to prove that he deserves another chance at the WWE Championship title by making his presence felt in the main event when Cena defends the gold against King Booker. Mr. McMahon finds himself subject to more humiliation after Triple H interrupts his guest appearance on Carlito's Cabana. All this and much more.

After using John Cena's father to gain another shot at WWE Championship, Randy Orton avoids the wrath of the WWE Champion by joining this edition of Raw via satellite. While speculation over the identity of his illegitimate son runs rampant, Mr. McMahon embraces a new strategy in dealing with his family. All this and much more.

Mr. McMahon's search to discover the identity of his illegitimate child comes up short. Randy Orton's despicable attempts to secure a WWE Championship opportunity finally catch up with him. Intercontinental Champion Jeff Hardy is forced to face SmackDown's World Heavyweight Champion The Great Khali. Plus, Triple H battles Shelton Benjamin and more.

On a night where John Cena's father tries to protect his son from being stripped of the WWE Championship by agreeing to face Randy Orton in the main event, Mr. McMahon shows the WWE Universe what kind of father he makes when he tries to put Hornswoggle up for adoption. Shelton Benjamin challenges Jeff Hardy for the Intercontinental Championship.

Mr. McMahon teams with Carlito to take on Triple H in a Steel Cage Match. John Cena is forced to surrender the WWE Championship to Raw General Manager Jonathan Coachman. Hornswoggle gets to see another side of Melina. Plus, Intercontinental Champion Jeff Hardy & Women's Champion Candice Michelle to take on Shelton Benjamin & Beth Phoenix and more.

Cena takes goes one-on-one with Mr. Kennedy for the first time. With Carlito serving as special guest referee, Mr. McMahon faces off with his son-in-law, Triple H. Plus, Santino Marella proves that everybody is a critic, Hornswoggle continues to torment Melina, a Six-Man Tag Team Match, and much more.

Mr. McMahon orders every Raw Superstar shake the hand of new WWE Champion Randy Orton. However, Orton's WWE Championship reign could come to an abrupt end when Triple H invokes his rematch clause for the gold. Mr. Kennedy puts the Intercontinental Championship on the line against Jeff Hardy. Plus, a live interview with John Cena and more.

With Randy Orton set to defend the WWE Championship against either Mr. Kennedy, Jeff Hardy, or Shawn Michaels at Cyber Sunday, Raw General Manager William Regal orders the Orton to face all three of his potential opponents in a series of matches. Mr. McMahon has Umaga give Triple H a demonstration of things to come. Plus, Santino Marella and more.

WWE Champion Randy Orton & Mr. Kennedy take on Shawn Michaels & Intercontinental Champion Jeff Hardy in a tag team main event. Before Umaga can make an example out of Hornswoggle, Triple H looks to get a piece of The Samoan Bulldozer. Plus, Beth Phoenix defends the Women's Championship, Cody Rhodes goes one-on-one with Shelton Benjamin, and more.

Umaga & WWE Champion Randy Orton take on Triple H in a Handicap Match. Mr. McMahon encourages Hornswoggle to make his family proud by having him go one-on-one with Jonathan Coachman. Despite coming up short due to a technicality at Cyber Sunday, Shawn Michaels looks for another chance at gold. Plus, the Finals of the 2007 Divas Search and more.

Shawn Michaels & Triple H take on Umaga and WWE Champion Randy Orton. Weeks of insulting "Stone Cold" Steve Austin's acting ability leave Santino Marella stunned by the arrival of The Rattlesnake. Rey Mysterio & Intercontinental Champion Jeff Hardy battle Mr. Kennedy & Finlay. All this and much more.

Triple H takes on Umaga in a Lumberjack Match. After The Undertaker and World Heavyweight Champion Batista bring their rivalry from SmackDown to Raw, The Deadman and The Animal face Lance Cade & Trevor Murdoch. When WWE Champion Randy Orton and Shawn Michaels go face-to-face before their match at Survivor Series. All this and more.

After successfully retaining the WWE Championship at Survivor Series, Randy Orton is confronted by a new challenger for his gold. An exchange of words between Shawn Michaels and Mr. Kennedy leads General Manager William Regal to order them to meet in one-on-one action. Plus, Santino Marella receives some royal treatment and much more.

When Ric Flair returns to WWE with a major announcement, Mr. McMahon forces "The Nature Boy" to put his career on the line in the main event against WWE Champion Randy Orton. After coming to Jeff Hardy's aid last week, Triple H finds himself teaming with the Intercontinental Champion to take on Umaga & Snitsky. Plus, Chris Jericho and more.

With Randy Orton and Chris Jericho set to battle for the WWE Championship at Armageddon, General Manager William Regal gives both men the right to choose each other's opponents tonight. Jeff Hardy defends the Intercontinental Championship against Snitsky. Mr. Kennedy tries to break Shawn Michaels' heart by offering him a blast from the past.

Superstars from the past and the present celebrate the 15th Anniversary of Monday Night Raw. Jeff Hardy defends the Intercontinental Championship against Carlito in a Ladder Match. Mr. Kennedy faces Marty Jannetty. WWE Champion Randy Orton and an old friend battle his former Evolution allies. Plus, a 15-Man Battle Royal and more.

Shawn Michaels & Intercontinental Champion Jeff Hardy face Mr. Kennedy & WWE Champion Randy Orton. The career of Ric Flair is put in jeopardy once again when "The Nature Boy" battles Umaga. Plus, Triple H faces Jonathan Coachman & General Manager William Regal in a Handicap Match, Chris Jericho receives a message from a wealthy Superstar, and more.

On a very special Tribute to the Troops, the Superstars of RAW journey to Iraq to perform for members of the U.S. Military. From WWE Champion Randy Orton going one-on-one with Chris Jericho, to D-Generation X taking on the team of Umaga & Mr. Kennedy, WWE offers the men and women of our armed forces some holiday wishes and a little taste of home.

With career of his friend and mentor Ric Flair on the line, Triple H finds himself in a difficult situation when he battles "The Nature Boy" for a spot in the upcoming Royal Rumble Match. WWE Champion Randy Orton gets personal with Jeff Hardy. John "Bradshaw" Layfield comes to the RAW brand for a face-to-face confrontation with Chris Jericho.

The fate of every Raw Superstar is in the hands of lady luck, as Mr. McMahon reintroduces Raw Roulette. From Triple H battling General Manager William Regal, to a Steel Cage Match main event between Umaga and Intercontinental Champion Jeff Hardy, the WWE Universe is treated to a night of some unique and unforgettable contests.

Jeff Hardy defends the Intercontinental Championship against Randy Orton. While Shawn Michaels competes to qualify for a spot in the upcoming Royal Rumble, Triple H’s frustrations over not being in the match lead Mr. McMahon to make a difficult decision. Plus, Ric Flair fights for his career once again and much more.

Intercontinental Champion Jeff Hardy and WWE Champion Randy Orton come face-to-face when Mr. McMahon orders both men to shake hands. Before he can qualify for the Royal Rumble Match, Triple H must compete in a Gauntlet Match. Plus, Shawn Michaels and Mr. Kennedy clash, Chris Jericho sends a message to John “Bradshaw” Layfield, and more.

John Cena sends a message to WWE Champion Randy Orton. Orton teams with John “Bradshaw” Layfield to take on Chris Jericho & Intercontinental Champion Jeff Hardy. Shawn Michaels & Triple H unite under the D-Generation X banner to battle Umaga & Snitsky. Plus, Mr. Kennedy, Women’s Champion Beth Phoenix, and many more in action.

On a night where John Cena and WWE Champion Randy Orton sign the contract for their upcoming battle at No Way Out, Cena must prove his strength by taking on Mark Henry in an Arm Wrestling Match. Shawn Michaels partners with Chris Jericho & Intercontinental Champion Jeff Hardy to battle John “Bradshaw” Layfield, Umaga & Snitsky and much more.

Shawn Michaels goes one-on-one with Intercontinental Champion Jeff Hardy. In retribution for his recent actions, Hornswoggle is forced compete in a No Disqualification Match against his father Mr. McMahon. WWE Champion Randy Orton takes a front row seat to witness John Cena in action against Mark Henry. Ric Flair gives Mr. Kennedy a history lesson.

Triple H serves as the special guest referee as John Cena faces WWE Champion Randy Orton. Shawn Michaels announces the newest inductee into the WWE Hall of Fame. A steel cage takes the place of the woodshed when Mr. McMahon looks to teach Hornswoggle a lesson in discipline. Plus, Superstars compete in Money in the Bank Qualifying Matches and more.

Triple H & John Cena face Mr. Kennedy & WWE Champion Randy Orton in the main event. Ric Flair issues a heartbreaking challenge to Shawn Michaels. John “Bradshaw” Layfield gives Mr. McMahon some interesting news about his family. Plus, Intercontinental Champion Jeff Hardy battles Chris Jericho in a Money in the Bank Qualifying Match and more.

While Triple H and WWE Champion Randy Orton prepare to battle each other in the main event, the other opponent in their Triple Threat Match at WrestleMania, John Cena, takes on Mr. Kennedy. Shawn Michaels & Ric Flair face Trevor Murdoch & Lance Cade. An appearance by Jeff Hardy on The Highlight Reel leads to a twist of fate for Chris Jericho.

The Superstars of WWE relive anew some of their classic battles from previous WrestleManias. From The Undertaker battling Mark Henry in a Casket Match, to Shawn Michaels and John Cena recreating their classic bout, these WrestleMania Rewind Matches are must see. Plus, Big Show and Floyd “Money” Mayweather weigh-in for their upcoming match.

John Cena and WWE Champion Randy Orton find themselves as unlikely partners when they compete in 17-On-2 Handicap Elimination Match. Mr. McMahon looks to end Ric Flair’s career himself by battling “The Nature Boy” in a Street Fight. Chris Jericho defends the Intercontinental Championship against Big Show. Plus, CM Punk faces Carlito and more.

John Cena, Ric Flair, Shawn Michaels & Triple H take on John “Bradshaw” Layfield, Umaga & Big Show in an Eight-Man Tag Team main event. CM Punk & Chris Jericho face MVP & Carlito. When things break down in a match between Maria and Melina, Raw General Manager William Regal makes a special Six-Person Intergender Tag Team Match. All this and more.

After retaining the WWE Championship at WrestleMania, Randy Orton finds himself faced with new challengers to his title before he goes one-on-one with Matt Hardy. The WWE Universe bids an emotional farewell to “The Nature Boy.” CM Punk takes on Chris Jericho. Plus, Big Show comes face-to-face with another giant, Cryme Tyme in action, and more.

With Raw General Manager William Regal ordering Randy Orton to defend the WWE Championship against John “Bradshaw” Layfield at Backlash, Triple H and John Cena look to find their place in the upcoming battle for the gold. Chris Jericho invites Batista and Shawn Michaels to be his guests on The Highlight Reel. Plus, Umaga faces Val Venis and more.

Triple H faces John “Bradshaw” Layfield in the main event. William Regal takes on WWE Champion Randy Orton. After taunting Shawn Michaels, Chris Jericho defends the Intercontinental Championship against Umaga. Plus, Mickie James challenges Beth Phoenix for the Women’s Championship, “Hacksaw” Jim Duggan in action, and much more.

John Cena, Triple H, ECW Champion Kane & World Heavyweight Champion The Undertaker take on John “Bradshaw” Layfield, Edge, Chavo Guerrero & WWE Champion Randy Orton. A king is set to be crowned, as Superstars from RAW, SmackDown, and ECW compete in the King of the Ring Tournament. Plus, appearances from the 2008 Presidential Candidates and more.

Randy Orton takes advantage of his rematch clause by challenging Triple H for the WWE Championship. After winning the King of the Ring Tournament, Raw General Manager William Regal looks to take his rightful place on the throne of WWE. Chris Jericho makes light of Shawn Michaels’ apparent knee injury on The Highlight Reel and much more.

Raw General Manager and current King of the Ring William Regal orders Mr. Kennedy and WWE Champion Triple H to team up against the entire ECW roster in a Handicap Match. Shawn Michaels & Chris Jericho take on WWE Tag Team Champions The Miz and John Morrison. Plus, “Rowdy” Roddy Piper joins Carlito’s Cabana and much more.

After standing up to Raw General Manager William Regal, John Cena faces Randy Orton. Shawn Michaels proves the extent of his injury to Chris Jericho. Hardcore Holly & Cody Rhodes defend the World Tag Team Championship against Santino Marella & Carlito. Jeff Hardy battles Umaga. All this and more.

John Cena & WWE Champion Triple H face Randy Orton & John “Bradshaw” Layfield. Raw General Manager William Regal and Mr. Kennedy battle for their careers in WWE. Batista goes one-on-one with Intercontinental Champion Chris Jericho for an opportunity to face Shawn Michaels in a Stretcher Match at One Night Stand. Plus, Piper’s Pit and more.

Mr. McMahon shows the WWE Universe the appreciation that they deserve with a million dollar announcement. Randy Orton and WWE Champion Triple H come face-to-face. Shawn Michaels competes against Intercontinental Champion Chris Jericho. Plus, John Cena & Jeff Hardy team up to take on Umaga & John “Bradshaw” Layfield and much more.

John Cena and Jeff Hardy battle to determine the new No. 1 Contender for the WWE Championship. Mr. McMahon gives some unique insight into the first ever Million Dollar Mania contest. Chris Jericho defends the Intercontinental Championship against John “Bradshaw” Layfield. Plus, Beth Phoenix in action, Mr. Kennedy faces Umaga, and more

Mr. McMahon’s Million Dollar Mania officially kicks off. While WWE Champion Triple H prepares to battle Jeff Hardy in the main event, the No. 1 Contender for his title John Cena goes one-on-one with John “Bradshaw” Layfield. Tensions between Shawn Michaels and Intercontinental Champion Chris Jericho explode on The Highlight Reel.

John Cena battles Umaga in a Street Fight. WWE Champion Triple H clashes with Intercontinental Champion Chris Jericho. Mr. McMahon continues to show the WWE Universe some appreciation with his Million Dollar Mania. Plus, Mr. Kennedy and Women’s Champion Mickie James take on Paul and Katie Lea Burchill in a Mixed Tag Team Match and more.

In the annual WWE Draft, Superstars from Raw, SmackDown, and ECW compete against each other in a series of Inter-promotional Matches in the hopes of earning their brand a draft pick. After weeks of giving the WWE Universe what they deserve with his Million Dollar Mania, Mr. McMahon’s benevolence unexpectedly comes crashing down

CM Punk uses his Money in the Bank Contract to challenge Edge for the World Heavyweight Championship. After capturing the Intercontinental Championship, Kofi Kingston puts the gold on the line against Chris Jericho. Plus, Shane McMahon addresses Mr. McMahon’s accident, Santino Marella gets on the wrong side of Rey Mysterio, and more.

SmackDown General Manager Vickie Guerrero comes to Raw to protest CM Punk’s recent capture of the World Heavyweight Championship. John Cena battles John “Bradshaw” Layfield, Kane, and Batista in a Fatal 4-Way main event to determine the new No. 1 Contender for the gold. Plus, Shawn Michaels accepts Chris Jericho’s recent challenge and more.

Despite Shane and Stephanie McMahon’s attempts at imploring the Superstars of Raw to maintain order in their father’s absence, chaos ensues when John Cena & Cryme Tyme take on John “Bradshaw” Layfield, Cody Rhodes & Ted DiBiase. Batista makes his presence felt during World Heavyweight Champion CM Punk’s battle with Kane and much more

After failing to capture the World Heavyweight Championship at The Great American Bash thanks to Kane, Batista seizes another golden opportunity by challenging CM Punk for the title in the main event. John “Bradshaw” Layfield teams up with Cody Rhodes & Ted DiBiase once again to take on John Cena and Cryme Tyme. Plus, Beth Phoenix and more.

Before naming a new General Manager of Monday Night Raw, Shane McMahon orders John Cena and Batista to put aside their recent misunderstandings and take on Kane & John “Bradshaw” Layfield. William Regal goes one-on-one with World Heavyweight Champion CM Punk. Plus, Chris Jericho sends a message to Shawn Michaels and much more action.

With both Chris Jericho and John “Bradshaw” Layfield looking to challenge CM Punk for the World Heavyweight Championship at SummerSlam, Raw General Manager Mike Adamle gives Y2J and JBL a unique chance to become the No. 1 Contender when they face The Straight Edge Superstar in a Handicap Match. All this and much more

Despite recently capturing the World Tag Team Championship, tensions between John Cena and Batista continue to rise when they defend the title against Cody Rhodes & Ted DiBiase. John “Bradshaw” Layfield tries to test World Heavyweight Champion CM Punk’s moral character by offering The Straight Edge Superstar a toast. Plus, Kane and much more.

World Heavyweight Champion CM Punk takes to the ring for main event action before the eyes of his hometown of Chicago when he goes one-on-one with Chris Jericho. John Cena takes on World Tag Team Champions Cody Rhodes & Ted DiBiase in a Handicap Match. Plus, Raw General Manager Mike Adamle reveals a new match concept for Unforgiven and much more.

In response to his wife’s recent injury at the hands of Chris Jericho, Shawn Michaels addresses his in-ring status. Batista battles Kane. Kofi Kingston challenges Santino Marella for the Intercontinental Championship. Plus, Raw General Manager Mike Adamle names the injured John Cena’s replacement for the upcoming Championship Scramble and more.

Before defending the World Heavyweight Championship against Batista, John “Bradshaw” Layfield, Rey Mysterio, and Kane in a Championship Scramble at Unforgiven, CM Punk competes in a Battle Royal against all four competitors. Tensions reach a breaking point as Shawn Michaels and Chris Jericho sign the contract for their upcoming Unsanctioned Match.

Like unicorns, the Loch Ness monster and the lost city of Atlantis, the return of Bret Hart to WWE seemed merely the stuff of legend, a sight among the WWE faithful that would never come to fruition.

Then it happened. After a controversial exit and a 12-year absence, The Excellence of Execution agreed to return to WWE as the first special guest host of Raw to kick off the new year. Even Bigfoot himself couldn’t have proven a more exciting host … or more shocking.

As professional boxing’s former Undisputed Heavyweight Champion of the World, Mike Tyson enjoyed a reputation for delivering the knockout punch in no time flat. As special guest host of Raw, however, the “Baddest Man on the Planet” held off until the final round to deliver a shocking KO to the WWE Universe – and especially Chris Jericho.

In the new comedy When In Rome, starring Raw’s special guest co-hosts Jon Heder and Don Johnson, a woman finds herself engulfed by an over abundance of affection from her suitors. Unlike the premise of their movie, though, Heder and Johnson found themselves surrounded by anything but love as Raw Superstars turned on one another in the lead up to the Royal Rumble.

After his co-star on USA Network’s Psych, James Roday, was rushed to the hospital for an emergency appendectomy, actor Dule Hill was forced to act as Raw’s sole guest host. No worries, though, since Hill more than held his own with a little guidance from John Cena, who just so happens to guest star on Psych’s season premiere this Wednesday at 10/9 CT.

In his role as Capt. James T. Kirk of the starship Enterprise, William Shatner presided over a crew that sometimes found themselves at each others’ throats. In his role as special guest host of Raw, the iconic actor also presided over a roster full of Superstars – and at least one Chairman – with enough personal vendettas to fill an entire galaxy.

Let the celebration continue! Just one night after the New Orleans Saints captured the NFL’s top prize in the Super Bowl, the people of Louisiana were still in the mood to party when Raw rolled into the Cajundome. Good thing, too, since special guest host and NASCAR driver Carl Edwards gave them plenty to celebrate.

The rowdy guests on The Jerry Springer Show are known for catching the objects of their scorn off guard and landing a painful blow or two. As evidenced by several WWE Superstars, however, those dirty tactics aren’t confined solely to the stage of Raw’s latest special guest host, Jerry Springer.

One night after WWE Elimination Chamber, special guest co-hosts, singer Jewel and her husband, pro bull rider Ty Murray, were riding high in the saddle as they helped wrangle an ornery herd of Superstars into several WrestleMania matches.
With Cheech and Chong acting as special guest hosts, the WWE Universe held on for a few loopy twists and trippy turns on The Road to WrestleMania.

Master illusionist Criss Angel may have acted as special guest host of Monday Night Raw, but it was Mr. McMahon who employed trickery and a host of hired hands to punish John Cena on The Road to WrestleMania.

When the most popular Superstar in WWE history returns to guest host Monday Night Raw, certain rules apply. First, that Superstar should behave in a manner befitting WWE’s image. Secondly, that Superstar should speak in respectful tones. And lastly, that Superstar should demonstrate sufficient reverence to their former employer.

As “Stone Cold” Steve Austin demonstrated, however, when The Texas Rattlesnake is that Superstar, no rules apply!

The Road to WrestleMania ends in just six days when the WWE Universe descends upon Phoenix for the biggest event in all of entertainment. Tonight, though, the twists, turns and dangerous curves continued to pop up along the way.

The day after WrestleMania XXVI ushered in a new era. While a crop of new, exhilarating, young Superstars are being cultivated in the hothouse of WWE, it was time for one Superstar, Shawn Michaels, to bid farewell after offering up a 25-year feast of cherished memories and jaw-dropping moments. Thank you, Shawn Michaels.
When David “A-List” Otunga won an Eight-Man Battle Royal to earn the honor of special guest host, the NXT Rookie didn’t forget to bring his “A” games to Monday Night Raw.

As an international star beloved by fans around the world, who better than David Hasselhoff to take the reins of Raw across the pond in London? To say he did a phenomenal job, would be like saying that KITT from Knight Rider was a “decent ride.” Let’s face it, The Hoff went off!

With a giant ash cloud hovering over Europe, thanks to an erupting volcano in Iceland, air travel has been severely restricted, causing most of the Raw roster to find themselves grounded overseas after their European tour. With Extreme Rules less than a week away, however, WWE found plenty of angry SmackDown Superstars just itching to blow their tops.

While the outcome of Extreme Rules rattled the WWE Universe just 24 hours prior, the following night’s 2010 WWE Draft on a special three-hour Monday Night Raw shook many of the Superstars themselves to their very core. The quake resulted when both the Raw and SmackDown rosters competed in inter-promotional matches to determine which brand would earn a Draft pick.

With an entirely new constellation of Superstar draftees moving into its orbit, the Raw roster promised to be an altered universe. As if to punctuate that point, former SmackDown Superstar Chris Jericho devestated the Unified Tag Team Champions with the help of an unlikely ally and Edge nearly laid waste to a former friend before feeling the pain of angry fangs.

“The sole advantage of power is that you can do more good.” – Baltasar Gracian.

It’s a pretty solid bet that Vickie Guerrero has never heard that quote. And while her reign as Raw’s General Manager proved mercifully brief, the ripples she caused are certain to reverberate for weeks to come.

With just six days before Over the Limit, special guest host Buzz Aldrin, one of the famed astronauts aboard the first manned mission to the moon, blasted the WWE Universe into orbit on a commercial-free Raw.

While special guest host Jon Lovitz enjoys success as a comedian, a movie star and a former member of Saturday Night Live, the brutal qualifying matches and one shocking departure that went down inside Toledo's Huntington Center were no laughing matter.

While the WWE Universe saluted the men and women of the armed forces on Memorial Day, it was special guest host Ashton Kutcher who ordered the Raw Superstars into combat with one another in front of a capacity crowd. Atten-shun!

The WWE Universe took the reins of Monday Night Raw for the first-ever Viewer’s Choice Night, choosing the matches and stipulations by voting on WWE.com. Hosted by the cast of The A-Team, this three-hour, co-branded event was created by and for the WWE Universe, loaded with surprise match-ups that reignited old rivalries between both Raw and SmackDown Superstars while creating entirely new ones in the process.

While it’s Raw guest host Mark Feuerstein who stars in USA Network’s Royal Pains, it was Raw’s General Manager, Bret Hart, who experienced serious and mounting pains of his own thanks to the group of ruthless and desperate season one NXT Rookies.

One night after the seven season one NXT Rookies decimated the WWE landscape at Fatal 4-Way, the pugnacious pack once again tore into the Raw roster to make their presence felt – even going so far as to attack The Chairman himself, Mr. McMahon!

As a singer of sinister songs and a director of horror films, Raw special guest host Rob Zombie has experience with the darker side of human nature. That experience must have set him somewhat at ease when Randy Orton slithered past his foes to demonstrate just how far a snake will go to wrap himself around what he wants.

During The Nexus’ reign of terror, the band of bothers have focused their attacks, managing not to involve the entire Raw roster. This week, however, their actions managed to drag nearly every Raw Superstar into their wicked wake.

While everyone’s favorite TV mom Florence Henderson tried to keep the Raw roster on the straight and narrow, The Nexus would have none of it, continuing to prove their as angry and out-of-control as Mel Gibson on a phone rant.

Push John Cena and the man is bound to push back. One night after losing a WWE Championship Steel Cage Match thanks to The Nexus, Cena came to Raw to return the favor – and he brought along reinforcements.

It’s often said that everything is bigger in Texas. Well, if you’re John Cena, that’s certainly proven true. As he and his seven-man SummerSlam squad move closer to the biggest bash of the season, the troubles, the tribulations and the headaches have all grown as large as the Lonestar State.

It’s the dog days of summer, and with SummerSlam just two weeks away, the Raw roster certainly seems to be feeling the heat. While WWE Champion Sheamus tries to escape the glare of his cold-blooded competitor, Randy Orton, Team WWE continues to tear themselves apart.

Like a runaway sailboat careening toward SummerSlam, Team WWE fought and flailed as if in the eye of the storm. With just six days left, however, will the crew finally right themselves in time, or are they destined to crash against the rock solid unity of The Nexus?

When Team WWE dismantled The Nexus at SummerSlam the night before, it appeared that the sun had finally set on the seven deadly sinners. On Monday night, however, the group’s members, with the exception of one, each survived in singles competition, offering The Nexus hope that a new day may have finally dawned.

During Monday Night Raw, the City of Angels played host to a pair of WWE's heavenly bodies, a contingent of deadly sinners and a half dozen Superstars ready to clash in a battle of biblical proportions at the Night of Champions pay-per-view.

In this historic city, nearly 240 years ago, a group of men rebelled against the tyranny of the English establishment. Those American colonists would eventually go on to overcome their British oppressors. During Raw’s 900th episode celebration, however, it would be the Englishman who would prevail in the end.

In the shadow of the breathtaking Washington Monument, Randy Orton made a few breathtaking monumental statements of his own. In the U.S. capital, The Viper countered the attacks of four Superstars with a flurry of RKOs.

With just six days until Night of Champions, several competitors in that night’s Six Pack Elimination Challenge pushed their luck with Raw’s Roulette Wheel. Some hit the jackpot in their matches, while others saw their fortunes dwindle at the tables.

Twenty-four hours earlier, at Night of Champions, several WWE Superstars were in heaven when they earned new championships. During Raw, however, WWE Champion Randy Orton, Sheamus, John Cena and Wade Barrett realized they'll be feeling the heat when they compete at the Hell in a Cell pay-per-view inside the American Airlines Center in Dallas.

It’s been said that the road to hell is paved with good intentions. Whoever thought up that must have never watched Raw. There are a galaxy of Superstars who have never nurtured a good intention in their lives, and with just one week until they find themselves in “Hell,” they aren’t about to start now.

WWE has been forever altered. One night after Hell in a Cell, John Cena, arguably WWE’s brightest Superstar, was forced into a shadowy arrangement with one of the darkest forces Raw has ever known, The Nexus, and the group's petulant principal, Wade Barrett.

With WWE Bragging Rights less than two weeks away, the time had come for the Raw roster to determine which Superstars would carry the brand’s flag into battle and just who would lead that charge – The Miz or John Cena.
As Team Raw prepares to make landfall at WWE Bragging Rights in just six days, the red brand found themselves awash in a stormy sea of blue when the SmackDown roster invaded Monday night.

Halloween may be a night for demonic spirits to wreak havoc on the living, but just six days prior to All Hallows Eve, a presence equally as sadistic, Wade Barrett, was busy haunting his nemesis, John Cena.

John Cena can probably kiss that employee-of-the-month award goodbye. Among supremely bad ideas, ticking off your boss is right up there with arm-wrestling an alligator, but the reluctant Nexus member did just that when he stuck to his principles and refused to play favorites for Nexus leader Wade Barrett.

With two weeks until Survivor Series, Monday Night Raw hopped the pond and settled into jolly ol’ England. Although the proceedings appeared to be running smoothly, even “tickety-boo,” as the Brits might say, when Manchester native Wade Barrett started bossing around Superstars, that’s when things became all “sixes and sevens” – and that, as any Englishman will tell you – adds up to chaos.

Who needs a DeLorean that can hit 88 mph to travel back in time? Instead, Raw kicked off Old School night with a battalion of WWE Alumni and Hall of Famers. And although the classic Raw graphics and ring ropes were evident, there was still a lot of brand new developments leading up to this Sunday’s Survivor Series.

Buckle up, hold on and expect the unexpected. While Central Florida may be the epicenter of theme parks and wild rides, the WWE Universe was forced onto a rollercoaster ride of their own, bidding farewell to one era while bracing for a completely new one - The Age of Awesome.

The lineage of those who’ve worn the King of the Ring crown is rich with WWE Hall of Famers and Legends, including “Stone Cold” Steve Austin, Bret Hart, Edge and Triple H. Tonight, a new King, an Irish King would capture the throne to take his place among WWE royalty.

Before the American Revolution began in 1774, the kingdom of Great Britain assumed they had their American subjects squarely under thumb. And we all know how that turned out. Fast forward 200 years, and Englishman Wade Barrett appears to be on the verge of suffering a similar revolt.

In one of the most exciting awards ceremonies on television, bar none, Raw celebrated another year of the Slammy Awards. With the opening of each envelope, bombshells continued to drop throughout the broadcast. And the Slammy goes to…

T’was five days before Christmas, 
and all through WWE, the Superstars were stirring, in the wake of TLC...

According to Chinese astrology, 2010 was the Year of the Tiger. However, with The Miz as WWE Champion, The Nexus still a dominant force and CM Punk getting the best of John Cena, perhaps the past 12 months will best be known as the Year of the Rat.
Starring John Cena, Randy Orton, CM Punk and Triple H.
CM Punk takes control of The New Nexus; John Cena challenges "The Straight Edge Superstar."
CM Punk battles John Cena in the main event; Superstars make their case for the Royal Rumble Match.
The Anonymous Raw GM enlists John Cena to referee a match between CM Punk and Wade Barrett.
Superstars compete in a special Raw Rumble Match to determine WWE Champion The Miz's next opponent.
Mr. McMahon makes a major WrestleMania announcement; CM Punk meets John Cena in the main event.
WWE Champion The Miz goes one-on-one with United States Champion Daniel Bryan, his former NXT pupil.
John Cena addresses the recent comments made about him by The Rock; CM Punk faces John Morrison.
Triple H returns and explains why he wants to fight Undertaker at WrestleMania.
John Cena has some harsh words for The Rock; The Undertaker sends a deadly message to Triple H.
WWE Champion The Miz gets involved in the rivalry between The Rock and John Cena.
WWE Champion The Miz wants to rewrite company history; Randy Orton tangles with Rey Mysterio.
The Rock and John Cena become involved in a confrontation with WWE Champion The Miz.
After losing to The Miz at WrestleMania, an upset John Cena confronts The Rock.
An emotional Edge bids farewell to the WWE Universe; Sin Cara makes his WWE debut.
In a WrestleMania XXVII rematch, CM Punk goes one-on-one with Randy Orton in the main event.
The 2011 WWE Draft reshapes the landscapes of "SmackDown" and "Raw"; Randy Orton threatens CM Punk.
The Rock celebrates his birthday in Miami; The Miz challenges John Cena for the WWE Championship.
R-Truth is furious when he's excluded from a Triple Threat Match to name a new Number One Contender.
The Miz is handed a unique opportunity by the Anonymous Raw GM; Kofi Kingston battles CM Punk.
Bret Hart serves as guest referee when WWE Champion John Cena & Rey Mysterio face CM Punk & R-Truth.

Roman Reigns beat the odds by defending WWE World Heavyweight Championship against Sheamus with Mr. McMahon as the guest referee, but his next title bout will truly be one versus all.
From Brock Lesnar's return to Kalisto's soaring U.S. Title victory, see what went down on the Raw that changed the Royal Rumble picture.
The road to the Royal Rumble winded down when Chris Jericho brought Brock Lesnar and Roman Reigns to "The Highlight Reel" on an all-new Monday Night Raw.

The Road to WrestleMania began on Raw as Triple H set the parameters for his WrestleMania title defense, and The Rock got a dose of The Power of Positivity when The New Day interrupted his homecoming.
What happened when Brock Lesnar, Roman Reigns and Dean Ambrose were all under the same roof ahead of their WWE Fastlane showdown?

During Raw’s emotional conclusion, Daniel Bryan spoke out about his retirement, reflected on his groundbreaking career and thanked the “Yes!” Movement for their unending support over the years. Find out what the four-time World Champion revealed, and what went down after Raw.

As The Wyatt Family attempted to dominate Big Show after Raw’s main event, Ryback and Demon Kane entered the fray to even the odds against the swamp monsters. Have The Eater of Worlds and his sinister flock met their match?

In one of the most jaw-dropping moments in sports-entertainment history, Shane McMahon returned to WWE after six years away from the company to interrupt his sister Stephanie’s acceptance of the Vincent J. McMahon Legacy of Excellence Award, confront his father and demand control of Monday Night Raw! But to get it, he'll have to defeat The Undertaker inside Hell in a Cell at WrestleMania!

Mr. McMahon might have considered The Undertaker to be his own personal "force of nature" against his son Shane at WrestleMania, but The Deadman follows no man … not even The Chairman. Get all the details on The Phenom’s unsettling message to the McMahon family, and how Mr. McMahon changed the landscape of The Show of Shows’ high-stakes Hell in a Cell Match.

As Shane McMahon responded to his father planning to “disown” him after WrestleMania, The Undertaker emerged to deliver a stern message to WWE’s prodigal son … or did he? Find out about the cruel joke Mr. McMahon masterminded to psyche out his son, and what The Boy Wonder did to The Chairman's security when they attempted to remove him from the building.

Triple H escaped with the WWE World Heavyweight Championship, but as he walks into Pittsburgh with the ultimate prize, what message will he have for his WrestleMania opponent Roman Reigns? And how will Dean Ambrose respond to coming up short at WWE Roadblock?

To ensure that The Undertaker defeats Shane McMahon inside Hell in a Cell at WrestleMania, Mr. McMahon decreed on Raw that if The Deadman is unsuccessful against WWE's prodigal son, this will be his last appearance on The Grandest Stage of Them All! Also on Raw, Dean Ambrose went berserk against The Wyatt Family and Roman Reigns gave WWE World Heavyweight Champion Triple H some serious car trouble.

WWE World Heavyweight Champion Triple H talked a big game on the final Raw before WrestleMania, but Roman Reigns was ready for a fight, sparking a brawl with his Show of Shows opponent that required nearly the entire roster to restore the peace. Does The Big Dog have The Cerebral Assassin running scared before they square off on The Grandest Stage of Them All? Also on Raw, Shane McMahon performed an awe-inspiring feat that grounded The Undertaker ... but not for long.

Shane McMahon was given the keys to Raw for a night and did not disappoint, creating a thrilling Fatal 4-Way main event between AJ Styles, Chris Jericho, Kevin Owens and the returning Cesaro to determine the No. 1 contender to WWE World Heavyweight Champion Roman Reigns.

Per Shane McMahon, who ran Raw for the second straight week thanks to the WWE Universe’s support on social media, WWE World Heavyweight Champion Roman Reigns teamed up with longtime nemesis Bray Wyatt to battle Sheamus & Alberto Del Rio in a never-before-seen main event. Could The Big Dog and The Eater of Worlds coexist? Also on Raw, Natalya vied for Charlotte’s WWE Women’s Title, AJ Styles clashed with Sami Zayn and a No. 1 Contenders’ Tag Team Tournament began!

In a hard-hitting Raw main event made by temporary Raw showrunner Shane McMahon, Dean Ambrose and Kevin Owens brought each other to the brink, but it was Chris Jericho who would have reason to celebrate as WWE’s flagship show went off the air. Find out how “The Best in the World at What He Does” got the better of The Lunatic Fringe, less than two weeks before their clash at WWE Payback. Plus, learn who advanced in the Semifinal Matches of the No. 1 Contenders’ Tag Team Tournament, sponsored by Booty-O’s.

In the aftermath of Raw’s main event bout pitting WWE World Heavyweight Champion Roman Reigns against Alberto Del Rio, Luke Gallows & Karl Anderson played the numbers game against The Big Dog — a game that became more difficult for Reigns when AJ Styles hit the ring. Will The Phenomenal One ensnare sports-entertainment’s grandest prize at WWE Payback, with his longtime friends at his back?

After AJ Styles, Luke Gallows and Karl Anderson defeated WWE World Heavyweight Champion Roman Reigns & The Usos in Raw’s main event, an intense chair-swinging melee culminated with The Big Dog tossing The Phenomenal One through the announce table. Will Styles suffer a similar fate in less than three weeks at Extreme Rules?

One week after Chris Jericho sadistically smashed Dean Ambrose’s prized plant over his head, The Lunatic Fringe got his share of retribution when he utterly destroyed Jericho’s iconic $15,000 light-up jacket. Plus, find out what happened during the tense steel chair standoff between WWE World Heavyweight Champion Roman Reigns and his Extreme Rules opponent, AJ Styles.

After The Usos defeated Luke Gallows and Karl Anderson in tag team action, WWE World Heavyweight Champion Roman Reigns and AJ Styles entered the fray, but The Phenomenal One stood triumphantly after laying out The Big Dog with a steel chair. Was this a sign of what the WWE Universe can expect this Sunday at Extreme Rules?

Kevin Owens, Dean Ambrose, Cesaro, Sami Zayn, and Chris Jericho qualified for this year’s Money in the Bank Ladder Match, where they’ll battle for the opportunity to cash in for a WWE World Heavyweight Championship Match at the time and place of their choosing. Also on Raw, the returning Seth Rollins learned he’ll challenge Roman Reigns for sports-entertainment’s most prestigious prize at WWE Money in the Bank!

After John Cena gave an impassioned Memorial Day address and gave his thoughts on the influx of new talent in WWE, AJ Styles welcomed the Cenation leader back to WWE before shockingly helping Luke Gallows and Karl Anderson lay out the 15-time World Champion. Has the reunited Club proven that there’s no place for Cena in WWE’s New Era?

By brutalizing Xavier Woods before the bell, AJ Styles transformed what was originally a six-man main event into a 2-on-3 battle pitting Kofi Kingston and Big E against all three members of The Club! Not content with merely defeating the WWE Tag Team Champions, The Phenomenal One, Luke Gallows and Karl Anderson continued their brutality after the match, but John Cena evened the odds and forced The Club to retreat. Will the Cenation leader keep Styles on the run as their WrestleMania-worthy dream match at WWE Money in the Bank approaches?

Live on Raw, John Cena presented AJ Styles with two separate contracts for their anticipated bout at WWE Money in the Bank: on one, The Phenomenal One could be accompanied to the ring by Luke Gallows and Karl Anderson, while the other stipulated that Styles' allies in The Club would be barred from ringside. Which did he choose?

After Roman Reigns and Seth Rollins’ Raw main event bout to determine WWE World Heavyweight Champion Dean Ambrose’s next challenger ended in a double count-out, The Lunatic Fringe revealed that he’d be willing to defend his title against both of his former Shield allies. At WWE Battleground, the onetime Hounds of Justice will clash in a Triple Threat Match for sports-entertainment’s grandest prize!

After WWE Champion Dean Ambrose defeated AJ Styles in Raw’s main event to keep the WWE Title bout at WWE Battleground a Triple Threat Match, Luke Gallows and Karl Anderson annihilated Cena with a Magic Killer on the stage while The Architect laid out The Lunatic Fringe with two Pedigrees. Will Cena and Ambrose attain retribution against their attackers?

Team U.S.A. clashed with The Multinational Alliance in Raw’s blockbuster Fourth of July main event. After a hard-fought bout, it was the endlessly determined Zack Ryder who picked up the big win for Old Glory. Find out how Long Island Iced-Z pulled it off.
