Dexter tries to figure out the Doomsday Killers' next victim before it's too late; Debra has a strong reaction to a crime scene, which leads her to the realization that she leans too heavily on her brother.

Dexter finds that in order to catch the Doomsday Killers, he must create a macabre tableau of his own; Debra's battle with LaGuerta over the case of the dead call girl boils over, and her therapist makes an unnerving suggestion.
Dexter and Homicide race against a lunar eclipse to catch the Doomsday Killers before their final gruesome act; Debra struggles with a new emotional reality.
After witnessing her brother kill, Debra attempts to reconcile with Dexter while struggling to cover up their involvement with the murder.
Miami Metro sets out to unearth new evidence on a claim from a local convict that he has new information regarding a 15-year-old crime spree; Debra tries to cure Dexter of his killer tendencies.
Dexter tries to bring Debra on board with his new target. While the Ukrainian mob seeks revenge for the killing of one of their own, Quinn grows close to a dancer at their strip club.

After capturing a deadly killer, things go awry for Miami Metro, sending Debra into a tailspin. In an effort to help his sister, Dexter enters into a dangerous game of cat and mouse, while the Ukrainian mob continues to seek revenge.

While trying to uncover why someone was killed on his boat, Dexter must out-maneuver a vengeful Isaak. New leads are brought to light on the Wayne Randall case by Hannah McKay, Randall's alluring former accomplice who Dexter discovers has a secret.

Debra gets to know a local crime writer who's dug up some incriminating dirt on Hannah McKay (Dexter's newest obsession). Quinn gets an offer he tries to refuse and Batista is drawn to a new business opportunity. LaGuerta keeps digging into the Bay Harbor Butcher case.

Quinn falls back into his old ways as he makes some questionable choices to protect Nadia. Things heat up as Dexter and Hannah grow closer, but when Sal Price discovers the two are involved, he wants the exclusive story.

Fresh out of jail, Isaak renews his pursuit of Dexter while Quinn continues his power struggle with the Koshkas. Dexter tries to keep Debra in the dark about his relationship with Hannah, but a surprise visit from Astor, Cody and Harrison throws a wrench into his plans.
As Dexter scrambles to track down Isaak, a power struggle erupts among the Koshka Brotherhood, which could prove to Dexter's advantage. Meanwhile, Miami Dade tries to smoke out the Phantom Arsonist.

Dexter is unnerved when Hannah's father pays him a surprise visit; the Phantom Arsonist's crimes become more vicious; and Quinn defends Nadia's honor and finds himself in a volatile situation. Meanwhile; LaGuerta asks a former superior for help on the Bay Harbor Butcher case.
As Christmas approaches, Dexter tries to balance his life with Hannah and his relationship with Debra. Dexter learns the man responsible for ordering his mother's death has been released from jail.
Dexter must protect himself when LaGuerta closes in on his secret.

It’s been 6 months since LaGuerta’s murder – and Dexter is still managing life as a dad, brother, and serial killer. Debra now works as a PI for a private firm and Batista has replaced her as Lieutenant. Meanwhile, Miami Metro investigates the murder of a man who has had pieces of his brain removed.

Miami Metro continues their hunt for the Brain Surgeon, while Dr. Vogel enlists Dexter to do her bidding based on her own personal experience with her previous patients. Debra continues to track down her PI case and has to take matters into her own hands.

Dexter continues his manhunt for the Brain Surgeon. Dr. Vogel tries to prove to Dexter that he’s perfect as a psychopath. Debra’s PTSD kicks in and she makes a desperate plea to confess to LaGuerta’s murder.

Dexter tracks down another potential serial killer from Dr. Vogel’s list. Quinn celebrates his passing of the Sergeant’s exam by defending Debra’s honor in a fight. Dr. Vogel begins treating Debra for her PTSD.
Dr. Vogel gets abducted by the Brain Surgeon, while Dexter and Debra try and rescue her. Masuka finds out he has a daughter.
Dexter monitors a young psychopath to see if he is suited for his table. Dexter and Debra finally get back to normal, but are surprised by his ex, Hannah.
Dexter hunts down Hannah to figure out why she’s back in Miami. Dexter also takes on a protégé and starts teaching him the Code.
Dexter tracks down his protégé in the belief that he murdered his neighbor. Meanwhile, Dexter tries to help Hannah escape the country.
Dexter investigates a murder that hits close to home. Meanwhile, Dr. Vogel gets the surprise of her life when someone from her past returns.
Dexter enlists Dr. Vogel's help to lure the Brain Surgeon to a location in order to get him on the table. Later, an important person in Dexter's life is murdered before his eyes.
Dexter is torn between fleeing the country with Hannah and Harrison, and taking Saxon out once and for all.
Dexter is faced with impossible odds as a brewing hurricane makes its way towards Miami.
Brilliant physicist roommates Leonard and Sheldon meet their new neighbor Penny, who begins showing them that as much as they know about science, they know little about actual living.
Leonard volunteers to sign for a package in an attempt to make a good impression on Penny, but when he enlists Sheldon for help, his attempt at chivalry goes terribly awry.
Leonard asks a woman out after he finds out that Penny is seeing someone.
Sheldon's getting fired forces him to explore what life has to offer outside physics, leaving Leonard to take drastic action to snap his friend out of his funk.
Fearing he's wasting his time on Penny, Leonard ends up making a connection with Leslie.
Penny hosts a Halloween party, putting Leonard, Sheldon, Wolowitz, and Koothrappali through a new test of their social skills.
With Wolowitz AWOL with one of her friends, Penny's recruited to fill in for him on the guys' Halo team
Raj's parents set him up on a blind date, but just when he discovers he can talk to her, she shows interest in Sheldon.
When they're invited to present at a physics conference, Sheldon's reluctance to share the credit leads to a tiff between him and Leonard, and Penny's intervention only exacerbates the situation.
Leonard and Sheldon each lie to avoid seeing Penny's concert, but Sheldon's is a bit too complicated for his own good.
With his friends knowing how sour he acts when sick—and avoiding him as a result—Sheldon is nursed by Penny, who hasn't a clue what she's in for.
With Sheldon rattled over meeting Dennis, a 15-year-old physicist who's smarter than he, Leonard helps him look for a way to debunk Dennis's research.
Sheldon finds himself booted from the gang's Physics Bowl team and replaced with Leslie, so he forms his own team, hoping to prove he's superior.
When delivery of another collectible leads to Penny's lashing out at Leonard, he decides it's time to give up his habit, much to his friends' protestation.
The rest of the gang fall for Sheldon's twin sister, and Leonard's plan to win her heart is derailed when Sheldon declares he'll be the one to decide who can date her.
Penny wants to throw a surprise party for Leonard, but Sheldon's indulgence at an electronics store throws her off-track.
Penny's break-up spurs Leonard to summon the courage to ask her out, and each goes to Sheldon for advice on their upcoming date.
Penny's first date with Leonard goes awry; Penny finds Sheldon to be an unwilling confidant.
A jealous Leonard reacts to Penny's new guy by rebounding with Leslie.
Sheldon creates a monster when he introduces Penny to online gaming.
Raj gets an inflated ego and makes a play for Penny after being referenced in a magazine article.
Leonard and his friends stage an intervention to force Sheldon to face his fear of driving.
Sheldon and the gang are confused when a young grad student is attracted to him.
When Sheldon bans Penny from the apartment for numerous minor infractions, she decides to retaliate.
Leonard inadvertently steals away the new woman Wolowitz thinks is the love of his life.
Sheldon is thrilled when Leonard starts dating a woman who meets Sheldon's stringent standards.
Leonard asks Penny for advice when his new relationship starts moving too fast.
Penny starts dating Leonard's handsome colleague; Leonard and his friends are tortured by Sheldon's obsession with gift-giving etiquette.
Penny's criticism of Wolowitz's romantic life pushes him into depression and AWOL for a fighting robot battle the rest of guys are depending on him for.
Sheldon creates a scientific procedure for making friends.
Sheldon's solution to Penny's financial difficulty leads to a confrontation between Leonard and Penny's ex-boyfriend.
Leonard and Penny are drawn together after a disastrous visit from Leonard's mother.
A paintball game leads to a fight between Sheldon and Penny, and romance for Leslie and Wolowitz.
Leonard, Sheldon and Wolowitz are ecstatic to learn that a famous science-fiction actress (Summer Glau) is on board the train they are taking to San Francisco.
Penny's home business turns into a complete nightmare when Sheldon takes over.
Penny squares off with a new beautiful female neighbor who may become the building's "new Penny."
A fellow comic book enthusiast's hitting on Penny leads to Leonard and Howard going to a bar's Ladies' Night.
Leonard and Koothrappali escort a heartbroken Wolowitz to Las Vegas, and Sheldon becomes locked out of his apartment and must stay with Penny.
Penny's second date with Stuart sees her making a comment that gives Leonard new hope for a relationship with her. Wolowitz realizes there's a crucial error in a NASA project he's working on.
The guys' plan to work over the summer at the North Pole makes Penny revaluate her feelings for Leonard.

When Sheldon learns the guys tampered with his expedition data he got from the arctic, he leaves to Texas in disgrace. This results in the guys following him, which threatens Leonard's hope for some romantic time with Penny and the guys' friendship with Sheldon.
Leonard and Penny struggle to recover from an awkward first hookup while Sheldon and Howard stake their best comic books on a bet to determine the species of a cricket.
Howard and Raj visit a Goth nightclub to pick up women while Sheldon attempts to build a better Penny using chocolate-based behavior modification.
Raj must find a new job or be sent back to India, but Sheldon has a solution, which leaves Leonard and Penny dealing with Howard as a third wheel.
After overhearing that Wil Wheaton is entering a trading-card competition, Sheldon decides to enter it himself. Meanwhile, Penny sets up one of her friends on a date with Wolowitz.
Sheldon becomes Leonard's teacher in order to understand football, while an incident with flying a kite threatens Howard and Raj's friendship.
A squabble between Leonard and Penny sees Sheldon playing mediator, though out of his own incovenience from the sitiation rather than altruism.
With Leonard, Howard and Raj away camping in the desert, an injured Penny has only Sheldon to rely on.
After he's humiliated on National Public Radio, Sheldon vows to destroy Kripke, while Wolowitz tries not to destroy his new relationship with Bernadette.
Penny gets help from Sheldon in order to understand what Leonard's work is, while Wolowitz develops a jealousy when Leonard starts hanging out with his new girlfriend.
A Christmas visit from his mother has Leonard discovering she's kept a lot of news from him that she shares with Sheldon and worrying if she'll approve of his romance with Penny.
Leonard is aghast to find out a secret of Penny's: she believes in psychics. Meanwhile, Sheldon tries to assist Koothrappali in picking up a girl at a university mixer.
When their apartment is robbed, Leonard and Sheldon turn to their friends to create a state-of-the-art security system.
Sheldon's search for the answer to a physics problem leads him to work at the Cheesecake Factory with Penny.
Leonard can only bring one guest on a trip to see CERN's Large Hadron Collider (the world's largest and highest energy particle accelerator) in Switzerland on Valentine's Day.
Sheldon winds up in traffic court when he gets a ticket because of Penny.
When the guys find a ring from "The Lord of the Rings" at a garage sale, it threatens to tear them apart.
Sheldon's friends come to his aid when his fear of public speaking stands between him and a coveted award.
A fight between Leonard and Penny threatens their relationship, while Sheldon battles Wil Wheaton in bowling.
When Leonard and Penny aren't speaking, Sheldon goes to extremes to keep them both happy.
Leonard and Sheldon compete for the attention of a famous female physicist.
Leonard tells Penny about how he met Sheldon for the first time...and what happened to the elevator.
While Penny worries that dating Leonard has ruined her for normal guys, Wolowitz and Koothrappali search for Sheldon's perfect match online.
Penny tags along on Sheldon's first ever date; Wolowitz finds a new use for a robotic arm.
Realizing he will not live long enough to download his consciousness into a robot body, Sheldon tries to extend his life span.
The guys are concerned as Sheldon searches for an alternative to human companionship.
An embarrassing secret of Wolowitz's comes to light, while Sheldon and Raj have a small war at work.
Leonard realizes he’s the only one without a girlfriend, while Sheldon wants to get rid of his.
Leonard keeps an affair a secret from Sheldon, Howard and Raj.
Sheldon's answers during an FBI interview put Wolowitz's security clearance in jeopardy.
While the guys camp in line for a long-awaited movie screening, Penny and Bernadette invite Amy to her first slumber party.
Penny asks Leonard to lie to her father, while Howard, Raj and Bernadette pull an all-nighter at a telescope.
Amy finds she has sexual feelings for Penny's ex, while Koothrappali and Wolowitz try to prove who would be the better superhero.
The guys find a "super" use for Penny's new boyfriend, Zack, when they enter a costume contest as the Justice League.
Leonard's idea for a smartphone app derails his friendship with Sheldon.
Bernadette runs into her ex-boyfriend while attending a science event with Wolowitz.
Hoping it will make him a better teacher, Sheldon has Penny give him acting lessons. Raj has fantasies about a friend's girlfriend.
A wealthy donor to the university makes Leonard consider how far he's willing to go for the sake of science.
As Wolowitz contemplates taking things with Bernadette to the next level, Leonard rekindles his relationship with Raj's sister.
Sheldon becomes concerned when everybody begins to hang out at Raj's apartment and discovers Leonard is the center of the group.
Sheldon is baffled by Wolowitz's magic trick. Meanwhile, Leonard realizes dating Priya may make it impossible to continue being friends with Penny.

Sheldon's online-game account is hacked by Todd Zarnecki, who then proceeds to steal all his items prompting the guys to go on a quest to retrieve them.  Penny, Bernadette and Amy discuss how Penny groomed Leonard to be willing to try various things and more adventurous boyfriend... for some other woman — Priya.
Sheldon and Amy decide to start several rumors about the others as a test. Meanwhile, Howard takes his relationship with Bernadette to even higher level.

When Leonard spends too much time in the shower with Priya, Sheldon charges Leonard with two violations of the roommate agreement. However, before he can get too far, Priya uses her skills as a lawyer to nullify the charges due to the agreement's vague wording, much to Sheldon's dismay. When the guys take advantage of Priya's skills in order to eat Greek food on pizza night, Sheldon goes to Penny, who invites him to a girls' night out with Amy and Bernadette, which Sheldon agrees to after Penny mentions that they may be talking trash about Priya. After the girls drink some cocktails, they decide to take Sheldon dancing, which Sheldon reluctantly goes along with. After dancing, Sheldon takes an intoxicated Amy back to her apartment and as well as talking about Priya, meets a monkey who is addicted to smoking cigarettes. Amy tells Sheldon not to give in to Priya's law skills, before kissing him and going to her bathroom to vomit.
Raj attempts to cure his social anxiety disorder while Penny uses Bernadette to spy on Leonard and his girlfriend.
When Howard finally breaks the news to his mom that he's engaged to Bernadette, it lands her in the hospital.
When Bernadette receives her PhD, Wolowitz feels emasculated. Raj and Leonard swap places and Penny does something she's regrets.
Penny is worried with how damaged her friendship with the guys will be in the aftermath of her sleeping with Raj while Sheldon becomes the leader of the paintball team.
A fight between Sheldon and Penny leaves Amy caught in the middle, while Leonard tries to spice up his long-distance relationship with Priya.
Leonard and Amy get to know each other better, while Howard and Bernadette spend the weekend with Mrs. Wolowitz.
Penny plays Matchmaker for Raj, which results in him finding a girl he is comfortable talking to.
Sheldon and Leonard get invited to a party at Wil Wheaton's house, and Howard gets an out-of-this-world opportunity.
Sheldon's mother, Mary Cooper, comes to visit, but Sheldon is annoyed that she also spends time with the rest of the gang, instead of catering to his every demand.
A cute comic book artist puts Leonard and Priya’s relationship to the test, while Sheldon tries to scare the guys for Halloween.
Amy becomes heartbroken when she discovers that Penny and Bernadette went wedding dress shopping without her.

Leonard and Penny try hanging out as friends on a 'non-date', but end up purposely ruining each others chances with perspective dates. Meanwhile, Sheldon enlists the help of Bernadette and Amy to overcome his fear of birds.
When Stuart asks Amy out on a date, Sheldon must confront his feelings and consider where his relationship with Amy is going.
Leonard must face his fears after being contacted by his high school tormentor.
Sheldon gets in trouble with Amy when he isn't impressed by her recent accomplishment, and Howard must come to grips with Bernadette's dislike of children.
Leonard, who broke up with Priya, asks Penny out to a spur-of the-moment romantic dinner for two, and the duo contemplates on their relationship.

Leonard and Penny deal with the idea of starting a relationship again and Raj finally finds a "woman" he can talk to without being drunk, in the form of Siri on his new phone. Meanwhile, Sheldon decides to start a YouTube series entitled "Sheldon Cooper presents Fun with Flags" with the help of Amy.
Sheldon's selfish demands force Leonard to reconsider their friendship. Meanwhile, Wolowitz tries to pick his astronaut nickname.
When Sheldon is forced to take his vacation, he goes to work with Amy in her neurobiology lab.
Sheldon battles Kripke for a coveted office at the university. Penny receives a very unusual gift from Amy.
Sheldon becomes agitated when his regular barber is out sick. Astronaut training causes Howard to reconsider wanting to go into space. Penny beats Leonard in chess, the first time she plays.
Sheldon must choose between joining Amy at her aunt's birthday party or playing videogames all weekend with the guys.

Penny buys Leonard and Sheldon “Star Trek” collectibles as a thank-you, leading Sheldon to be haunted by Mr. Spock. Meanwhile, Raj decides he has met the “Future Mrs. Koothrappali” after his parents set him up on a date.
When Wolowitz gets to work with Stephen Hawking, Sheldon is willing to do anything to meet his hero.
After the guys throw Howard a bachelor party, Bernadette reconsiders marrying him after learning about his sexual history.
When NASA moves up Howard's mission, he must face his fears and Bernadette's dad, thus putting the wedding plans in jeopardy. Meanwhile, Leonard says something surprising to Penny in the bedroom.

The fifth season ends with Howard and Bernadette deciding to get married before his NASA mission, causing the gang to scurry into overdrive in an effort to stage the wedding. NASA astronaut Mike Massimino has a cameo as himself.
With his friends on dates, Raj must face his loneliness. Also, Wolowitz is caught in an argument between Bernadette and his mom, even while he’s in space.
When Sheldon learns that Penny is thinking about breaking up with Leonard, he tries to intervene. Meanwhile, in space, the other astronauts pick on Howard.
Amy feels threatened when Sheldon hires a young female assistant, and the pressure of being in space takes its toll on Wolowitz.
When Wolowitz returns from space, he doesn’t get the hero’s welcome he expected. Meanwhile, Game Night turns into a battle of the sexes.
The gang celebrates Halloween at Stuart’s comic book store. Meanwhile, Leonard seduces Penny with science.
Sheldon’s relationship with Stephen Hawking is threatened over a game of “Words with Friends,” and Penny secretly enrolls in a class at the local college.
Wolowitz struggles with moving out of his mother’s house. Meanwhile, Sheldon is caught in the middle of an argument between Amy and Wil Wheaton.
Raj and Howard try to to figure out why Sheldon disappears at 2:45 every afternoon; jealousy arises in Penny and Leonard's relationship.
When the University reassigns Sheldon’s parking spot to Wolowitz, their fight affects the whole gang.
When Amy gets sick, Sheldon tries to nurse her back to health; Wolowitz and his father-in-law plan a fishing trip.
During a Dungeons and Dragons game, Sheldon revisits Christmas memories; Amy, Penny and Bernadette look for a date for Raj.
When Sheldon is accused of sexual harassment, he ends up getting Raj, Leonard and Howard in trouble.
As the guys don costumes and go on a road trip to a comic book convention, the ladies decide to stay home and try to interpret a comic book.
Sheldon faces a crisis of confidence when he is forced to work with his nemesis, Barry Kripke; Raj and Howard buy expensive action figures of themselves.
A fight between Sheldon and Leonard impacts Amy and Penny's living arrangements; while Howard is away, Raj helps Mrs. Wolowitz out.
The guys search for a perfect Valentine's Day gift for their significant others; Stuart and Raj host a "lonely people" party at the comic book store.
After a bad date, Koothrappali decides to never leave his apartment; Penny's acting skills impress Sheldon.
Leonard, Sheldon and Howard give lectures on science to junior high students. The girls ditch work to go to Disneyland. Raj devises a date for Lucy that fixes their social anxiety problems.
Howard considers whether or not he should open a letter from his father; Penny and Leonard host a "grown-up" cocktail party.
The girls get involved when Leonard, Sheldon and Raj compete for tenure at the University.
Amy tries to help Sheldon get over his compulsive need for closure when one of his favorite TV shows is canceled; Raj discovers a secret about Lucy.
Leonard and Sheldon hire the host (Bob Newhart) of their favorite childhood TV show to perform; Bernadette and Howard run into trouble while dog-sitting for Raj's pet.

A date between Raj and Lucy takes both of them out of their comfort zones. After a trip to Las Vegas goes awry, the girls join in on a Dungeons and Dragons game, which causes Amy and Sheldon to re-evaluate their relationship.
When Leonard receives an exciting opportunity to work overseas, Penny and Sheldon are thrown for a loop. Raj and Lucy's relationship comes to a crossroad.
With Leonard away, Sheldon and Penny spend quality time together sharing intimate secrets. Also, Wolowitz helps Raj get over his ex-girlfriend.
Leonard and Sheldon's friendship is tested; Howard's latest foray into helping his mother has some disastrous side effects.
When the entire gang competes in a scavenger hunt designed by Raj, it brings out the best - and worst - in everyone.
Sheldon gets mad at Amy for ruining one of his favorite movies, Raj and Stuart try to make their online dating profiles more appealing, and Leonard tries to play the sympathy card with Penny.
Amy starts working at Caltech which causes friction with Sheldon. Howard agrees with Sheldon who mentions this to Bernadette causing a big fight for the Wolowitzes.
Sheldon's latest scientific breakthrough leaves him feeling like a fraud; a romantic gesture between Howard and Bernadette causes Penny to up her game with Leonard.
Sheldon seeks payback when Arthur "Professor Proton" Jeffries asks Leonard for help on a project instead of him. Raj gets upset at Howard for crashing his night with the girls.
When a mistake comes to light, Sheldon makes Leonard walk a mile in his shoes; Penny decides to confront Raj's ex-girlfriend, Lucy.
Sheldon protests when the gang drags him to Mrs. Wolowitz’s house for Thanksgiving.  Meanwhile, Penny and Leonard must deal with a mistake from her past.
Leonard has to deal with the fallout of disproving Sheldon's new scientific discovery. Raj spends a week at Howard and Bernadette's apartment.
While Sheldon is at home in Texas, the rest of the gang realizes how much he has changed their lives as they decorate the apartment Christmas tree.

When Penny’s big acting break on NCIS is a bust, Leonard struggles to help her, which results in Penny asking Leonard a bold relationship question. Meanwhile, Raj and Stuart try to practice their social skills, and Sheldon navigates the intricacies of being funny.

Sheldon tries to relax after he is forced to take a vacation. Meanwhile, Leonard struggles to be supportive of Penny after she quits her job, and Bernadette seeks Stuart’s help in replacing one of Howard’s comic books. Also, Amy receives an unwanted attention from a co-worker.

After the guys can’t get Comic-Con tickets, Sheldon tries to hold his own convention and winds up spending a wild night with James Earl Jones. Meanwhile, the girls try to feel more mature by going to a fancy hotel for tea.
Sheldon and Amy take a train ride to Napa Valley with Howard and Bernadette on Valentine's Day. Leonard and Penny take Raj's dog to the vet when she accidentally eats some chocolate.

Leonard buys a dining room table and it causes Sheldon to reevaluate the changes in his life. Meanwhile, Wolowitz is offered a chance to go back to space and Bernadette struggles with whether or not to encourage him.

After arguing with Sheldon, Howard tries to make amends by taking him to NASA headquarters in Houston. Penny has second thoughts about quitting her waitressing job when her car dies. Amy gets involved in trying to find Raj a date.
When Sheldon visits his Mom in Houston, he is forced to confront a new reality. Meanwhile, Raj’s ‘Murder Mystery’ party starts some fights within the gang.
While Raj is wracked with guilt when he tries to date two women at once, Penny wrestles with whether to take a role in a cheesy movie and Sheldon is torn trying to choose between two gaming systems.
Sheldon faces a personal crisis after deciding he’s wasting his time with string theory. Meanwhile, a double date between Raj, Emily and the Wolowitzes ends in embarrassment for Howard.
To prepare for a date with Emily, Howard acclimates Raj to horror movies. Penny and Sheldon are upset when they discover Amy and Bernadette lied to avoid hanging out with them.
As the gang celebrates Star Wars Day, Sheldon has difficulty dealing with the recent death of Arthur "Professor Proton" Jeffries.
A bad day causes Penny to reevaluate her life choices – including Leonard. Meanwhile, Howard and Bernadette struggle to care for Mrs. Wolowitz, and Raj gets relationship advice from Sheldon.

Sheldon get upset about his career, the destruction of the comic book store and Leonard and Penny's future living arrangements. Howard and Bernadette can't keep hold of a caretaker for his mother. With his entire world changing around him, Sheldon considers a major move.
Leonard and Amy make an unexpected trip to Arizona to fetch Sheldon; Penny interviews for a job at Bernadette's company; Stuart's relationship with Mrs. Wolowitz disturbs Howard.
Sheldon is forced to teach a class as a Junior Professor and Howard decides to enroll in it. Meanwhile, Amy plays both sides when tension arises between Penny and Bernadette.
Wolowitz feels nervous when he is asked to throw the first pitch at a Los Angeles Angels game. Penny and Leonard want to prove Sheldon wrong after he says he and Amy are the better couple.
Raj's honesty comes back to haunt him when his new girlfriend is unfriendly to Penny. The guys think about becoming part owners in Stuart's store.
The girls head to Las Vegas for some weekend fun, while the guys try to invent something cool, but only come up with new ways to procrastinate.

Sheldon and Raj test whether they could survive a dark-matter research expedition in a salt mine by simulating the conditions in a steam tunnel deep underground. Meanwhile, Leonard and Penny seek advice from Howard and Bernadette after they fight about money.

The guys try to help Penny out of an awkward work dilemma, when a smitten doctor shows up at her door after her flirtatious sales techniques work a little too well. Meanwhile, Amy and Bernadette argue over whether or not female scientists should play up their sexuality.
The girls decide to re-enact their high school proms with the guys. While Sheldon feels under pressure to commit to his relationship with Amy, Howard worries about who Stuart will bring as his date.
When Leonard gets minor surgery on his nose, Sheldon is the one in need of sympathy. Meanwhile, Raj's parents' impending divorce causes Howard and Bernadette to work on their own marriage.

While Sheldon says a tearful goodbye to the final installment of "Fun with Flags", Leonard, Howard and Raj search for something significant in a dead professor's research. And Bernadette finds out what her colleagues really think of her.

Leonard and Howard turn to Raj for help in dealing with a work emergency when they nearly come to blows after blaming each other for a potential disaster at the university. Amy throws an authentic Victorian Christmas party, while Sheldon seeks revenge on her for making him celebrate the holidays.
Howard tries to distract Raj, who is anxiously awaiting data from a space probe he helped launch. Meanwhile, Sheldon and Leonard go dress shopping with Penny and Amy.
When Sheldon becomes stuck in a rut with his work, the gang tries to help him by raising his stress levels. Howard teases Raj with a game called "Emily or Cinnamon?"
Leonard and Sheldon publish a paper which is widely accepted except for comments from an internet troll. Meanwhile, the girls reminisce about embarrassing incidents from their past.

Howard receives some shocking news as everyone prepares for the reopening of Stuart’s comic book store. Penny teaches Sheldon how to “let it go,” but can’t follow her own advice after she learns something infuriating about Amy. Also, Leonard and Raj think they spot Nathan Fillion at a restaurant.

As a joke, Sheldon and Penny try an experiment designed to make participants fall in love. Meanwhile, Leonard, Amy, Raj and Emily spend the evening trying to escape a room with a “zombie.” And, after returning from Mrs. Wolowitz’ funeral, Bernadette and Howard run into trouble at the airport.

A trip to the pet store ends in a fight after Amy learns Sheldon has applied for a one-way mission to colonize Mars. Meanwhile, Leonard surprises Penny with a very "adult" purchase, and Raj gets into trouble when he snoops around Emily's apartment.
Friction ensues when a magazine fails to mention Leonard in an article about the paper he co-wrote with Sheldon. Also, a blackout at Mrs. Wolowitz’s home leads to a final family dinner in her honor.

When Leonard and Sheldon are invited to speak at UC Berkeley, they take a detour to try to meet an idol. Also, when Bernadette and Howard battle over the fate of his Doctor Who TARDIS, Raj and Amy offer to settle the dispute with a game of ping pong.

When Sheldon and Amy build a blanket fort, they come to major crossroads in their relationship. Also, Howard meets the half-brother he never knew he had. Meanwhile, Penny is invited to appear on Wil Wheaton’s podcast, but things turn awkward when Leonard joins them.

When Raj is asked to create a message in case a NASA mission discovers alien life, the guys fight over what he should do. Also, Penny is torn between auditioning for a movie or keeping her successful pharmaceutical sales job.

Howard questions his engineering abilities when he and Sheldon can’t get a toy drone to fly. Meanwhile, a cancelled flight nearly prevents Leonard from giving the commencement address at his former high school, and Raj pits his parents against each other when his father cuts him off financially.

Personalities collide when Sheldon and Leonard’s mothers finally meet. Meanwhile, Howard finally decides to “man up” and do his fair share of the housework – but not without a little help from his friends.

As Sheldon presses Leonard and Penny to set a wedding date, he encounters major changes in his own relationship with Amy. Meanwhile, Raj contemplates breaking up with Emily, and Howard and Bernadette struggle with asking Stuart to move out of their house.
After driving to Vegas to get married, Penny struggles with Leonard’s confession that he kissed another girl. Also, Sheldon doesn't know how to act after Amy pushes pause on their relationship.

Leonard confronts the woman he kissed on the North Sea in an attempt to set Penny's mind at ease. Also, Sheldon films a special episode of "Fun with Flags" after his breakup with Amy, and Bernadette feels guilty about withholding a secret from Penny.

The guys' science skills are put to the test when they get a flat tire during Leonard's bachelor party weekend in Mexico. Also, the girls force Penny to finally tell her family that she eloped with Leonard.

Sheldon learns of an impending change in his living arrangements and decides to revert back to 2003, a simpler time before he met Leonard and Penny. Also, Howard and Raj form a band to play at the Comic Book Store.

The guys take a fencing lesson from Barry Kripke and Sheldon finds himself in an awkward position when Kripke expresses interest in Amy. Also, when Stuart struggles to get female customers at the Comic Book Store, Penny, Amy and Bernadette come by to help him out.

In the midst of a nation-wide helium shortage, Sheldon and Leonard take desperate measures to get the supplies they need. Also, Penny and Bernadette download a dating app on Amy's phone to try and find her a new man.

Wil Wheaton interviews Sheldon for a Star Trek documentary where he reveals the ring and his plan to propose to Amy.  Bernadette wants to start renovating the house and the topic of starting a family together with Howard is brought up.

Sheldon, Wolowitz and Koothrappali post an online advertisement to find Sheldon a new girlfriend. Also, when Amy is coy with details about a guy she is dating, Penny and Bernadette decide to spy on her.

Sheldon and Amy try hanging out as friends when they spend Thanksgiving together at the aquarium. Also, Wolowitz reluctantly agrees to volunteer at the soup kitchen with Bernadette, Raj and Emily, and Penny discovers that Leonard knows more about her than she thought.

Sheldon has a revelation when he realizes why a song was stuck in his head. Also, Amy invites Dave over for dinner despite their previously awkward date, and Wolowitz and Koothrappali become obsessed with a fan of their band, "Footprints on the Moon".
After more than five years of dating, Sheldon and Amy spend their first night together. Also, Leonard, Wolowitz, and Koothrappali must decide who will take their extra Star Wars movie ticket.

Penny gets more than she bargained for when Leonard agrees to meet with a psychiatrist on her behalf. Also, Sheldon and Koothrappali collaborate on an astronomical discovery, and Wolowitz and Bernadette can't believe what they are feeling after Stuart moves out.
After having to deal with a sick Sheldon, Leonard, Penny and the gang try to treat themselves to a Sheldon-free weekend.
Meemaw meets Amy, but it isn't all roses. Meemaw seems to have an axe to grind with her. Sheldon comes to Amy's defense, but not before Meemaw lets a little secret of his slip.

Sheldon and Amy host a live Valentine's Day episode of Fun with Flags, Leonard and Penny grapple with getting older, Howard and Bernadette find a surprise in their hot tub and Raj is torn between Emily and the cute girl he met at the Comic Bookstore.

When the gang finds out about Bernadette’s pregnancy, they celebrate by  singing karaoke. Also, Bernadette is concerned when Wolowitz freaks out  over her pregnancy announcement, and Wolowitz is convinced he must make  more money to provide for the baby.
After more than nine years together, the gang finally celebrates Sheldon’s birthday, surprising him with a special guest.

Leonard, Sheldon, and Wolowitz run into problems when they file for a patent for their infinite persistence gyroscope. Also, Penny, Amy and Bernadette give Koothrappali dating advice when Emily reaches out to him after their breakup.

Amy is shocked at a revelation from Sheldon after she buys him a new laptop. Also, Koothrappali sells out Leonard and Wolowitz after they lie to their wives in order to attend an early screening of a movie.

Sheldon spills a secret of Leonard’s when the two take a weekend cabin  trip with Penny and Amy. Also, when Koothrappali goes overboard with  pregnancy gifts, Wolowitz and Bernadette must draw the line.
Everyone must choose sides when a small argument between Leonard and  Sheldon erupts into a heated fight during a group get-together.

The gang goes to a wine bar and runs into Penny’s old boyfriend, Zack. Also, Bernadette gets stuck spending the evening with Sheldon when she can’t go wine tasting with the group, and things don’t go as planned when Koothrappali introduces his new girlfriend, Claire.
Sheldon hires Stuart to spend the day with Amy when he’d rather go to a movie screening. Also, Leonard’s mother, Beverly, comes to town and Penny struggles to make a connection with her.

Chaos ensues when Leonard’s recently divorced parents, Alfred and Beverly, and Sheldon’s devoutly religious mother, Mary, come to town. Also, Wolowitz and Koothrappali think the government is out to get them when they are contacted about their guidance system.

After Sheldon’s mother and Leonard's father share an evening together, everyone deals with an awkward morning the next day. Also, Penny’s family arrives for the wedding ceremony, including her anxiety-ridden mother, Susan, and her drug dealing brother, Randall.
Colonel Williams, an Air Force representative from the Department of Material Command sits down to talk with Wolowitz.

Tensions rise when the boys struggle to complete their government project on time and Sheldon tries an energy drink to stay awake. Also, Penny and Amy go to a “party” at Bert the geologist’s house, and Koothrappali learns Bernadette’s true feelings about her pregnancy when they clean out the future baby room.
When Amy’s apartment floods, she proposes a “cohabitation experiment” with Sheldon. Also, Howard and Bernadette are upset when Koothrappali learns the gender of the baby before they do.

Leonard and Penny must separate a quarreling Sheldon and Amy when their cohabitation does not go as planned, and Sheldon threatens to break off their relationship when Amy refuses to adhere to the bathroom schedule. Also, Howard and Bernadette find unexpected guests at their house when they decide to stay home from a planned vacation.

Penny is surprised to learn she has fans of her performance in "Serial Ape-ist" when she attends Van Nuys Comic Con with Leonard. Also, Amy hosts a Sheldon-style brunch at Penny’s apartment, and Wolowitz makes an impulsive purchase when he starts stressing out about the baby on the way.

In order to continue living with Sheldon, Amy lies to him about repairs being made to her apartment and they host an "on location" episode of "Fun With Flags" in Penny’s apartment. Also, Leonard lets Penny decorate Sheldon’s old room after he learns that she has been secretly moving Leonard’s collectibles into storage.

After a successful experiment combining their genes, Sheldon will stop at nothing to convince Amy they should procreate. Also, Koothrappali is embarrassed to tell the gang what the new woman he’s dating does for a living.
When Bert, a Caltech geologist, wins the MacArthur Genius fellowship, Sheldon is overcome with jealousy. Also, Wolowitz finds an old remote control Stephen Hawking action figure he invented.
Sheldon and Leonard try to divvy up their shared belongings, but can’t agree on anything. Also, Koothrappali and Stuart fight to be the most helpful during Bernadette’s final weeks of pregnancy.
Howard and Bernadette welcome their new baby and Sheldon and Amy celebrate Amy’s birthday.
Sheldon and Amy visit Leonard and Penny for the first time since the holidays and share details about their terrible trip to Texas.
When Penny feels that Leonard is taking her for granted, she decides to go on a spa weekend with Amy. Also, Wolowitz and Koothrappali try to fix a squeaky floorboard in the baby’s room.

Sheldon beta-tests an MIT invention after hearing it can help him read people’s emotions. Also, Leonard can’t hide his feelings when Penny announces her brother is coming to town, and Raj invites his ex-girlfriends over to give him dating advice.

Leonard and Wolowitz try to distract Sheldon when he slows the progress of their guidance system. Also, Penny and Amy take Bernadette out for the night, leaving Raj and Stuart to care for baby Halley.
Sheldon and Amy have their first fight since moving in together, and Koothrappali is shocked at the realities of financial independence when he stops receiving support from his father.
With Koothrappali cut off from his father’s fortune, he appoints Sheldon to help him get out of debt. Also, Penny considers joining Leonard at Comic-Con.
When Raj moves out of his apartment, Leonard and Penny offer him Sheldon's old room.
Leonard, Penny and Raj adjust to their new living arrangement, and Sheldon takes an interest in Amy’s work.

Sheldon pushes himself to the limit when he collaborates on projects with Leonard and Wolowitz as well as Amy on the same day. Also, Bernadette is nearing the end of her maternity leave and must return to work.
Howard and Bernadette have a hard time leaving Halley in day care when Bernadette returns to work. Also, Bert introduces the gang to his new girlfriend, Rebecca.
Leonard isn’t thrilled when Penny considers taking a new job offered by her ex-boyfriend, Zack.

After Leonard, Sheldon and Wolowitz celebrate the completion of the top secret air force project, they are met with an unpleasant surprise. Also, Amy is offered a summer position as a visiting researcher.
The gang is concerned when Sheldon’s former admirer, Dr. Ramona Nowitzki, resurfaces while Amy is away at Princeton.
In the eleventh season opener, Amy gives Sheldon an answer to his proposal while Howard and Bernadette struggle with some unexpected news.
Leonard angers the university – and the entire physics community – after he gives an embarrassing interview. Also, Amy and Bernadette bond over having to hide their success from Sheldon and Howard.

Sheldon and Amy struggle with picking a wedding date, which stresses out Sheldon and causes him talking in his sleep. Meanwhile, Raj and Stuart fight over the attention of one of Bernadette's co-workers.
As Howard worries about fatherhood, he and Sheldon bond when they jointly assemble a model rocket. Meanwhile, Penny bonds with Leonard's mother, Beverly, much to his concern.

Sheldon and Raj confide in Bernadette when they can't handle Amy and Howard working together on a science project. Also, Penny and Leonard learn new tactics for how to deal with Sheldon from an unlikely source.
Sheldon goes head-to-head with Wil Wheaton for the role of the new Professor Proton. Also, Penny steps in to take care of Halley when Bernadette and Howard both wind up on bed rest.
Sheldon and Bert collaborate on a research project, despite Sheldon’s embarrassment. Also, Penny and Bernadette coach Raj on how to navigate his relationship with Ruchi.

Leonard and Howard are furious after they learn Sheldon went to work with the military behind their backs. Also, while Bernadette is on bed rest, she asks Raj to do some digging when she suspects that Ruchi might be trying to take over her projects at work.
Sheldon tries to teach the guys a lesson after they cut him out of a potentially valuable Bitcoin investment. Also, a seven-year-old video reveals a secret about Leonard and Penny's relationship.
Sheldon and Amy try to eliminate stress from wedding planning by applying math to the process. Also, Raj “breaks up” with Howard after realizing his best friend is actually hurting his confidence.

Raj and Howard's feud continues as the gang plan Halley's first birthday party. Sheldon's surprise for Amy's birthday goes awry when they get food poisoning. Also, Leonard gets a Christmas letter from his brother that causes him to spiral out about his own lack of accomplishments.
Sheldon and Amy try to pick their Best-Man and Maid of Honor by experimenting on the gang.

When Sheldon kicks Amy out to work solo, she and Leonard bond during a series of science experiments. Also, Bert the geologist replaces Wolowitz in the band Footprints on the Moon, and Sheldon finds Penny a surprising source of scientific inspiration.

Raj finds himself in the middle of domestic drama when he learns the woman he's dating, has a very upset husband. Also, when Sheldon rents his old room back for a quiet place to work, he drives Leonard crazy by being a model tenant.
Leonard's book raises questions, and Amy guest stars on the new Professor Proton show.
When Bernadette won't go into labor, the gang tries different tactics to get things started. Also, Howard confronts Bernadette after Amy accidentally reveals she's already chosen their son's name.

Leonard jumps through hoops to help secure the perfect wedding venue for Sheldon and Amy. Also, Bernadette and Howard have a hard time deciding who should stay at home with the kids and who should go back to work.
Bill Gates visits Penny's work, and the gang schemes to meet him. Hilarity ensues. Meanwhile, Sheldon is convinced that he's a target of an April's Fools prank.

When Leonard learns Sheldon is the president of the tenants association, he decides to run against him. Also, Bernadette encourages Howard and Raj to find the owner of a drone after they find it in the backyard.

A brilliant but reclusive scientist, Doctor Wolcott, invites Sheldon to his cabin in the middle of nowhere, and Leonard, Raj and Howard go along for the trip. Also, Penny and Bernadette improvise after Amy doesn’t like the tame bachelorette party they planned for her.
Sheldon’s comic book store experiences changes when writer Neil Gaiman puts Stuart’s store on the map. Also, friendships are threatened when Raj takes credit for Penny's astronomical discovery.
Sheldon goes to Vegas to win money for science. Also, Penny and Bernadette take Amy wedding dress shopping, but her terrible choice entangles them in a web of lies.

When Sheldon learns that his mother won’t attend his wedding unless he invites his brother, Georgie, he and Leonard travel to Texas to end a family feud. Also, the Wolowitz kids inadvertently infest Amy, Bernadette, Howard and Raj with pinkeye.
When Amy's parents and Sheldon's family arrive, everybody is focused to make sure all wedding arrangements go according to plan – everyone except the bride and groom.
Sheldon and Amy's honeymoon runs aground in New York. Penny and Leonard discover they are uncomfortably similar to Amy's parents. Raj insults physicist Neil deGrasse Tyson and starts a Twitter war.

Sheldon and Amy drive themselves crazy trying to figure out what 'perfect gift' Leonard and Penny gave them for their wedding. Raj decides he wants to settle down and asks his father to arrange a marriage for him.
The Wolowitzes' life gets complicated when Stuart starts bringing his new girlfriend home. Also, Penny and Leonard talk about starting a family, while Raj explores an arranged marriage.

When Sheldon won't tell anyone why he's never mentioned his childhood best friend, Leonard takes matters into his own hands. Bernadette and Penny take out Raj’s fiancée for dinner to get the skinny on her.

When Amy doesn’t have time to work on super-asymmetry, Sheldon goes to great lengths to ensure she’s available to work with him even it if means accidentally sabotaging her career in the process. Raj doesn’t want Howard to join him in hosting a show at the planetarium.
When Howard dresses up as Sheldon for Halloween, Sheldon seeks retaliation at Leonard and Penny's Halloween party. Leonard is shocked that Penny doesn't remember their first kiss.
Leonard is caught between a rock and a hard place when he's responsible for distributing extra grant money. Bernadette turns the backyard playhouse into a hideaway from Howard and the kids.

Sheldon tries to bond with Amy's father, but when Howard lures Mr. Fowler away with magic tricks, Sheldon has no choice but to bond with Mrs. Fowler. Raj and Anu try to get physical for the first time.

Sheldon and Amy are devastated after learning from a Russian paper that Super Asymmetry has already been theorized and disproven. Meanwhile, ultra-competitive Bernadette asks Stuart’s girlfriend to teach her how to beat Howard in a popular video game.

Sheldon and Amy are still down about their theory being disproven, but a VHS tape from Sheldon’s past inspires him not to give up. Bernadette turns into a pageant mom when she tries to help Howard ace his Magic Castle audition.

Penny and Leonard organize a paintball game that results in mayhem when Sheldon is jealous of Amy. Also, Raj catches Anu with her ex-boyfriend, and Stuart gets cold feet when Denise hints at the possibility of them living together.

Penny runs into her ex-boyfriend, Zack, who invites her and Leonard to a dinner to meet his newlywed wife. After the dinner the newlywed couple make an odd proposition to Leonard, which makes Penny to freak out. Also, Raj attempts to mend things with his ex-fiancée, Anu.

Sheldon and Amy are thrilled when their super asymmetry theory is proven by two physicists, until they try to kick Amy off the Nobel nomination. Also, Bernadette gets one of her drugs approved at work and wants a reluctant Penny to head the sales team.

Sheldon is thrilled to help Bernadette and Wolowitz navigate bureaucratic paperwork, until he discovers they are breaking the law. Also, Leonard is disappointed when his friends exclude him from a scientific project.

Penny tries to seduce an abstaining Leonard to ruin his "donation" for her ex-boyfriend, Zack, and his wife, Marissa. Also, Wolowitz, Bernadette, Anu and Koothrappali turn Koothrappali's canceled bachelor party into a couple's trip.

The gang finds out Wil Wheaton hosts a celebrity Dungeons and Dragons game involving William Shatner, Joe Manganiello, Kareem Abdul-Jabbar and Kevin Smith. Deception and betrayal are the path to make it to the one open seat.

When Penny and Bernadette go to San Diego for a pharmaceutical sales convention, Wolowitz is in charge of the kids. Also, Sheldon finds a book on experimenting on kids, and the guys plus Amy make a day of it.

When competitors Pemberton and Campbell charm America on a publicity tour, Sheldon and Amy try to bring Nobel laureates Kip Thorne, George Smoot and Frances Arnold to their side. Also, Halley's fear of the dark causes opportunity and conflict at the Wolowitz home.

The concept of what it would mean for women everywhere if Amy were to win a Nobel Prize causes Amy to have a meltdown. Also, Howard and Raj try to relive the good old days after Howard buys a scooter that looks like the one he had years ago.

Raj is worried people won’t take him seriously in his own field after publishing a paper that suggests he may have discovered alien life. Also, Leonard wants to be the principal investigator on a plasma physics study.

Kripke has proof that Dr. Pemberton plagiarized his thesis in college, and Sheldon and Amy aren't sure if they should turn him in or not. Meanwhile, Howard learns that Bernadette wasn't the only waitress at the Cheesecake Factory who had a crush on him.

Leonard is pleasantly surprised when Beverly comes to visit and she's genuinely kind to him, until he finds out the real reason she's there. Also, Denise and Stuart overstay their welcome at the Wolowitz house.

Sheldon and Amy await big news. Meanwhile, Penny and Leonard have some big news of their own. Also, Howard and Bernadette face the stressful challenge of leaving their kids for the first time and Raj makes a new friend, as the gang travels together into an uncharted future.
Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco will lead fans on a trip down memory lane, sharing some of the best-kept backstage secrets and personal memories from the past 12 years.
The kids tackle a big mission at the fire station. Cody and his dad make a special birthday cake. Nina rides the school bus for the first time.
JJ visits an animal park with his family... but where are the bears? Nina gets to see the garbage truck up close. Bella sleeps over at Cece's house.
JJ learns how seeds grow at his grandparents' farm. Cece's nervous about getting a haircut. Cody goes on a long car ride. Cece makes a furry new friend.
JJ has to go potty but doesn't want to take a break. The kids go on a nature walk to see different animals. Cody gets his teeth cleaned at the dentist.
At JJ's house, doing chores together is a fun family game! A rainy day changes Cody's plans to go to the fair with his dad. Nina gets new sneakers.
JJ has a "food adventure" at Nico's house! Cece braves the pool for her first swimming lesson. Nico learns that giving gifts to others feels great!
Bella goes on a "bug-venture" with her big brother. On family game night, Cece learns how to take turns. Nico and his dad pick out a gift for Papa.
Bella and Nina must work together to finish a race. Nico, Dad and Papa take a family picture. Nina helps her abuela make a snack for school.
JJ helps his mom at the farmers market. Nina and her abuela shop for colorful fruit. At a café, the kids learn the power of "please" and "thank you."
JJ joins his dad at the construction site. Cody visits his favorite dino at the museum. On a bike ride with her family, Nina learns all about safety.
JJ's going to the doctor but isn't sure what to expect. Cody learns that trains are big — and loud! Bella's pet caterpillar turns into a butterfly.
Bingo needs a bath — and JJ's going to help! Cece's afraid to sleep outside without her nightlight. Nina doesn't score a goal at her first soccer game.
Cece has to return her favorite library book. Cody helps his sister fall asleep. Cece's sending a letter to her grandma — but how will it get there?
JJ borrows Cody's favorite toy... but something bad happens. Cece sits down for a fancy dinner with her family. Nina rehearses for a special dance.
JJ celebrates his birthday at the fire station. The kids dance and play at a pet party. Bella has her friends over for tea and yummy snacks.
Cody picks out an item for show and tell. JJ hurts his knee while riding a scooter with TomTom and YoYo. Bella learns how to take care of Bingo.
Nina takes her first Taekwondo class. Bella tries to enjoy beach day, but she feels overwhelmed! Cece shows off her dancing skills.
Nick and Anne welcome longtime friends Kate, Jack, Danny and Claude for a weekend at their bucolic lake house — where some very unwelcome news awaits.
Reeling from Nick's confession, the other couples must decide whether to reveal the truth to Anne before she suffers a public embarrassment.
Months later, the friends reunite at a tropical resort, where a new addition complicates the group dynamic.
Hoping to warm up to Ginny, the gang hits a late-night beach party, where tequila-fueled conflict ensues. Anne is tempted by forbidden fruit.
Fall has arrived as the group reunites at Jack, Kate and Danny's alma mater. An attempt to spice things up leads to friction between Danny and Claude.
Jack and Kate try to rekindle the romance of their college years, with mixed results. Nick comes face-to-face with Lila's anger about the divorce.
It's Nick's turn to be on the outs as Anne joins the other couples for a New Year's ski vacation — and he struggles to fit in with Ginny's friends.
A twist of fate forces Anne and Ginny to confront their complicated feelings about one another. Jack and Kate's standoff comes to a head.
Samira moves her family into a 1970s smart home. Her curiosity turns into suspicion when her son reactivates the house's long-dormant AI assistant.
Cassandra begins to turn Samira's family against her. Fynn takes an interest in a classmate. In 1971, a woman suspects her husband of infidelity.
Feeling isolated, Samira tries to convince David of Cassandra's intentions. In 1971, a mother goes to extreme lengths to protect her son.
Fynn goes looking for Steve. Tensions reach a boiling point during Juno's playdate. In 1964, a medical experiment takes a terrible turn.
With Samira out of the house, Cassandra takes her family hostage. In 1972, Cassandra adapts to her new living circumstances.
Convinced that her family is in danger, Samira attempts to return home. Meanwhile, Cassandra asserts full control over the house.
Animal detectives Sam and Kit collect all the clues while searching for the suspect who bit an express train's engineer.
Sam and Kit are sent to the African Grasslands to investigate rampaging rhinos at a watering hole gathering, and a bug-loving genet is caught in the act.
When the Mice Squad go missing in the Arctic Tundra, Sam and Kit go on a long-winded search and discover that despite what it may seem, a nearby herd of musk oxen are likely involved.
Sent to the European Wetlands to investigate falling bird eggs, Sam and Kit are given unexpected help from Wally Bungler as they race to stop a sneaky cuckoo bird.

Sam and Kit are sent to the African Desert to locate a missing mole rat- the princess of the current kingdom. With time running short, however, the duo have to hurry before a hungry owl finds her first.
Sam and Kit are sent to the African Grasslands to help a lost honeybee find her hive and family, with Director Scratch assigning Indy, a nearby field agent, to assist in the search.

Trees are falling over in a mysterious fashion in the North American Forest, and Sam and Kit have to find the culprit before the entire forest is destroyed. However, the burrowing suspect is hard to catch.
An orangutan is struck by a thief who has been stealing fruit from her island in the Asian Jungle, but even when Sam and Kit cover all their bases, the mystery bandit keeps slipping by their sights.

Sam and Kit are dispatched to the North American Desert to try and break up a fight between a pair of gila monsters. However, they manage to bite and poison Kit, forcing Sam to work on the case by himself before the lizards leave the town in ruins.
Sam and Kit are sent to find a missing ball of giraffe dung on the African Grasslands. Sam, however, is less than enthused, particularly due to his germophobic nature.

Wally Bungler joins Kit and Sam in the South American Jungle as they search for a tarantula's pet dotted humming frog. Unfortunately, the surrounding area is full of frogs, and finding the one they're looking for is a real challenge.
The Mice Squad van's satellite dish is chomped off by a mysterious creature, and both Sam and Kit are at odds at who the culprit is.
Sam and Kit investigate the strange shrieks keeping the bats awake in a cave.
The pals search for the culprit who nabbed a crab's spiral shell home.
Sweetie the honey badger sneaks onto Sam and Kit's bee-infested aircraft.
Mysterious lights are messing up the dancing at the firefly prom.
The duo follows the jungle sounds to locate a baby monkey.
A silver ant needs help getting back home after being swept up by a sandstorm.
Sam and Kit head to the swamp to investigate a dinosaur sighting.
Something's funky in the food at a jungle resort for howler monkeys.
Snowshoe hares need to find a missing camper during their trip to the forest.
Sam and Kit save a town from being pulled underground by a legendary serpent.
The pals search for their team leader after crashing during a flight test.
Everyone's decking the halls to get in the holiday spirit. But Sam and Kit are blasted back in time to the Ice Age and meet some wooly new pals!
No one's food is safe in the forest when a mysterious thief nabs everyone's supply.
Sam and Kit are on the case when Gordy the giraffe goes missing.
The Stinkwells send Sam and Kit a strange and crawly case trapped in ice.
A salamander mom wonders why her dry pond hasn't filled up with water.
Sam tries to blend in with a tough clan of hyenas during a desert mission.
Underground creatures start getting spooked by their burrow's new addition.
The duo must figure out why bats are suddenly sneezing after waking up from their winter sleep.
Biting army ants march through a birthday picnic.
Two capybaras can't be found after a game of hide-and-seek in the wetlands.
Sam and Kit try to figure out who's playing tricks on them in the snow.
Sam and Kit track a legendary creature who's spreading an unstoppable itch among prairie dogs.
Who would steal a cute forest pika's dry flower pile?
Kit's on the case when an innocent prairie dog is stung out of nowhere.
Something's making a dripping noise that's been bothering some birds — but what?
Someone's stealing Pierre's "très magnifique" spider webs. It's up to Sam and Kit to follow the clues and crack this itsy-bitsy case wide open.
Kit and Sam are joined by their flying squirrel pal, Wally Bungler, to help locate a missing Arctic fox in the middle of a freezing blizzard.
Something stinks — and for once it isn't the skunks! Sam and Kit travel to South America to uncover the source of a yucky smell.
Three wolves who are new to the forest hear a spooky voice ordering them to go away. Can Sam and Kit uncover who's behind the scares?
Did Tony the tuatara really eat up that seabird's egg? He's the prime suspect, but maybe there's another explanation for his odd behavior...
When water threatens to overrun a chinchilla dust spa, Kit and Sam head to the desert to help the furry creatures stay safe and dry.
Animal residents in the North American wetlands are in a panic, claiming their home has been invaded by rats. But Kit and Sam aren't so sure.
After two birds build their perfect nest, one bird mysteriously goes missing. Is a predator to blame — or is the truth closer to home?
When a mysterious orange bat with no memory crash-lands in an African jungle, Sam and Kit offer to help her remember who she is and where she came from.
After a velvet worm sticks Sam and Kit together, the two pals must work together to free themselves — and help their new friend get back home.
On a sunny beach day, a sneaky thief makes off with every drop of milk meant for a group of baby elephant seals. Luckily, Sam and Kit are on the case!
Sam and Kit try out new glow-in-the-dark goggles to help find a brightly colored creature that causes chaos at a dance party in the African grasslands.
After swapping sweet Valentine's Day cards, the CLADE crew rushes to help Judy the red panda find her missing special someone before time runs out.
Leonard the lungfish needs to get back to the water — fast. Good thing the CLADE agents are ready to help carry him to safety!
After an itchy rash breaks out on the Monsoon Express, a hooded pitohui bird helps Kit and Sam interview suspects in the jungle and find the culprit.
Wally Bungler flies in to help Kit and Sam search for a mysterious creature munching on all the crops in the mountains. Maybe it's the mythical yeti?
When a family of dung beetles uncovers an egg that's tumbled out of the nest, the team must find its mother before a hungry goanna lizard gobbles it up.
Philip Night swings by with his son to help Sam and Kit solve a sticky situation when a crafty critter destroys a flock of bird nests.
Wally Bungler invites Sam and Kit onto his basement talk show to hear about their first-ever case and how they learned to work together.
Booba finds himself in a kitchen. The fridge enchants him so much that he is ready for everything to conquer it!
Booba discovers a bathroom and finds many attracting objects that turn him into a real explorer!
Booba gets into a nursery room. He climbs the stairs, dives into a pool with balls and battles with soldiers! Booba is a cartoon about a charming brownie loved by children and adults alike.
Booba discovers a study! He comes across an air-blower and a real computer. After all these activities he decorates the room with… a hole punch.
Booba gets into a game room. He can’t stand still due to his curious nature! He destroys a house of cards, learns to play billiards and discovers an electric guitar!
Running away from the globe, Booba gets into a biology class, where he looks through a microscope and rescues a fish with artificial respiration.
On New Year's Eve, Booba tries to blow out the candle. What could be easier? Eventually this trick turns into a new adventure!
Booba sneaks into a garage and finds an expensive car! He has to explore shiny tools on the wall, and the car itself of course!
Everyone knows that an attic is full of old and strange things! What can Booba find there?
Booba gets attracted by a bow tie behind a shop window. He is eager to hook it and ready to use all possible devices to hit this goal!
Booba appears in a country house full of delicious food. He wants to get some cheese, but it seems not that easy! A mousetrap becomes a serious trouble…
Booba gets into a suitcase at the airport and finally finds himself in an apartment of an artist. He sees many beautiful paintings and tries to imitate the subject of the masterpiece.
Booba appears in a bakery! What a lucky chance to eat all yummy snacks at once! What will Booba eat in the first place?
Booba appears on a circus arena, where a magician left his magic hat. Let’s find out what tricks Booba can repeat and what will come after!
Booba appears in a room, which is prepared for a children's party. His gets attracted by a red balloon and tries to grab it, but it's not as simple as it seems at first glance.
Booba gets into a cinema hall. He finds a coin and buys a chewing gum. Let’s see how many fun tricks he can make with a chewing gum!
Booba goes down to the basement and notices a light bulb. He is unhappy that it is too bright, so he tries to make it dim. Do you think he can manage it?
Booba looks through a recipe book and decides to make a burger. A bun, a cutlet, cheese ... what else will Booba add to his cooking masterpiece?
Booba and his teddy bear get down to a subway station. He wants to climb the escalator, but it's hard to do with a toy in his hands.
​Booba finds some cheese in a supermarket. He wants to take it away but the cunning access frame doesn’t let him out. It’s a funny cartoon series for kids and toddlers.
Booba enters a concert hall, where he gets attracted by a conductor's stick. But Loola the Rat grabs it first! Who will get the stick in the end?!
Booba wants to taste some cheese, but his new friend Googa the Parrot outruns Booba. It’s a popular 3D animated cartoon series about funny and cute creature named Booba.
Booba and his friends enjoy dancing! Please feel free to join them and dance all together!
Booba dreams about a magic cheese island where he can eat as much cheese as he can, but some noise always interrupts his dream! Let’s find out what could it be.
Booba finds himself in a gym. He tries to get some water and switches on the treadmill…
Booba meets the strangest thing in his life and tries to have fun in such an unusual situation!
Booba just wants to lie in the sun, but can he remain calm for even a second? As always, his rest turns into a series of fun-packed adventures!
Booba is travelling by train. He is exploring a compartment and things there. Booba is studying the contents of a suitcase and finds something interesting!
Booba gets on a plane and feels like a real captain! It seems that he can do everything: hold the hand wheel tight, clean up and take care of any passengers. But as usual, he does it in his own way!
Booba gets into a museum where he finds lots of interesting showpieces and tries to save his treat - a banana.
Summer brings so much fun to the countryside! Booba is trying to catch butterflies, tasting apples and avidly exploring a farm.
Booba really likes to play. In the new episode he is trying to catch a ball that suddenly appears in a family house. It looks like the ball doesn't want to be caught!
Booba finds himself in a hi-tech house and lays his eyes on a remote control. Check out what happens when he presses the buttons…all of them!
In the new episode Booba discovers superpowers that let him cope with unusual stuff, help a friend and have fun.
Booba has never played hockey but he is ready to learn. And here is the smart Loola to help. Suddenly the puck chase turns into a joyful adventure.

On Christmas Eve Booba and his friends appear in a country house and find out that the main holiday element is missing. Together they joyfully clear the mess (well, almost) and create the Christmas mood.
Booba and his friends start a funny competition at a playground. Who will win the main prize - a delicious lollipop?
Booba is up for an ice-cream that suddenly gets him in a computer game. Will he pass all the levels and taste the dessert?
In the new episode Booba meets a ghost. Will it frighten him? Or will they make friends?
Booba and Loola would like to make something delicious. Join the characters in the amusing adventure.
Booba and Loola explore a big toy store. What's inside a bright unusual egg the spot there?
Booba and his friends decide to play golf. And the game suddenly turns into a pirate adventure.
Booba would like to play bowling in his own tricky way. He is joined by a new character who adds more fun to the game.

Booba loves cheese, and little mouse Loola is all about dancing. In the new episode of the cartoon, the friends will get to the theater, where they can take advantage of both of their skills-ballet and cheese hunting.
Booba really likes to make noise and have fun. And his friends eventually join him in exciting adventures.
Booba goes into space trying to save the spaceship from asteroids. Luckily, his favorite plush bear is there to help.
Booba and his friends get into a music store. They incidentally try all the instruments creating such noisy fun.
Booba and his friends live in a wonderful world filled with adventure and magic. Now they are playing with a chalk that can bring any drawing to life.
Booba and Loola find a pirate treasure map. Looks like a new exciting adventure is about to begin.
Magic goes on. Booba travels into the past and gets into an exciting prehistoric adventure with "new friends".
Booba is suddenly having a guest from the previous episode. They are joyfully exploring a smart house looking for treats.
In this educational show, Booba and his cheerful friends will help children learn the song and dance, as well as find out something new for themselves.
Booba looks for some treats and suddenly gets into a mysterious house ready for Halloween. Who will he meet there - a ghost, a witch or maybe a spider?
Booba wants to learn to fly like a butterfly or a bird. Who will help him make his dream come true?
A kitchen fridge is a real treasure chest. But Booba can be so carried away by a fun game that he even forgets about his favorite food - cheese.
Booba gets into a shopping mall wonderfully decorated for Christmas. Or maybe it's Santa's grotto where he stores presents for kids.
Offices are empty after Christmas. Booba and his friends get into one to have some party cake.
Booba works wonders trying to save the clumsy hedgehog from danger on a circus arena. But, in fact, Spike might also be a gifted acrobat.
Adventures through magic wardrobe are filled with twists. Booba wanted to go to the seaside but instead traveled to the future. Who will he meet there?
Fresh fruits look so delicious. One wants to eat them all. Or maybe squeeze some juice? Booba will do anything to quench his thirst.
Booba and Loola discover modelling clay in an artists' workshop. They can now make vases, flower pots, fruits, cheese. Well, what else will the friends create?
Booba explores a fire museum, tests a fire extinguisher, tries on a fire helmet and even becomes a true firefighter saving his friends from a real pickle.
Everyone is getting ready for Easter. And Booba and Loola suddenly get into a sweets factory. They are eager to make colorful chocolate eggs and have a lot of fun.

What should you do if a baby tooth falls out? Wait for a tooth fairy, of course. Booba is eager to get her attention and a shining coin. It's not that easy but it's fun. Watch the episode to find out his tricky plan.
What could be better than a ripe, juicy watermelon? Booba and his friends will show you how to correctly share out a watermelon among everyone.
There are so many different attractions in the theme part. On which of them will Booba be able to get a coin that he needs to win the top prize?
Everyone needs a vacation, even a genie. But Booba, Loola and their friends have so many wishes. Who will make them come true? Check out a new episode to find out.
Booba can find cheese everywhere, even in a science museum. There he incidentally took part in a baffling experiment like in a real lab. This made the museum a really mysterious spot.
Booba is all about adventures. This time he suddenly gets in the Wild West. Dressed as a cowboy he becomes a sheriff to chase a dangerous criminal who stole cheese.
Booba is going on an exciting adventure to the underwater world. What kind of treasures will he find travelling in a submarine?

When you're bored and have no one to talk to, you just need to find a magic photo booth and clone yourself. That's exactly what Booba did. He made copies of himself with different hobbies and interests.
Booba and his friends can find a fairy tale wherever they go. Even the ball pool in the entertainment center can lead to the underwater kingdom of the Sea King.
Booba can't wait to celebrate Easter! While chasing after the Easter Bunny, Booba meets his friends, has fun, and plays pranks!
Booba travels back in time to help his friends build a mysterious structure. Look what Booba brought with him to the Stone Age!
Booba has found a magic cauldron to make different treats! What will Booba and his friends choose? How will it turn out?
Booba made a bumblebee mad, and now he's hiding from it at his friends' house. What kind of trouble will Booba get into now? Can he make friends with the fluffy bug?
Booba's got hiccups! His friends know effective ways to get rid of them. But who will manage to cure Booba?
The Magic Wheel of Fortune! Spin it to get a new challenge with tasty cheese as the prize! Will Booba manage to get the treat?
Where do missing packages go? And what will happen to letters and packages if the postman goes missing? Booba needs to find out!
Ghost Booba is being naughty again! This time, he is making himself an outfit by collecting different objects that belong to his friends. What will come out of it?
Booba and his friends chose identical outfits for Halloween. Will it mess up with the fun? Watch the new episode to find out.
Booba and his friends decided to help Santa wrap presents. Will they be able to finish in time for Christmas?
Booba caught some strange disease, and Doctor Loola will do everything possible to cure his patient! What caused the illness? Find out in the new episode!

Booba and friends decided to celebrate the Chinese New Year—the Year of the Dragon. They are looking forward to lots of fun, adventures, and mischief! Will the prediction from the traditional cookies come true?
During the Easter egg hunt, Booba finds the most unusual egg. But it's not so easy to capture! What thrilling adventures await Booba and his friends in pursuit of the main symbol of Easter!
Booba is visited by an unexpected guest, and their games plunge the house into chaos. But even the most unpredictable situations can't stand in the way of friendship and fun!
Booba and Twinkle decide to make pizza, but they lack ingredients. Friends from other worlds come to their aid. What ingredients will make it into this unusual dish? Write down the recipe!
Booba starts fixing and improving everything he sees, but the results are completely unexpected. Will Booba turn out to be a real builder?
Future Booba puts on VR glasses and travels through worlds, as if in fun arcade games.
Booba and his friend Prehistoric Booba find a giant footprint! They decide to embark on an exciting adventure to find out who it belongs to.
Booba meets the Echo and embarks on an exciting adventure with him.
Booba and his friends head to a fun climbing wall to conquer the heights! But what if one of our climbers is afraid of heights? Of course, rush to help!

Booba finds himself at the center of Dr. Spike’s Halloween experiment and secretly decides to recreate it. But will he be able to keep everything under control, or will the Night of Nightmares become even more mysterious?
Booba dreams of Mr Beak’s sneakers, but getting them won't be easy! Can his friends help him find the right item to trade?
Booba discovers the magic of cinema and starts filming his own movie. The result will be thrilling!
The robot from the future doesn’t just clean; he’s obsessed with tidiness! He’s so into order that he’s ready to play nanny for Booba and his friends. Who will outsmart whom?
Booba is preparing a festive Christmas celebration for his friends, but someone’s pranks threaten to ruin it. However, it all ends with an unexpected surprise!
Booba and Twinkle find themselves in magical snow globes, but their adventures spiral out of control when Noodle and Spike turn their world upside down!

On his first day as an intern, an idealistic Dr. Devon Pravesh faces the harsh realities of medical care, as third year resident Dr. Conrad Hawkins takes him under his wing and teaches his unconventional ways for treating patients. Meanwhile, Conrad goes head-to-head with Chief of Surgery Dr. Solomon Bell, who uses power and intimidation to cover up his mistakes.

Conrad receives the call he's been waiting for when a heart becomes available for a patient who has been on the transplant list for two years. But when a congressman is admitted to the hospital after a heart attack, he is prioritized and derails Conrad's patient's surgery. Meanwhile, Nic grows suspicious of one of the doctors after a file goes missing, Dr. Bell tries to manipulate Mina and Devon is put to the test when a patient's condition requires a split-second decision.

An old army buddy and fellow surgeon visits Conrad at the hospital. Meanwhile, the team is put to the test when they have to save the life of an uninsured and undocumented patient, while simultaneously battling the hospital's administrators, who fear the patient will cost millions. Also, Dr. Bell experiments with a new medication for his tremor and Nic swears to investigate the mystery surrounding missing medical records.

After a mix-up in the ER causes Conrad to deliver a death notification to the wrong family, he sets out to fix it.
