In the wake of the sudden and tragic passing of Eddie Guerrero, Superstars from both Raw and SmackDown come together to mourn the loss of Latino Heat and pay tribute to his legacy. Featuring Chavo Guerrero, Triple H, The Mexicools, John "Bradshaw" Layfield, and many more on this emotional edition of SmackDown.

SmackDown General Manager Theodore Long assembles the entire SmackDown roster to defend their brand from an imminent invasion of Raw Superstars. In the main event, Batista defends the World Heavyweight Championship in a No Holds Barred Match against Randy Orton. Plus, Juventud challenges Nunzio for the Cruiserweight Championship and much more.

Randy Orton goes one-on-one with Matt Hardy. However, Legend Killer soon learns that you cannot kill what is already dead. Raw's World Tag Team Champions Kane & Big Show take on John "Bradshaw" Layfield & Rey Mysterio. Plus, a Tag Team Battle Royal, The Boogeyman makes his debut in a match against Simon Dean, and much more.

Rey Mysterio & World Heavyweight Champion Batista face John "Bradshaw" Layfield & Orlando Jordan. After looking to put an end to The Undertaker's mind games by calling out The Deadman, Randy Orton comes to the realization that he is traveling on the Highway to Hell. Plus, The Boogeyman in action, Super Crazy faces Joey Mercury, and more.

Randy Orton's fear of stepping into a Hell in a Cell Match with The Undertaker leads him to make a difficult decision regarding the future of his in-ring career. Before Rey Mysterio & World Heavyweight Champion Batista challenge MNM for the WWE Tag Team Championship, Melina pulls out all the stops to prevent The Animal from competing.

On a very special holiday edition of SmackDown, Michael Cole and Tazz take the WWE Universe on journey through the brand's greatest matches and moments from the past year. Plus, a special look at the life and times of the late great Eddie Guerrero, the recently debuted Boogeyman, and more highlights from 2005.

Amidst Melina's potentially career threatening allegations against him, World Heavyweight Champion Batista takes to the ring with Rey Mysterio to defend the WWE Tag Team Championships against MNM. Plus, John "Bradshaw" Layfield and Matt Hardy clash in one-on-one action, Cruiserweight Champion Kid Kash makes an example out of Funaki, and more.

The WWE Tag Team Championship is on the line in a Steel Cage Match as MNM defend against Rey Mysterio & World Heavyweight Champion Batista. After Mark Henry dismantles three opponents, Melina explains her new relationship with The World's Strongest Man. John "Bradshaw" Layfield and Matt Hardy battle in a Falls Count Anywhere Match and much more.

After Batista is forced to relinquish his World Heavyweight Championship due to injury, a main event Battle Royal to determine a new champion is announced. Rowdy Roddy Piper returns to WWE for the 22nd Anniversary of Piper's Pit with some unique guests. Plus, the final match in the Best of Seven Series for the United States Championship.

Daivari faces World Heavyweight Champion Kurt Angle. While Angle readies for action, Rey Mysterio and Mark Henry face off in a match to determine a new No. 1 Contender for his title. Despite being challenged by Orlando Jordan, United States Champion Booker T once again uses his "injury" to avoid in-ring competition. Plus Matt Hardy and more.

Kurt Angle battles WWE Tag Team Champions MNM in a Handicap Match. Finlay looks to give the WWE Universe a preview of things to come in a match against Funaki. The Mexicools take on The Dicks for a chance to qualify for the 2006 Royal Rumble Match. Plus, Randy Orton competes in a No Holds Barred Match, Rey Mysterio in action, and much more.

Randy Orton & Mark Henry face Rey Mysterio & World Heavyweight Champion Kurt Angle. While still suffering the effects of his nagging "injury", Booker T enlists Finlay to defend his United States Championship for him. SmackDown General Manager Teddy Long gives The Undertaker a golden opportunity. All this and more.

With Randy Orton's despicable comments towards the memory of Eddie Guerrero weighing on his mind, Rey Mysterio sets his sights on getting even with The Legend Killer. The Undertaker goes one-on-one with Mark Henry. The No. 1 Contender for the United States Championship is decided in a Fatal 4-Way Match.

The Undertaker & Kurt Angle take on Mark Henry & WWE Tag Team Champions MNM. With Randy Orton's taunts continuing to get under his skin, Rey Mysterio takes to the ring to go one-on-one with Sylvan. After defending the Cruiserweight Championship against Scotty 2 Hotty, Gregory Helms realizes that there is a target on his back. All this and more.

While Randy Orton celebrates taking Rey Mysterio's place at WrestleMania 22, the festivities are short-lived. Eddie Guerrero is announced as being inducted into the WWE Hall of Fame. Gregory Helms puts the Cruiserweight Championship on the line against Psicosis. Plus, a Six-Man Tag Team Match, MNM defend the WWE Tag Team Championship, and more.

Kurt Angle and The Undertaker battle for the World Heavyweight Championship. Matt Hardy enlists the help of a mystery partner to face WWE Tag Team Champions MNM. Fear of The Boogeyman becomes a reality for Booker T when he goes one-on-one with Tatanka. Plus, Bobby Lashley and Finlay clash in singles action, Randy Orton faces Super Crazy, and more.

After demanding a chance to challenge Kurt Angle for the World Heavyweight Championship, Mark Henry finds himself partnering with Randy Orton to face Rey Mysterio & The Olympic Gold Medalist. John "Bradshaw" Layfield issues a challenge to "Stone Cold" Steve Austin. Bobby Lashley and Finlay compete for a spot in the Money in the Bank Ladder Match.

Mark Henry & WWE Tag Team Champions MNM face World Heavyweight Champion Kurt Angle, Randy Orton & Rey Mysterio. Bobby Lashley, Matt Hardy, and more look to qualify for the upcoming Money in the Bank Ladder Match on The Grandest Stage of Them All. Plus, Booker T and Sharmell are tormented by The Boogeyman, Orlando Jordan in action, and much more.

World Heavyweight Champion Kurt Angle battles Mark Henry. Randy Orton looks to strike at Rey Mysterio. Despite being wary about facing The Boogeyman on The Grandest Stage of Them All, Booker T is forced to make a decision. In a final attempt to qualify for the upcoming Money in the Bank Ladder Match, Superstars compete in a Battle Royal.

Rey Mysterio faces World Heavyweight Champion Kurt Angle. With his bout against The Undertaker at WrestleMania approaching, Mark Henry vows to lay The Deadman's undefeated streak to rest. The horrors continue for Booker T after The Boogeyman kidnaps Sharmell. Matt Hardy, Bobby Lashley & Tatanka take on Finlay & WWE Tag Team Champions MNM.

After defying the odds to capture the World Heavyweight Championship at WrestleMania 22, Rey Mysterio defends his newly won title against Randy Orton. When The Undertaker battles Mark Henry, another giant arrives to make a lasting impression on The Deadman. Paul London & Brian Kendrick take on WWE Tag Team Champions MNM and much more action.

Kurt Angle battles Randy Orton in the first round of the King of the Ring Tournament. The man who laid waste to The Undertaker is revealed to the WWE Universe. John "Bradshaw" Layfield defends the United States Championship in a Steel Cage Match. Plus, The Mexicools in action, Matt Hardy goes one-on-one with Road Warrior Animal, and much more.

When John "Bradshaw" Layfield hosts a special Great American Celebration, Kurt Angle and World Heavyweight Champion Rey Mysterio take it upon themselves to crash the festivities. Booker T faces Matt Hardy in the King of the Ring Tournament. The Great Khali makes his in-ring debut against Funaki. Plus, Finlay and Orlando Jordan team up for action.

Kurt Angle challenges Rey Mysterio for the World Heavyweight Championship. The King of the Ring Tournament continues with Bobby Lashley facing off against Mark Henry. John "Bradshaw" Layfield defends the United States Championship against William Regal. Feeling under the weather, Booker T enlists Finlay to take his place in singles action.

The problems between World Heavyweight Champion Rey Mysterio and United States Champion John "Bradshaw" Layfield continue to escalate when JBL announces that Mysterio will go one-on-one with Mark Henry in the main event. Plus, the tournament to crown a new King of the Ring continues, Booker T takes to the ring for singles action, and much more.

World Heavyweight Champion Rey Mysterio takes on The Great Khali in the main event. Mark Henry looks to send a message to Kurt Angle in a match against Paul Burchill. Plus, Booker T attempts to steal another undeserved victory, Bobby Lashley meets Finlay in the semi-finals of the 2006 King of the Ring Tournament, and much more.

Rey Mysterio takes on a mystery opponent in the main event. Jillian Hall partners with Brian Kendrick & Paul London to take on the trio of MNM in a Six-Person Mixed Tag Team Match. Mark Henry prepares for his upcoming battle with Kurt Angle by going one-on-one with Matt Hardy. Plus, Booker T in action, Bobby Lashley faces Jared Steele, and more.

John "Bradshaw" Layfield challenges Rey Mysterio for the World Heavyweight Championship, but is forced to defend the United States Championship against a formidable opponent. Following his victory in the 2006 King of the Ring Tournament, Booker T embraces his regal triumph with a special coronation. All this and more.

United States Champion Bobby Lashley gets less than the royal treatment in a main event bout against King Booker. "Rowdy" Roddy Piper hosts The Great Khali and Daivari on a brand new edition of Piper's Pit. Paul Heyman takes a front row seat to witness World Heavyweight Champion Rey Mysterio faces ECW's newest acquisition, Kurt Angle.

World Heavyweight Champion Rey Mysterio declines Paul Heyman's offer to join him in the reformation of ECW. After suffering an assault at the hands of Bobby Lashley, William Regal goes one-on-one with his attacker. Plus, The Great Khali's path of destruction continues, Mr. Kennedy takes to the ring to battle Scotty 2 Hotty, and much more action.

Despite receiving advice from doctors not to compete, Bobby Lashley puts the United States Championship on the line in a main event bout against King Booker. The Mexicools look for some retribution by taking on The Great Khali in a Handicap Match. World Heavyweight Champion Rey Mysterio faces Cruiserweight Champion Gregory Helms and much more.

Rey Mysterio defends the World Heavyweight Championship against Mark Henry. King Booker and Bobby Lashley compete for the United States Championship. The Great Khali looks to make an example out of Tatanka and Simon Dean. Plus, The Mexicools challenge Paul London and Brian Kendrick for the WWE Tag Team Championship and much more.

Mark Henry looks for revenge against Chavo Guerrero. Much to his dismay, King Booker competes in a Steel Cage Match to challenge Bobby Lashley for the United States Championship. Plus, The Great Khali continues to leave a path of bodies in his wake, Gregory Helms defends the Cruiserweight Championship against Super Crazy, and more.

A Battle Royal for a chance to challenge for the World Heavyweight Championship at The Great American Bash. Rey Mysterio joins forces with Batista to settle a score with Mark Henry. The Undertaker answers The Great Khali's challenge to a Punjabi Prison Match. United States Champion Bobby Lashley faces Cruiserweight Champion Gregory Helms and more.

With King Booker set to challenge Rey Mysterio for the World Heavyweight Championship, William Regal is tasked with softening up his majesty's opponent in the main event. SmackDown General Manager Theodore Long mediates the contract signing between Batista and Mark Henry. Bobby Lashley defends the United States Championship against Finlay.

King Booker faces Rey Mysterio. With Mark Henry being unable to face Batista at The Great American Bash due to injury, Mr. Kennedy steps up to offer The Animal a new challenge. Bobby Lashley looks to reclaim the United States Championship from Finlay. Plus, Brian Kendrick in action, Super Crazy faces Psicosis, and much more.

King Booker defends the World Heavyweight Championship against Rey Mysterio. Just hours after facing each other in a memorable bout, Batista and Mr. Kennedy take to the ring do battle once more. Plus, William Regal challenges Finlay for the United States Championship, Tatanka goes one-on-one with Sylvan, and much more.

Chavo Guerrero explains why he turned on Rey Mysterio. A giant problem awaits The Undertaker when he goes one-on-one with World Heavyweight Champion King Booker in the main event. In a rematch from their previously-interrupted encounter, Batista and Mr. Kennedy face off in singles competition. Plus, Tatanka, Elijah Burke, and many more in action.

William Regal & United States Champion Finlay face Batista and Bobby Lashley. Tensions between The Undertaker and The Great Khali explode after Khali refuses to accept The Deadman's challenge to face him in a Last Man Standing Match at SummerSlam. The problems between Rey Mysterio and Chavo Guerrero continue. All this and much more action.

After taking to the ring to battle Sylvan in singles action, Batista is called out by World Heavyweight Champion King Booker. The Great Khali and The Undertaker meet in a Last Man Standing Match. Bobby Lashley challenges Finlay for the United States Championship. Plus, Mr. Kennedy and Tatanka go head-to-head and much more!

As a reward for William Regal and Finlay's service to his throne, World Heavyweight Champion King Booker offers his loyal subjects a special Knighthood. SmackDown General Manager Theodore Long makes a Handicap Tag Team Match main event. Vickie Guerrero apologizes to both Chavo Guerrero and Rey Mysterio. Plus, Tatanka in action and more.

World Heavyweight Champion King Booker and Batista to sign the contract for their upcoming battle. Rey Mysterio feels the pain of betrayal when Vickie Guerrero reveals her new business relationship with Chavo Guerrero. Plus, Matt Hardy in action, The Miz makes his in-ring debut against Tatanka, and much more.

Sir William Regal and Finlay prove their worth to King Booker when he defends the World Heavyweight Championship against Batista. The Miz looks to continue his recent success in a match against Matt Hardy. Under Vickie Guerrero's management, Chavo Guerrero takes on Tatanka. Plus, WWE Tag Team Champions Paul London & Brian Kendrick and more.

Finlay faces Bobby Lashley in the main event for a chance at King Booker's World Heavyweight Championship. The extremely personal rivalry between Rey Mysterio and the duo of Vickie and Chavo Guerrero reaches a new level when Mysterio takes to the ring to face United States Champion Mr. Kennedy. Plus, Sir William Regal, The Miz, and many more.

King Booker defends the World Heavyweight Championship against The Undertaker. While their king prepares for battle, Finlay & Sir William Regal take to the ring to meet Batista & Bobby Lashley in a tag team match. Rey Mysterio is given a chance at retribution by going one-on-one with his former friend, Chavo Guerrero. All this and much more action.

WWE Champion John Cena comes to SmackDown to partner with Bobby Lashley & Batista against King Booker, Sir William Regal & Finlay. United States Champion Mr. Kennedy finds himself with one foot in the grave when he pays a special tribute to The Undertaker. Plus, Jimmy Wang Yang makes his debut, Rey Mysterio battles Elijah Burke, and much more.

With Bobby Lashley set to challenge King Booker for the World Heavyweight Championship at No Mercy, both men find themselves with the advantage of picking the other's opponent on this edition of SmackDown. Montel Vontavious Porter lets the WWE Universe know that the game has changed. Rey Mysterio & Matt Hardy battle Chavo Guerrero & Gregory Helms.

Despite successfully defending the World Heavyweight Title at No Mercy, King Booker's reign as champion may be nearing the end, as Bobby Lashley, Finlay, and Batista clash in a Triple Threat Match main event to determine the new No. 1 Contender. MVP goes one-on-one with Kane. Plus, Rey Mysterio in action and much more.

Despite successfully defending the World Heavyweight Title at No Mercy, King Booker's reign as champion may be nearing the end, as Bobby Lashley, Finlay, and Batista clash in a Triple Threat Match main event to determine the new No. 1 Contender. MVP goes one-on-one with Kane. Plus, Rey Mysterio in action and much more.

After Batista suffers an attack for refusing to join Paul Heyman's ECW brand, The Animal partners with WWE Champion John Cena to take on World Heavyweight Champion King Booker and ECW Champion Big Show. Chavo Guerrero gloats about his recent victory over Rey Mysterio. Mr. Kennedy goes one-on-one with Kane in a No Disqualification Match and more.

Batista calls out Finlay. The Brothers of Destruction take Mr. Kennedy & Montel Vontavious Porter in a tag team match with some special stipulations. While rumors abound over the future of his in-ring career, an injured Rey Mysterio addresses the WWE Universe. All this and much more.

King Booker finds himself defending the World Heavyweight Championship under SmackDown General Manager Theodore Long's orders. In the main event, Batista goes one-on-one with Finlay. As The Undertaker's 16th anniversary with WWE approaches at Survivor Series, Mr. Kennedy looks to make a special challenge to The Deadman. All this and much more.

World Heavyweight Champion King Booker & Finlay take on Batista & Bobby Lashley. MVP takes to the ring for a Street Fight against Kane. The Boogeyman finds himself pulling double duty when he battles The Miz & Kristal in a Handicap Match. Plus, Matt Hardy, Paul London, and many more in action.

King Booker and Batista and sign the contract for their World Heavyweight Championship Match at Survivor Series. Mr. Kennedy gives a Thanksgiving address to The Undertaker. Kane and MVP's rivalry leads them to face each other in a Steel Cage Match. Plus, The Boogeyman in action, Brian Kendrick takes on William Regal, and much more.

MVP goes one-on-one with The Undertaker. The World Heavyweight Championship is on the line in a Triple Threat Match when Batista defends the title against King Booker and Finlay. Plus, Chavo Guerrero takes to the ring to compete for the United States Championship, MNM battle WWE Tag Team Champions Paul London & Brian Kendrick, and much more.

Mr. Kennedy competes in main event action against Kane. World Heavyweight Champion Batista prepares for his upcoming battle with John Cena by going one-on-one with Finlay. Plus, William Regal & Dave Taylor face WWE Tag Team Champions Paul London & Brian Kendrick and more.

Raw's WWE Champion John Cena goes one-on-one with Finlay. MVP & Mr. Kennedy unite to face The Brothers of Destruction. WWE Tag Team Champions Paul London and Brian Kendrick partner with Jimmy Wang Yang to take on Cruiserweight Champion Gregory Helms and the duo of William Regal and Dave Taylor. All this and much more.

The Brothers of Destruction take on Finlay & King Booker. With Christmas just days away, World Heavyweight Champion Batista takes on a true holiday icon. Following Joey Mercury's injury at Armageddon, Matt Hardy finds himself going one-on-one with the other half of MNM in Johnny Nitro. Plus, Ashley & Layla team up for action and much more.

As 2006 comes to a close, Michael Cole and John "Bradshaw" Layfield take the WWE Universe on a journey through time for a look at highlights of all the best matches and most unforgettable moments from the past 12 months on SmackDown.

The Superstars of SmackDown compete in a series of Beat the Clock Sprint Matches to earn an opportunity at challenging Batista for the World Heavyweight Championship at the Royal Rumble. Montel Vontavious Porter speaks out about his recent defeat at the hands of Kane in an interview with John "Bradshaw" Layfield. All this and more.

Several Superstars compete in the Beat the Clock Sprint Matches for an opportunity at challenging Batista for the World Heavyweight Championship at the Royal Rumble. Paul London & Brian Kendrick put the WWE Tag Team Championship on the line against William Regal & Dave Taylor. Plus, Mr. Kennedy in action, Jimmy Wang Yang takes on Tatanka, and more.

Mr. Kennedy is forced to go one-on-one with The Undertaker in the main event. In a Six-Man Tag Team Match, MVP partners with William Regal & Dave Taylor to take on Vito and WWE Tag Team Champions Paul London & Brian Kendrick. Plus, Deuce 'n' Domino debut, Kane faces The Miz, and much more.

The Undertaker makes an emphatic statement to all the participants in the 2007 Royal Rumble Match. After trying to avoid in-ring competition with Kane, MVP is informed that his future on The Grandest Stage of Them All rests on going one-on-one with The Big Red Machine. All this and much more action.

Following The Undertaker's victory in the 2007 Royal Rumble Match, World Heavyweight Champion Batista and WWE Champion John Cena take to the ring to find out who The Deadman will challenge at WrestleMania 23. King Booker is presented with a special gift. Plus, Matt Hardy goes one-on-one with The Miz in the main event and much more.

With the WWE Universe buzzing in anticipation to see The Undertaker challenge Batista for the World Heavyweight Championship at WrestleMania 23, Mr. Kennedy reminds everyone that his golden opportunity comes first. King Booker demands that Kane be suspended for his recent actions. Plus, The Miz in action, The Boogeyman faces Finlay, and much more.

Raw's Rated-RKO takes on The Undertaker & World Heavyweight Champion Batista. MVP & Mr. Kennedy look to bring the World Tag Team Championships to SmackDown by challenging Shawn Michaels and WWE Champion John Cena for the gold. Plus, Ashley reveals her new endeavor, Deuce goes one-on-one with Brian Kendrick, and much more.

Batista sends a message to The Undertaker. When an injured Rey Mysterio addresses the WWE Universe, Mr. McMahon shows the world the destructive power of his representative in the upcoming Battle of the Billionaires, Umaga. King Booker faces Kane in a Falls Count Anywhere Match for a chance to qualify for the Money in the Bank Ladder Match and more.

Mr. Kennedy asks Mr. McMahon for an opportunity to challenge Bobby Lashley for the ECW Championship in the main event. The Undertaker returns to the graveyard to send a message to World Heavyweight Champion Batista. Plus, Matt Hardy takes on Joey Mercury for a chance to qualify for the Money in the Bank Ladder Match and much more.

The Undertaker battles Finlay. World Heavyweight Champion Batista faces Kane. In the debut edition of MizTV, The Miz welcomes Ashley to reveal her new business venture to the entire WWE Universe. Plus, CM Punk clashes with Mr. Kennedy in singles competition, King Booker takes on Matt Hardy, and much more action.

King Booker goes one-on-one The Undertaker. The Miz pays the price for provoking an animal after World Heavyweight Champion Batista joins him on an all new edition of MizTV. Ashley partners with Paul London & Brian Kendrick to take on Melina and her WWE Tag Team Champions Joey Mercury & Johnny Nitro. Plus, MVP in action and much more.

The Undertaker & World Heavyweight Champion Batista face King Booker & Finlay in the main event. In an effort to help his chances in the upcoming Battle of the Billionaires, Mr. McMahon orders Mr. Kennedy and Randy Orton to team up for a Handicap Match against Donald Trump's representative, Bobby Lashley.

Tensions between The Undertaker and World Heavyweight Champion Batista explode. John "Bradshaw" Layfield is left stunned by the return of another fellow Texan. After being named Edge's replacement in a match against Matt Hardy, The Great Khali receives a message from Kane. Randy Orton goes one-on-one with Jeff Hardy. All this and much more.

The Undertaker begins his reign as the new World Heavyweight Champion, however, The Deadman receives little time to celebrate as Batista demands a rematch. Mr. Kennedy goes one-on-one with Jeff Hardy. Plus, WWE Tag Team Champions Paul London & Brian Kendrick in action, King Booker faces Matt Hardy, and much more.

Batista & The Undertaker find themselves teaming up against the reconciled duo of Mr. Kennedy & Finlay in the main event. Dave Taylor & William Regal seize an opportunity to make an example out of Kane. WWE Tag Team Champions Brian Kendrick & Paul London in action. All this and much more.

Mr. Kennedy takes on with The Undertaker. Kane finds himself pulling double duty, as he takes on William Regal and Dave Taylor in a Handicap Match. Deuce 'n' Domino put the WWE Tag Team Championship on the line in a match against Paul London & Brian Kendrick. World Heavyweight Champion Batista faces off against Finlay. All this and much more.

Batista and The Unddertaker find themselves uneasy allies in a tag team match against Finlay & Mr. Kennedy. In a partnership made in hell, Kane teams with The Boogeyman to take on William Regal & Dave Taylor. Plus, MVP in action, Brian Kendrick goes one-on-one with Deuce, and much more.

Batista shows the measure of his resolve by vowing to continue his pursuit of the World Heavyweight Championship. MVP goes one-on-one with Kane to determine the new No. 1 Contender for the United States Championship. Plus, The Miz and Finlay face off in singles action, Mr. Kennedy takes on Matt Hardy, and much more.

The Undertaker puts his World Heavyweight Championship on the line against Batista in a Steel Cage Match. Money in the Bank Winner Edge has his eyes on the prize. Will he cash in his Money in the Bank briefcase for a chance at the title? MVP & Finlay compete in tag team action. Domino faces Paul London. Plus, Kane, The Boogeyman and much more.

Edge gives an inaugural address as the new World Heavyweight Champion. However, SmackDown General Manager Theodore Long reminds The Rated-R Superstar that his reign may be short-lived come Judgment Day. Plus, Matt Hardy and MVP meet in singles action, William Regal takes on Kane in the main event, and much more.

Edge eagerly waits to see who will challenge him for the World Heavyweight Championship when Batista, Finlay, Kane, and Mark Henry compete in a Fatal 4-Way Match. Plus, Paul London & Brian Kendrick take on William Regal & Dave Taylor, MVP holds a celebration for winning the United States Championship, Matt Hardy battles The Miz, and much more.

Edge invites Batista to meet him face-to-face on all new edition of The Cutting Edge. Deuce 'n' Domino put the WWE Tag Team Championship on the line against Brian Kendrick & Paul London and William Regal & Dave Taylor. Plus, United States Champion MVP in action, Mark Henry goes one-on-one with Kane, and much more.

Mr. McMahon's behavior becomes increasingly more erratic when The Chairman joins World Heavyweight Champion Edge on an all new edition of The Cutting Edge. In the main event, Batista goes one-on-one with United States Champion MVP. Matt Hardy competes in a Handicap Match against WWE Tag Team Champions Deuce 'n Domino. Plus, Mark Henry and more.

While the WWE Universe buzzes over the apparent "death" of Mr. McMahon, the Superstars of SmackDown take to the ring to continue on in spite of the mysterious circumstances surrounding The Chairman's departure. Current World Heavyweight Champion Edge goes one-on-one with one of the greatest World Heavyweight Champions of all time, Ric Flair.

When violence breaks out on The Cutting Edge after Torrie Wilson is accused of being responsible for the recent demise of Mr. McMahon, World Heavyweight Champion Edge & United States Champion MVP find themselves united for a Tag Team Match main event against Ric Flair & Batista. Plus, Mark Henry in action, Matt Hardy takes on Finlay, and much more.

World Heavyweight Champion Edge faces Batista in the main event. Eugene receives an unceremonious welcome to SmackDown in a match against The Great Khali. United States Champion MVP takes to the ring to face Kane. Plus, Jamie Noble challenges Chavo Guerrero for the Cruiserweight Championship, Ric Flair battles Carlito, and much more.

After World Heavyweight Champion Edge refuses to compete, SmackDown General Manager Theodore Long looks to make The Rated-R Superstar feel the heat by choosing a mystery guest for an all new edition of The Cutting Edge. For the first time in their storied careers, Ric Flair and Finlay meet in one-on-one action and much more.

World Heavyweight Champion Edge holds a special Mardi Gras celebration. A display of disrespect by The Great Khali toward Batista during the contract signing for their upcoming match at The Great American Bash earns The Punjabi Nightmare an animal's bite. Plus, The Major Brothers take on Jamie Noble & Chavo Guerrero and much more.

After Edge is forced to vacate the World Heavyweight Championship due to injury, a 20-Man Battle Royal is held to determine the new champion. The No. 1 Contender is also decided when Kane goes one-on-one with Batista. Matt Hardy takes to the ring to face off against Kenny Dykstra. All this and much more.

To commemorate the first ever Indian-born World Heavyweight Champion, a celebration is held for The Great Khali. However, the festivities are cut short when Batista issues a challenge for the gold. Hornswoggle puts the Cruiserweight Championship on the line against Jamie Noble. Kane goes one-on-one with Dave Taylor. All this and much more.

Batista teams with Ric Flair to take on WWE Tag Team Champions Deuce 'n' Domino in the main event. United States Champion MVP looks to test his strength against Mark Henry in an Arm Wrestling Match. Plus, Kane clashes with Chris Masters in singles action, Jamie Noble goes one-on-one with Shannon Moore, and much more.

Ric Flair looks for some retribution against World Heavyweight Champion The Great Khali. United States Champion MVP joins SmackDown via satellite to give an update on his heart condition. Matt Hardy takes on Finlay. Batista goes one-on-one with Domino. Plus, Chavo Guerrero, Kane, and many more in action.

The Great Khali faces Kane in a rematch from their battle at WrestleMania 23, Matt Hardy finds himself facing an unexpected challenge on an all new edition of MVP's VIP Lounge. The sum of Mark Henry's days may be numbered after The World's Strongest Man is once again stalked by one of The Undertaker's druids. All this and more.

Batista goes one-on-one with Finlay in the main event. After Kane tries his luck in The Masterlock Challenge, Chris Masters competes against Chuck Palumbo in singles action. Plus, Jamie Noble battles Jimmy Wang Yang for a chance at the Cruiserweight Championship, Mark Henry continues to be tormented by The Undertaker, and much more.

Several SmackDown Superstars compete for a chance to challenge The Great Khali for the World Heavyweight Championship. Less than a week after being assaulted by Deuce 'n' Domino, Matt Hardy and United States Champion MVP are given a chance to challenge their attackers for the WWE Tag Team Championship. All this and much more.

Batista & Kane take on Finlay & World Heavyweight Champion The Great Khali. Despite their unlikely partnership leading them to the WWE Tag Team Championship, Matt Hardy and United States Champion MVP continue to find themselves at odds with each other. Plus, Rey Mysterio goes one-on-one with Chavo Guerrero in an "I Quit" Match main event.

World Heavyweight Champion The Great Khali faces Batista. In the first ever Belfast Brawl, Finlay battles Kane. While Mark Henry insists that his strength is more devastating than The Undertaker's power, The Deadman promises to lay The World's Strongest Man to rest. Plus, Domino receives an unexpected match with MVP and more.

Wedding bells are in the air, as the WWE Universe prepares to witness the marriage of Theodore Long and his girlfriend Kristal. However, it becomes apparent that the General Manager of SmackDown may not have the heart to be sealed in holy matrimony. World Heavyweight Champion Batista faces Mark Henry in the main event.

With Theodore Long in an apparent coma after recently suffering a heart attack during his wedding, Vickie Guerrero is selected to assume his role as the General Manager of SmackDown. United States Champion MVP gets burned on The VIP Lounge. The Undertaker faces Mark Henry. Rey Mysterio sits for in an interview with John "Bradshaw" Layfield.

Rey Mysterio battles The Great Khali in a true-to-life "David and Goliath" confrontation. MVP & Matt Hardy put the WWE Tag Team Championship on the line when they take on Deuce 'n Domino. Plus, the team of Jesse and Festus make their long-awaited debut, Kane goes one-on-one with Kenny Dykstra, and much more.

Rey Mysterio and Finlay clash for the right to become the No. 1 Contender to the World Heavyweight Championship. The Brothers of Destruction take on WWE Tag Team Champions Matt Hardy & MVP. Drew McIntyre makes his WWE debut in a match against Brett Major. The Great Khali looks to make short work of Jamie Noble. All this and more.

Rey Mysterio faces United States Champion MVP. John "Bradshaw" Layfield conducts a special interview with Batista. Two giants clash as Kane goes one-on-one with The Great Khali. Plus, Matt Hardy, Drew McIntyre, and many more in action.

The Undertaker takes to the ring for a one-on-one interview with John "Bradshaw" Layfield. After a confrontation on The VIP Lounge, Finlay & Rey Mysterio find themselves reluctant partners against WWE Tag Team Champions MVP and Matt Hardy. Mark Henry returns to SmackDown to take on Kane. All this and much more action.

With Mr. McMahon serving as the Special Guest Referee, Jonathan Coachman steps into the ring to go one-on-one with Mick Foley. On a night where Rey Mysterio takes on Jamie Noble, Finlay sends a message to The Master of the 619. Plus, a huge tag team match main event, Big Daddy V targets Kane, and much more.

The Great Khali and The Undertaker clash in a No Holds Barred Match. Rey Mysterio looks to settle a score with Finlay. Five teams compete in a Battle Royal to determine the new No. 1 Contenders for the WWE Tag Team Championship. Plus, World Heavyweight Champion Batista is in the house, ECW Champion CM Punk battles Jamie Noble, and much more.

World Heavyweight Champion Batista battles Mark Henry in a No Disqualification Match. The Miz & John Morrison challenge MVP & Matt Hardy for the WWE Tag Team Championship. Plus, Finlay faces Intercontinental Champion Jeff Hardy in singles action, Rey Mysterio goes one-on-one with Mr. Kennedy, and much more.

The Undertaker seeks revenge on Edge and SmackDown General Manager Vickie Guerrero. Rey Mysterio looks to settle a score with United States Champion MVP for his assault on Matt Hardy. Plus, Torrie Wilson takes on Victoria, WWE Tag Team Champions Miz 'n' Morrison in action, and more.

After addressing The Undertaker's recent assault on SmackDown General Manager Vickie Guerrero, Edge reveals that his new girlfriend gave him a World Heavyweight Championship match against Batista in the main event. ECW Champion CM Punk goes one-on-one with Kenny Dykstra. Rey Mysterio & Kane team up take on Big Daddy V & United States Champion MVP.

Edge goes one-on-one with Kane in the main event. World Heavyweight Champion Batista takes to the ring to battle ECW Champion Elijah Burke. MVP shows the level of respect he has for legends on an all new edition of The VIP Lounge, featuring Michael Hayes. Plus, WWE Tag Team Champions The Miz & John Morrison, Finlay, and many more in action.

SmackDown General Manager Vickie Guerrero places all three competitors in the upcoming Triple Threat Match for the World Heavyweight Championship at Armageddon in action. While Edge is tasked with battling Funaki in singles competition, The Undertaker and World Heavyweight Champion Batista find themselves in some more challenging situations.

In celebration of Edge's victory at Armageddon, SmackDown General Manager Vickie Guerrero presents her boyfriend with the World Heavyweight Championship. However, the festivities are short-lived when Batista vows to reclaim the gold. John "Bradshaw" Layfield gives a farewell address. Plus, Festus gets into the holiday spirit and more.

On the final SmackDown of 2007, the best matches from throughout the year are revisited for the WWE Universe. From Triple H facing Randy Orton for the WWE Championship in a Last Man Standing Match at No Mercy, to the Money in the Bank Ladder Match from WrestleMania 23, go back in time for a special look at the year that was!

Several Superstars compete in a Beat the Clock Challenge for an opportunity at the World Heavyweight Championship. While The Undertaker, Finlay, Rey Mysterio, and others compete for this golden opportunity, Batista finds himself taking on Zack Ryder & Curt Hawkins in a Handicap Match. Plus, Jimmy Wang Yang in action and more.

Rey Mysterio goes one-on-one with a family friend in the main event. The deck is stacked against The Undertaker when he battles Mark Henry & Matt Striker in a Handicap Match. Batista faces United States Champion MVP. Ranjin Singh and Hornswoggle look to test their strength in an Arm Wrestling Match. All this and much more.

As the 2008 Royal Rumble Match approaches, The Undertaker sends a message to the other 29 Superstars. Rey Mysterio & ECW Champion CM Punk take on the Chavo Guerrero & World Heavyweight Champion Edge. Hornswoggle suffers a giant's wrath when Finlay faces The Great Khali. Ric Flair joins The VIP Lounge. All this and more.

Edge takes on ECW Champion CM Punk in the main event. Batista stakes his claim in the Royal Rumble Match by vowing to make history repeat itself. With their upcoming battle just days away, Ric Flair and United States Champion MVP come face-to-face. Finlay seeks some vengeance for Hornswoggle in a Belfast Brawl with The Great Khali. Plus, much more.

Rey Mysterio & CM Punk take on ECW Champion Chavo Guerrero & World Heavyweight Champion Edge. United States Champion MVP looks to end Ric Flair's career in WWE once again when they meet. The Brothers of Destruction battle Matt Striker & Mark Henry in the main event. All this and much more.

A confrontation over the upcoming Elimination Chamber Match at No Way Out leads to The Undertaker partnering with Batista & Finlay to take on The Great Khali, Big Daddy V & United States Champion MVP in a Six-Man Tag Team Match main event. Tensions explode when World Heavyweight Champion Edge tries to make Rey Mysterio apologize to Vickie Guerrero.

On a special Valentine's Day edition of SmackDown, World Heavyweight Champion Edge takes advantage of the romantic atmosphere to ask SmackDown General Manager Vickie Guerrero an important question. The Undertaker goes one-on-one with Big Daddy V. Batista battles United States Champion MVP. CM Punk & Kane take on Shelton Benjamin & Chavo Guerrero.

SmackDown General Manager Vickie Guerrero forces Rey Mysterio to compete against Chavo Guerrero. Edge's reign as World Heavyweight Champion may be on life support as he turns his attention to defending the gold against The Undertaker at WrestleMania XXIV. Plus, a Money in the Bank Qualifying Match, Kane faces The Great Khali, and much more.

As The Undertaker continues his ominous walk down the road to WrestleMania XXIV, World Heavyweight Champion Edge tasks Zack Ryder with going one-on-one with The Deadman in the main event. Batista partners with Kane to take on The Great Khali & United States Champion MVP in a huge tag team match. Big Show sends a message to Floyd Mayweather.

Edge, Zack Ryder & Curt Hawkins face The Undertaker in a 3-On-1 Handicap Match. MVP puts the United States Championship on the line in a match against Batista. CM Punk partners with Jesse & Festus to take on ECW Champion Chavo Guerrero and WWE Tag Team Champions The Miz & John Morrison in a Six-Man Tag Team Match. All this and much more action.

With their confrontation at WrestleMania XXIV on the horizon, Shawn Michaels & Ric Flair take on World Heavyweight Champion Edge, Zack Ryder & Curt Hawkins in a Steel Cage Match. Batista challenges MVP for the United States Championship in a No Holds Barred Match. The Miz and John Morrison try to qualify for the Money in the Bank Ladder Match.

As The Undertaker faces ECW Champion Chavo Guerrero in the main event, World Heavyweight Champion Edge prepares for his upcoming battle with The Deadman by taking on a less than formidable opponent. The Miz and John Morrison put the WWE Tag Team Championship on the line against Jesse & Festus. Plus, Chris Jericho joins The VIP Lounge and more.

Edge holds a premature funeral for The Undertaker's storied undefeated streak on The Grandest Stage of Them All. Intercontinental Champion Chris Jericho takes on United States Champion MVP. Plus, Kane competes in an Over the Top Rope Challenge, CM Punk goes one-on-one with John Morrison, and much more action.

With both the ECW and World Heavyweight Championships in the hands of The Brothers of Destruction following WrestleMania XXIV, SmackDown General Manager Vickie Guerrero forces The Undertaker to face Kane. While Shawn Michaels tries to come to terms with ending Ric Flair's career, Batista lets The Heartbreak Kid know where he stands.

Edge and SmackDown General Manager Vickie Guerrero enjoy some pampered respite. World Heavyweight Champion The Undertaker goes one-on-one with Festus. In an effort to quell his rivalry with Big Show, The Great Khali offers The World's Largest Athlete a unique peace offering. Batista continues his crusade against Shawn Michaels. All this and more.

After getting into a physical altercation with Chris Jericho on The Highlight Reel, Batista takes to the ring for main event action against World Heavyweight Champion The Undertaker. The Great Khali makes an emphatic statement when Big Show goes one-on-one with Mark Henry. With Natalya Neidhart in her corner, Victoria faces off against Cherry.

The Undertaker defends the World Heavyweight Championship against Batista in a No Disqualification Match. Edge goes one-on-one with Money in the Bank holder CM Punk. Matt Hardy vows to take the United States Championship from MVP at Backlash. Plus, The Miz and Shannon Moore meet in singles action, Natalya battles Cherry, and more.

All of SmackDown's titles are on the line. The Miz & John Morrison defend the WWE Tag Team Championship against Jimmy Wang Yang & Shannon Moore. MVP challenges Matt Hardy for the United States Championship. Plus, The Undertaker's World Heavyweight Championship defense against The Great Khali will leave everyone in shock. All this and more!

With The Undertaker recently stripped of the World Heavyweight Championship, SmackDown General Manager Vickie Guerrero invites some select SmackDown and ECW Superstars to compete in a special Championship Chase. While Batista, Kane, Big Show, and others look to take advantage of this chance at glory, Edge seizes another opportunity of his own.

When Teddy Long turns the tables on Vickie Guerrero by having her placed in a match against The Undertaker in order to keep her job as General Manager of SmackDown, Guerrero turns to La Familia for help. With Shawn Michaels admitting to feigning injury, Batista sends a message to The Heartbreak Kid. Plus, Big Show & Finlay take on MVP & Mark Henry.

SmackDown General Manager Vickie Guerrero announces that more than gold will be at stake for The Undertaker at One Night Stand. Things take an animalistic turn when Teddy Long joins MVP on The VIP Lounge. Kofi Kingston & United States Champion Matt Hardy take on Elijah Burke & Shelton Benjamin. Plus, Vladimir Kozlov in action and more.

Edge and The Undertaker come face-to-face on The Cutting Edge. While looking forward to battling Shawn Michaels in a Stretcher Match, Batista teams with a mystery partner to take Curt Hawkins & Zack Ryder. Plus, Shannon Moore is next in line to face Vladimir Kozlov in singles action, CM Punk goes one-on-one with John Morrison, and much more.

While La Familia looks to celebrate Edge becoming the new World Heavyweight Champion and effectively banishing The Undertaker from WWE, Batista targets The Rated-R Superstar for a shot at his gold. After becoming the No. 1 Contender for the ECW Championship, Big Show is confronted by Mark Henry. Plus, Chuck Palumbo faces Finlay in a Belfast Brawl.

When Batista meets with Edge to sign the contract for his World Heavyweight Championship opportunity at Night of Champions, SmackDown General Manager Vickie Guerrero adds an amendment that forces The Animal to earn his opportunity by battling The Great Khali in the main event. MVP finds himself going one-on-one with CM Punk and more.

After using The VIP Lounge to air his grievances with his current status, SmackDown General Manager Vickie Guerrero orders MVP to face ECW Champion Kane. When Referee Charles Robinson does his job too effectively, he is punished by having to face The Great Khali. World Heavyweight Champion Edge officiates a bout between Batista and Chavo Guerrero.

In the aftermath of the WWE Draft, Rey Mysterio bids farewell to the brand on his way to Raw and WWE Champion Triple H makes his triumphant return to SmackDown. Batista goes one-on-one with Umaga. Plus, ECW Champion Kane & Big Show take on MVP & Mark Henry, World Heavyweight Champion Edge faces United States Champion Matt Hardy, and more!

Turmoil erupts in the relationship between Edge and SmackDown General Manager Vickie Guerrero. WWE Champion Triple H joins The Highlight Reel. Matt Hardy defends the Untied States Championship against Mr. Kennedy, Shelton Benjamin, and Chavo Guerrero in a Fatal 4-Way Match. Plus, Umaga in action, Jeff Hardy faces John Morrison, and much more.

After calling off his wedding to SmackDown General Manager Vickie Guerrero, Edge is forced to take on Big Show in a No Disqualification Match. Chavo Guerrero's love for family earns him a match with WWE Champion Triple H. Finlay & Hornswoggle take on WWE Tag Team Champions The Miz & John Morrison. Plus, United States Champion Matt Hardy and more.

Edge and SmackDown General Manager Vickie Guerrero invite the WWE Universe to celebrate their wedding. However, the festivities are short lived after WWE Champion Triple H refuses to hold his peace. Matt Hardy defends the United States Championship against Jeff Hardy. Plus, Big Show is forced to compete in a 4-on-1 Handicap Match and more.

Despite his best attempts to apologize to his former bride-to-be, Edge learns the hard way that hell hath no fury like a woman scorned when SmackDown General Manager Vickie Guerrero turns the sound of their wedding bells to a more ominous tone. Plus, a Battle Royal to determine the No. 1 Contender for the WWE Championship. All this and much more.

With Edge officially set to face The Undertaker within the confines of Hell in a Cell at SummerSlam, The Rated-R Superstar looks to get some insight into the battle that awaits him by welcoming a special guest to The Cutting Edge. Jeff Hardy is faced with an enormous challenge of going one-on-one with The Great Khali. Plus, Mr. Kennedy in action.

On a night where each member of La Familia meets with a mysterious fate, SmackDown General Manager Vickie Guerrero looks to reform an alliance with Edge. WWE Champion Triple H tests his strength against The Great Khali in an Indian Broken Glass Arm Wrestling Match. Jeff Hardy goes one-on-one with United States Champion Shelton Benjamin.

SmackDown General Manager Vickie Guerrero finds herself at the mercy of Edge as he looks to make an offering to The Undertaker. Shelton Benjamin puts the United States Championship on the line against Jeff Hardy. Kenny Dykstra looks to make a statement at the expense of WWE Champion Triple H. Plus, Festus battles Vladimir Kozlov and much more.

With a chance to qualify for the Championship Scramble at Unforgiven at stake, several SmackDown Superstars compete for this golden opportunity. Despite her best efforts to make amends with The Undertaker, SmackDown General Manager Vickie Guerrero finds out the hard way that her fate is already sealed. WWE Champion Triple H makes a statement.

The Undertaker continues to haunt General Manager Vickie Guerrero's every step. The WWE Universe is set free by the in-ring debut of R-Truth. WWE Champion Triple H battles United States Champion Shelton Benjamin in the main event. Plus, Brie Bella makes her debut, Jeff Hardy goes one-on-one with MVP, and much more action.

Triple H battles The Great Khali in a Lumberjack Match. Vladimir Kozlov's demands for a better challenge are answered by Big Show. The Undertaker vows to take Vickie Guerrero's soul at Unforgiven. Brie Bella's unique abilities become suspect. Plus, R-Truth continues to impress the WWE Universe, Jeff Hardy battles The Brian Kendrick, and much more.

WWE Champion Triple H watches to see who will be named the new No. 1 Contender for his title following a Fatal 4-Way Match between Jeff Hardy, MVP, The Brian Kendrick, and Shelton Benjamin. With Big Show by her side, SmackDown General Manager Vickie Guerrero looks for an apology from The Undertaker. Plus, R-Truth in action and much more.

WWE Champion Triple H goes one-on-one with MVP. Vladimir Kozlov makes an emphatic statement. Jeff Hardy takes on The Brian Kendrick. Zack Ryder & Curt Hawkins make their presence felt when Carlito welcomes Primo to Carlito's Cabana. Plus, Maryse challenges Michelle McCool for the Divas Championship, R-Truth faces Shelton Benjamin, and more.

Despite having the security of her familia by her side, SmackDown General Manager Vickie Guerrero remains haunted by the threats of a vengeful Undertaker. Triple H & Jeff Hardy face MVP & The Brian Kendrick. Plus, Primo & Epico challenge Curt Hawkins & Zack Ryder for the WWE Tag Team Championship, Jimmy Wang Yang faces Chavo Guerrero, and more.

WWE Champion Triple H faces ECW Champion Matt Hardy and World Heavyweight Champion Chris Jericho in a Triple Threat Match. Big Show looks to put Vickie Guerrero's fears about The Undertaker to rest. Jeff Hardy partners with Rey Mysterio, Batista & Finlay to take on Kane, MVP, John "Bradshaw" Layfield & The Brian Kendrick. All this and more.

As a reward for his services in taking out The Undertaker, Big Show is given a WWE Championship against Triple H. R-Truth takes to the ring to go one-on-one with United States Champion Shelton Benjamin. Brie Bella's magical abilities prove useful in a battle with Natalya. Plus, an Eight-Man Tag Team Match, Jeff Hardy faces MVP, and much more.

Jeff Hardy looks to do what no one else has been able to do when he goes one-on-one with Vladimir Kozlov. In preparation for his upcoming battle with The Undertaker at Cyber Sunday, Big Show gives The Deadman a demonstration of exactly what he can do. Primo & Epico put the WWE Tag Team Championship on the line against Curt Hawkins & Zack Ryder.

WWE Champion Triple H faces The Undertaker. Jeff Hardy and Vladimir Kozlov make their intentions for the WWE Championship known. R-Truth partners with Kung Fu Naki to take on MVP & United States Champion Shelton Benjamin. Plus, Natalya in action, Super Crazy faces The Brian Kendrick, and much more.

The Undertaker takes on Chavo Guerrero in a Casket Match main event. Vladimir Kozlov demands an opportunity to challenge Triple H for the WWE Championship. Plus, The Hardy Boyz partner with Rey Mysterio to take on Kane, MVP & Mark Henry in a Six-Man Tag Team Match, Jimmy Wang Yang faces The Brian Kendrick, and much more.

Vladimir Kozlov looks to earn a WWE Championship opportunity against Triple H by taking on The Undertaker in the main event. When MVP addresses his recent string of bad luck on an all new edition of The VIP Lounge, The Great Khali interrupts to make a statement of his own. Shelton Benjamin defends the United States Championship against R-Truth.

Undertaker goes one-on-one with Jeff Hardy in an Extreme Rules Match. Vladimir Kozlov and WWE Champion Triple H meet face-to-face to sign the contract for their match at Survivor Series. Plus, Maria challenges Michelle McCool for the Divas Championship, ECW Champion Matt Hardy faces United States Champion Shelton Benjamin, and much more.

Before their upcoming Casket Match at Survivor Series, The Undertaker looks to administer Last Rites to Big Show. However, it may be those closest to The World's Largest Athlete who suffer the wrath of The Deadman. Jeff Hardy continues to prove his abilities as goes one-on-one with WWE Champion Triple H. Plus, ECW Champion Matt Hardy in action.

SmackDown General Manager Vickie Guerrero announces that Triple H, Jeff Hardy, and Vladimir Kozlov will compete in a series of Beat the Clock Matches to determine the new No. 1 Contender for the WWE Championship. The Miz & John Morrison take on Jesse & Festus. Divas Champion Michelle McCool & The Bella Twins face Natalya, Victoria & Maryse.

Triple H and Jeff Hardy are forced to try and put aside their differences when SmackDown General Manager Vickie Guerrero orders them to run the gauntlet together. In the main event, Big Show goes one-on-one with The Undertaker within the confines of a steel cage. WWE Champion Edge takes to the ring to go one-on-one with Kung Fu Naki and more.

When tensions between Triple H and Jeff Hardy explode, SmackDown General Manager Vickie Guerrero orders both men to resolve their differences in the main event. WWE Champion Edge invites ECW Champion Matt Hardy to join him on The Cutting Edge. Hurricane Helms goes one-on-one with United States Champion Shelton Benjamin in a Non-Title Match.

Jeff Hardy begins his reign as the newly-crowned WWE Champion by going one-on-one with Vladimir Kozlov in the main event. Edge faces ECW Champion Matt Hardy. Plus, John Morrison in action, Hurricane Helms & R-Truth take on MVP & Shelton Benjamin, and much more.

WWE Champion Jeff Hardy goes one-on-one with Big Show. Triple H looks to make Vladimir Kozlov pay the price for costing him his shot at the WWE Championship. Shelton Benjamin defends the United States Championship against Hurricane Helms. Maria serves as Special Guest Referee when Michelle McCool defends the Divas Championship against Maryse.
